analyzed: prabho śvi sūrya indu anila agni vedhasām jaleśa śakra ādiṣu ca adhikārān
translated: O lord, having occupied the positions of the Ashvins, the sun, the moon, the wind, the fire, the creator, the lord of the waters, Indra, and others,

original: ākramya nākāttu nirākṛtā vayaṃ kṛtāvanisthā mahiṣāsureṇa // / //
analyzed: ākramya nākāt tu nirākṛtāḥ vayam kṛta avani sthāḥ mahiṣa asureṇa
translated: We have been expelled from heaven by the demon Mahisha and made to dwell on earth.

original: etad bhavantau śaraṇāgatānāṃ śrutvā vaco brūta hitaṃ surāṇām /
analyzed: etat bhavantau śaraṇa āgatānām śrutvā vacaḥ brūta hitam surāṇām
translated: Having heard these words of the gods who have come for refuge, you two should speak what is beneficial for the gods.

original: na ced vrajāmo 'dya rasātalaṃ hi saṃkālyamānā yudhi dānavena // / //
analyzed: na ced vrajāmaḥ rasātalam hi saṃkālyamānāḥ yudhi dānavena
translated: If we do not go to Rasatala today, we will be destroyed in the battle by the demon.

original: itthaṃ murāriḥ saha śaṅkareṇa śrutvā vaco viplutacetasastān /
analyzed: ittham murāriḥ saha śaṅkareṇa śrutvā vacaḥ vipluta cetasaḥ tān
translated: Having heard these words of them with disturbed minds, the enemy of Mura (Krishna) along with Shankara,

original: dṛṣṭvātha cakre sahasaiva kopaṃ kālāgnikalpo hariravyayātmā // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā atha cakre sahasā eva kopam kālāgni kalpaḥ hariḥ avyaya ātmā
translated: and seeing them, Hari, of imperishable soul, resembling the fire of dissolution, suddenly became angry.

analyzed: tatas nu kopāt madhusūdanasya sa śaṅkarasya api pitāmahasya
translated: Then, due to the anger of Madhusudana (Krishna) and also of the grandfather (Brahma) along with Shankara,

original: tathaiva śakrādiṣu daivateṣu maharddhi tejo vadanād viniḥsutam // / //
analyzed: tathā eva śakra ādiṣu daivateṣu maharddhi tejaḥ vadanāt viniḥsutam
translated: great splendor and power issued forth from their mouths, and in the same way from the gods like Indra.

original: taccaikatāṃ parvatakūṭasannibhaṃ jagāma tejaḥ pravarāśram mune /
analyzed: tat ca eka tām parvata kūṭa sannibham jagāma tejaḥ pravara aśram mune
translated: And that splendor, resembling the peak of a mountain, became one, O sage, in the excellent abode.

original: kātyāyanasyāpratimasya tena maharṣiṇā teja upākṛtaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: kātyāyanasya apratimasya tena mahā ṛṣiṇā tejaḥ upākṛtam ca
translated: And the incomparable great sage Katyayana received that splendor.

analyzed: tena ārṣi sṛṣṭena ca tejasā vṛtam jvalat prakāśa arka sahasra tulyam
translated: Surrounded by that splendor created by the sage, it blazed with the brilliance of a thousand suns.

analyzed: tasmāt ca jātā tarala āyata akṣī kātyāyanī yoga viśuddha dehā
translated: And from that was born Katyayani, with restless long eyes, her body purified by yoga.

original: māheśvarād vaktramatho babhūva netratrayaṃ pāvakatejasā ca /
analyzed: māheśvarāt vaktram atho babhūva netra trayam pāvaka tejasā ca
translated: Then from Maheshvara (Shiva) was born a face, and three eyes from the splendor of Agni (fire),

original: yāmyena keśā haritejasā ca bhujāstathāṣṭādaśa saṃpjajñire // / //
analyzed: yāmyena keśāḥ hari tejasā ca bhujāḥ tathā aṣṭādaśa saṃpjajñire
translated: and from Yama (the god of death) the hair was born, and from the splendor of Hari (Vishnu) the eight arms were born.

original: saumyena yugmaṃ stanayoḥ susaṃhataṃ madhyaṃ tathaindreṇa ca tejasābhavat /
analyzed: saumyena yugmam stanayoḥ su saṃhatam madhyam tathā aindreṇa ca tejasā bhavat
translated: The pair of breasts became well-formed with the Soma pair, and the waist with the Indra pair of rays.

original: ūraba cajaṅghe ca nitambasaṃyute jāte jaleśasya tu tejasā hi // / //
analyzed: ca nitamba saṃyute jāte jaleśasya tu tejasā hi
translated: The thighs and calves, along with the buttocks, were produced by the energy of the lord of water.

analyzed: ca loka prapitāmahasya padma abhikośa pratimau babhūvatuḥ
translated: The feet of the grandfather of the world became like the whorl of a lotus.

analyzed: divākarāṇam api tejasā aṅgulīḥ kara aṅgulīḥ ca vasu tejasā eva
translated: The fingers of the sun and the fingers of the hands were made by the energy of the Vasus.

original: prajāpatīnāṃ daśanāśca tejasā yākṣeṇa nāsā śravaṇau ca mārutāt /
analyzed: prajāpatīnām daśanāḥ ca tejasā yākṣeṇa nāsā śravaṇau ca mārutāt
translated: The teeth of the Prajapatis were by the energy of the Yakshas, the nose by the Maruts, and the ears by the Maruts.

original: sādhyena ca bhrayugalaṃ sukāntimat kandarpabāṇāsanasannibhaṃ babhau // / //🔽tarthārṣitejottamamuttamaṃ mahannāmnā pṛthivyāmabhavat prasiddham /
analyzed: sādhyena ca bhra yugalam su kāntimat kandarpa bāṇāsana sannibham babhau  tartha ārṣi tejaḥ uttamam uttamam mahat nāmnā pṛthivyām abhavat prasiddham
translated: The pair of eyebrows, very beautiful, shone like the bow of Cupid, by the energy of the Sadhyas.🔽Then, that excellent and great energy, the best of all, became famous on earth by the name of Arshita.

original: kātyāyanītyeva tadā babhau sā nāmnā ca tenaiva jagatprasiddhā // / //🔽dadau triśūlaṃ varadastriśūlī cakraṃ murārirvaruṇaśca śaṅkham /
analyzed: kātyāyanī iti eva tadā babhau sā nāmnā ca tena eva jagat prasiddhā  dadau triśūlam vara daḥ triśūlī cakram murāriḥ varuṇaḥ ca śaṅkham
translated: She then shone as Katyayani, and became famous in the world by that very name.🔽The trident-holder, the giver of boons, gave a trident, Vishnu a discus, Varuna a conch,

original: śaktiṃ hutāśaḥ śvasanaśca cāpaṃ tūṇau tathākṣyyaśarau vivasvān // / //
analyzed: śaktim hutāśaḥ śvasanaḥ ca cāpam tūṇau tathā akṣyya śarau vivasvān
translated: Agni a spear, Vayu a bow, and Vivasvan a quiver, a case, and arrows.

original: vajraṃ tathendraḥ saha ghaṇṭayā ca yamo 'tha daṇḍaṃ dhanado gadāṃ ca /
analyzed: vajram tathā indraḥ saha ghaṇṭayā ca daṇḍam dhanadaḥ gadām ca
translated: Indra gave a thunderbolt and a bell, Yama a staff, Kubera a mace,

original: brahma'kṣamālāṃ sakamaṇḍaluṃ ca kālo 'simugraṃ saha carmaṇā ca // / //🔽hāraṃ ca somaḥ saha cāmareṇa mālaṃ samudro himavān mṛgendram /
analyzed: brahma kṣamālām sa kamaṇḍalum ca simugram saha carmaṇā ca  hāram ca somaḥ saha cāmareṇa mālam samudraḥ himavān mṛgendram
translated: Brahma a rosary and a water pot, and Kala a fierce sword and shield.🔽The moon gave a necklace and a yak-tail fan, the ocean a garland, and the Himalayas a lion.

analyzed: cūḍāmaṇim kuṇḍalam arddhacandram prādāt kuṭhāram vasu śilpa karttā
translated: The artisan Vasu gave a crest-jewel, earrings, a half-moon, and an axe.

original: gandharvarājo rajatānuliptaṃ pānasya pūrṇaṃ sadṛśaṃ ca bhājanam /
analyzed: gandharva rājaḥ rajata anuliptam pānasya pūrṇam sadṛśam ca bhājanam
translated: The king of the Gandharvas gave a silver-smeared vessel filled with drink,

analyzed: bhujaṅga hāram srajam ca
translated: and the lord of the serpents a necklace of serpents and the seasons a garland of fresh flowers.

analyzed: tadā ati tuṣṭā sura sttamānām aṭṭāṭṭahāsam mumuce trinetrā
translated: Then the three-eyed goddess, greatly pleased with the gods, let out a loud laugh.

analyzed: tām tuṣṭuvuḥ deva varāḥ saha indrāḥ sa viṣṇu rudra indu anila agni bhāskarāḥ
translated: The best of gods with Indra, Vishnu, Rudra, Indra, Vayu, Agni, and Surya praised her.

original: namo 'stu daivyai surapūjitāyai yā saṃsthitā yogaviśuddhadehā /
analyzed: namaḥ stu daivyai sura pūjitāyai yā saṃsthitā yoga viśuddha dehā
translated: Salutations to the divine one worshipped by the gods, who abides with a body purified by yoga,

original: nidrāsvarūpeṇa mahīṃ vitatya tṛṣṇā trapā kṣud bhayadātha kāntiḥ // / //
analyzed: nidrā sva rūpeṇa mahīm vitatya tṛṣṇā trapā kṣudh bhaya dā atha kāntiḥ
translated: in the form of sleep, spreading over the earth, as greed, shame, hunger, fear, and beauty.

original: śraddhā smṛtiḥ puṣṭiratho kṣamā ca chāyā ca śaktiḥ kamalālayā ca /
analyzed: śraddhā smṛtiḥ puṣṭiḥ atho kṣamā ca chāyā ca śaktiḥ kamalālayā ca
translated: Faith, memory, nourishment, forgiveness, shadow, power, the abode of the lotus,

original: vṛttirdayā bhrānti ratheha māyā namo 'stu daivyai bhavarūpikāyai // / //
analyzed: vṛttiḥ dayā bhrānti rathā iha māyā namaḥ stu daivyai bhava rūpikāyai
translated: conduct, compassion, delusion, and here Maya - salutations to the divine one who is the stage of worldly existence.

analyzed: tatas stutāḥ deva varaiḥ mṛgendram āruhya devī pragatā avanīdhram
translated: Then, praised by the best of gods, the Goddess mounted the lion and went to the mountain,

original: vindhyaṃ mahāparvatamuccaśṛṅgaṃ cakāra yaṃ nimnataraṃ tvagastyaḥ // / //
analyzed: vindhyam mahā parvatam uccaśṛṅgam cakāra yam nimnataram tu agastyaḥ
translated: the great mountain Vindhya with its lofty peaks, which Agastya made much lower.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

analyzed: kirmatham adrim bhagavān agastyaḥ tam nimna śṛṅgam kṛtavān mahā ṛṣiḥ
translated: Why did the great sage Agastya make that mountain, the abode of demons, with its peaks lowered?

original: kasmai kṛte kena ca kāraṇena etad vadasvāmalasattvavṛtte // / //
analyzed: kasmai kṛte kena ca kāraṇena etat vadasva amala sattva vṛtte
translated: For whose sake and for what reason? Tell this, O you of pure and virtuous conduct.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: purā hi vindhyena divākarasya gatirniruddhā gaganecarasya /
analyzed: purā hi vindhyena divākarasya gatiḥ niruddhā gaganecarasya
translated: Formerly, Vindhya obstructed the path of the sun, the wanderer in the sky.

original: ravistataḥ kumabhabhavaṃ sametya homāvasāne vacanaṃ babhāṣe // / //
analyzed: raviḥ tatas kumabha bhavam sametya homa avasāne vacanam babhāṣe
translated: Then the sun, having met the pot-born one, spoke these words at the end of the oblation.

original: samāgato 'haṃ dvija dūratastvāṃ kuruṣva māmuddharaṇaṃ munīndra /
analyzed: samāgataḥ ham dvija dūratas tvām kuruṣva mām uddharaṇam muni indra
translated: I have come a long way, O Brahmin. O lord of sages, please lift me up.

original: dadasva dānaṃ mama yanmanīṣinaṃ carāmi yena tridiveṣu nirvṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: dadasva dānam mama yat manīṣinam carāmi yena tridiveṣu nirvṛtaḥ
translated: Give me the gift that I desire, by which I can wander in the three worlds with a contented mind.

original: itthaṃ divākaravaco guṇasaṃprayogi śrutvā tadā kalaśajo vacanaṃ babhāṣe /
analyzed: ittham divākara vacaḥ guṇa saṃprayogi śrutvā tadā kalaśajaḥ vacanam babhāṣe
translated: Having heard these words of the sun, which were full of good qualities, the Pot-born One then spoke these words:

original: dānaṃ dadāmi tava yanmanasastvabhīṣṭaṃ nārthi prayāti vimukho mama kaścideva // / //
analyzed: dānam dadāmi tava yat manasaḥ tu abhīṣṭam na arthi prayāti vimukhaḥ mama kaścid eva
translated: I shall give you whatever is desired by your mind. No one who seeks will leave disappointed from me.

original: śrutvā vaco 'mṛtamayaṃ kalaśodbhavasya prāha prabhuḥ karatale vinidhāya mūrdhni /
analyzed: śrutvā vacaḥ mṛta mayam kalaśodbhavasya prāha prabhuḥ kara tale vinidhāya mūrdhni
translated: Having heard the nectar-like words of the Pot-born One, the Lord said, placing his head in his hands:

original: eṣo 'dya me girivaraḥ praruṇāddhi mārgaṃ vindhyasya nimnakaraṇe bhagavan yatasva // / //
analyzed: eṣaḥ dya me giri varaḥ praruṇāt hi mārgam vindhyasya nimnakaraṇe bhagavan yatasva
translated: Today, let this best of mountains, Vindhya, open the way for me. O Lord, strive to make Vindhya low.

original: iti ravivacanādathāha kumbhajanmā kutamiti viddhi mayā hi nīcaśṛṅgam /
analyzed: iti ravi vacanāt atha āha kumbhajanmā kutam iti viddhi mayā hi nīca śṛṅgam
translated: Thus, the Pot-born One said, Know that I will make the peak of Vindhya low.

original: tava kiraṇajito bhaviṣyate mahīdhro mama caraṇasamśritasya kā vyathā te // / //
analyzed: tava kiraṇajitaḥ bhaviṣyate mahīdhraḥ mama caraṇa samśritasya kā vyathā te
translated: For you, the conqueror of the rays, this mountain will become low, and what pain will you have, being dependent on my feet?

original: ityevamuktvā kalaśodbhāvastu sūryaṃ hi saṃstūya vinamya bhaktyā /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā kalaśodbhāvaḥ tu sūryam hi saṃstūya vinamya bhaktyā
translated: Having said this, the Pot-born One praised the sun and bowed to him with devotion.

original: jagāma saṃtyajya hi daṇḍakaṃ hi vindhyācalaṃ vṛddhvapurmaharṣiḥ // / //
analyzed: jagāma saṃtyajya hi daṇḍakam hi vindhya acalam vṛddhvapuḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ
translated: The great sage, having grown old, left Dandaka and went to Vindhya mountain.

original: gatvā vacaḥ prāha munirmahīdhraṃ yāsye mahātīrthavaraṃ supuṇyam /
analyzed: gatvā vacaḥ prāha muniḥ mahīdhram yāsye mahā tīrtha varam su puṇyam
translated: Having gone there, the sage spoke to the mountain: I will go to the great and most auspicious holy place.

original: vṛddhosmayaśaktaśca tavādhiroḍhuṃ tasmād bhavān nīcataro 'stu sadyaḥ // / //
analyzed: vṛddhaḥ usmaya śaktaḥ ca tava adhiroḍhum tasmāt bhavān nīcataraḥ stu sadyas
translated: I am old and weak, and cannot climb you. Therefore, be immediately lower.

analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ muni sttamena sa nīca śṛṅgaḥ tu abhavat mahīdhraḥ
translated: Thus addressed, that mountain became lower-peaked.

original: samākramaccāpi maharṣimukyaḥ prollaṅghya vindhyaṃ tvidamāha śailam // / //
analyzed: samākramat ca api mahā ṛṣi mukyaḥ prollaṅghya vindhyam tu idam āha śailam
translated: And the chief of great sages also crossed the Vindhya mountain and spoke to this mountain:

original: yāvanna bhūyo nijamāvrajāmi mahāśramaṃ dhautavapuḥ sutīrthāt /
analyzed: yāvat na bhūyas nijam āvrajāmi mahā āśramam dhauta vapuḥ su tīrthāt
translated: As long as I do not return to my great hermitage, my body purified by the excellent tirthas,

original: tvayā na tāvattviha vardhitavyaṃ no ced viśapsye 'hamavajñayā te // / //
analyzed: tvayā na tāvat tu iha vardhitavyam no ced viśapsye ham avajñayā te
translated: you should not grow any further here, otherwise I will curse you in contempt.

original: ityevamuktvā bhagavāñjagāma diśaṃ sa yāmyāṃ sahasāntarikṣam /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā bhagavān jagāma diśam sa yāmyām sahasā antarikṣam
translated: Having said this, the Blessed One went to the southern direction in the sky.

original: ākramya tasthau sa hi tāṃ tadāśāṃ kāle vrajāmyatra yadā munīndraḥ // / //
analyzed: ākramya tasthau sa hi tām tad āśām kāle vrajāmi atra yadā muni indraḥ
translated: Having crossed it, he stood on that side, thinking, When the time comes, I will go there, O lord of sages.

analyzed: tatra āśramam ramyataram hi kṛtvā saṃśuddha jāmbūnada toraṇa antam
translated: Having made a very beautiful hermitage there, with a gate of pure gold,

analyzed: tatra atha nikṣipya vidarbha putrīm svam āśramam saumyam upājagāma
translated: and having placed the daughter of Vidarbha there, he went to his own hermitage, O gentle one.

original: ṛtāvṛtau parvakāleṣu nityaṃ tammabare hyāśramamāvasat saḥ /
analyzed: ṛtau ṛtau parva kāleṣu nityam tammabare hi āśramam āvasat saḥ
translated: During the two fertile seasons and on the festival days, he always stayed in that hermitage,

original: śeṣaṃ ca kālaṃ sa hi daṇḍakasthas tapaścārāmitakāntimān muniḥ // / //
analyzed: śeṣam ca kālam sa hi daṇḍaka sthaḥ tapaḥ cāra amita kāntimān muniḥ
translated: And the remaining time, that sage of immeasurable splendor, residing in Dandaka, practiced austerities.

original: vinandhyo 'pi dṛṣṭvā gagane mahāśramaṃ vṛddhiṃ na yātyeva bhayānmaharṣeḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā gagane mahā āśramam vṛddhim na yāti eva bhayāt mahā ṛṣeḥ
translated: Vinadhya also, seeing the great hermitage in the sky, did not grow out of fear of the great sage.

original: nāsau nivṛtteti matiṃ vidhāya sa saṃsthito nīcatarāgraśṛṅgaḥ // / //
analyzed: na asau nivṛttā iti matim vidhāya sa saṃsthitaḥ nīcatara agra śṛṅgaḥ
translated: Deciding that he had not turned back, he remained with his lower peak bent down.

original: evaṃ tvagastyena mahācalendraḥ sa nīcaśṛṅge hi kṛto maharṣe /
analyzed: evam tu agastyena mahā acala indraḥ sa nīcaśṛṅge hi kṛtaḥ mahā ṛṣe
translated: Thus, by Agastya, that great king of mountains was made with its lower peak by the great sage.

original: tasyordhvaśṛṅge munisaṃstutā sā durgā sthitā dānavanāśanārtham // / //
analyzed: tasya ūrdhva śṛṅge muni saṃstutā sā durgā sthitā dānava nāśana artham
translated: On its upper peak, that Durga, praised by the sages, remained for the destruction of the demons.

original: devāśca siddhāśca mahoragāśca vidyādharā bhūtagaṇāśca sarve /
analyzed: devāḥ ca siddhāḥ ca mahoragāḥ ca vidyādharāḥ bhūta gaṇāḥ ca sarve
translated: The gods, the Siddhas, the great serpents, the Vidyadharas, and all the hordes of spirits,

analyzed: sarva apsarobhiḥ pratirāmayantaḥ kātyāyanīm tasthuḥ apeta śokāḥ
translated: Together with all the celestial nymphs, served Katyayani, free from sorrow.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe ekonaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the nineteenth chapter in the Vamana Purana—19.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: tatastu tāṃ tatra tadā vasantīṃ kātyāyanīṃ śailavarasya śṛṅge /
analyzed: tatas tu tām tatra tadā vasantīm kātyāyanīm śailavarasya śṛṅge
translated: Then, on that mountain peak, they saw Katyayani, the daughter of the king of mountains,

original: apaśyatāṃ dānavasattamau dvau caṇḍaś ca muṇḍaśca tapasvinīṃ tām // / //
analyzed: apaśyatām dānava sattamau dvau caṇḍaḥ ca muṇḍaḥ ca tapasvinīm tām
translated: The two best of demons, Chanda and Munda, saw the ascetic woman.

original: dṛṣṭvaiva śaulādavatīrya śīghramājagmatuḥ svabhavanaṃ surārī /🔽dṛṣṭvocatustau mahiṣāsurasya dūtāvidaṃ caṇḍamuṇḍau ditīśam // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā eva śaulāt avatīrya śīghram ājagmatuḥ sva bhavanam surārī  dṛṣṭvā ūcatuḥ tau mahiṣa asurasya dūtau idam caṇḍa muṇḍau ditīśam
translated: Seeing this, the enemies of the gods quickly descended from the mountain and went to their own abode.🔽Seeing them, Mahisha, the lord of demons, said to the messengers of Mahisha, O Chanda and Munda, what is this?

original: svastho bhavān kiṃ tvasurendra sāmpratamāgaccha paśyāma ca tatra vindhyam /
analyzed: svasthaḥ bhavān kim tu asura indra sāmpratam āgaccha paśyāma ca tatra vindhyam
translated: Are you well, O lord of demons? Come now, let us go there and see the Vindhya mountain.

original: tatrāsti devī sumahānubhāvā kanyā surūpā surasundarīṇām // / //🔽jitāstayā toyadharālakairhi jitaḥ śaśaṅko vadanena tanvyā /
analyzed: tatra asti devī su mahā anubhāvā kanyā surūpā sura sundarīṇām  jitāḥ tayā toyadhara alakaiḥ hi jitaḥ śaśaṅkaḥ vadanena tanvyā
translated: There is a very powerful goddess, a beautiful maiden, more beautiful than the celestial nymphs.🔽She has conquered the moon with her face, and the clouds with her eyebrows.

original: netraistribhistrīṇi hutāśanāni jitāni kaṇṭhena jitastu śaṅkhaḥ // / //
analyzed: netraiḥ tribhiḥ trīṇi hutāśanāni jitāni kaṇṭhena jitaḥ tu śaṅkhaḥ
translated: With her three eyes, she has conquered the three fires, and with her throat, she has conquered the conch.

original: stanau suvṛttāvatha magnacūcukau sthitau vijityeva gajasya kumbhau /

translated: And how did she slay the great asuras Shumbha and Nishumbha?

original: kasya cemau sutau vīrau khyātau śumbhaniśumbhakau /
analyzed: kasya ca imau sutau vīrau khyātau śumbha niśumbhakau
translated: Whose sons were those two heroes, known as Shumbha and Nishumbha?

analyzed: etat vistarataḥ sarvam yathāvat vaktum arhasi
translated: You should tell me all this in detail, exactly as it happened.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: etatte kathayiṣyāmi pārvatyāḥ saṃbhavaṃ mune /🔽śṛṇuṣvāvahito bhūtvā skandotpattiṃ ca śāśvatīm // / //
analyzed: etat te kathayiṣyāmi pārvatyāḥ saṃbhavam mune  śṛṇuṣva avahitaḥ bhūtvā skanda utpattim ca śāśvatīm
translated: I will tell you this, O sage, about the birth of Parvati.🔽Listen attentively to the eternal birth of Skanda.

analyzed: rudraḥ satyām praṇaṣṭāyām brahmacāri vrate stitaḥ
translated: When Sati died, Rudra remained in the vow of celibacy.

analyzed: nirāśraya tvam āpannaḥ tapaḥ taptum vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Having become helpless, he settled down to perform austerities.

analyzed: sa ca āsīt deva senā nīḥ daitya darpha vināśanaḥ
translated: And he became the general of the gods, the destroyer of the pride of the demons.

analyzed: tatas nirākṛtāḥ devāḥ senā nāthena śaṃbhunā
translated: Then the gods, rejected by the commander-in-chief Shambhu,

analyzed: dānava indreṇa vikramya mahiṣeṇa parājitāḥ
translated: were defeated by the powerful king of demons, Mahisha.

analyzed: tatas jagmuḥ mureśānam draṣṭum cakra gadā dharam
translated: Then they went to see the lord of gods, the wielder of the discus and mace,

analyzed: śvetdavīpe mahāhaṃsam prapannāḥ śaraṇam harim
translated: and sought refuge in Hari, the great swan in the White Island.

original: tānāgatān surān dṛṣṭvā tataḥ śakrapurogamān /🔽vihasya meghagambhīraṃ provāca puruṣottamaḥ // / //
analyzed: tān āgatān surān dṛṣṭvā tatas śakra purogamān  vihasya megha gambhīram provāca puruṣottamaḥ
translated: Seeing the gods come, headed by Shakra,🔽the best of men, Purushottama, spoke with a voice deep like the clouds.

analyzed: kim jitāḥ tu asura indreṇa mahiṣeṇa durātmanā
translated: Have you been defeated by the evil-minded king of demons, Mahisha?

analyzed: yena sarve sametya evam mama pārśvam upāgatāḥ
translated: By whom, having assembled together, you have come to my side in this way?

original: tad yuṣmākaṃ hitārthāya yad vadāmi surottamāḥ /
analyzed: tat yuṣmākam hita arthāya yat vadāmi sura uttamāḥ
translated: Therefore, O best of gods, for your welfare, I tell you what I say.

original: tatkurudhvaṃ jayo yena samāśritya bhaveddhi vaḥ // / //
analyzed: tat kurudhvam jayaḥ yena samāśritya bhavet hi vaḥ
translated: By resorting to that, victory may be yours.

analyzed: ye ete pitaraḥ divyāḥ tu agniṣvātta iti viśrutāḥ
translated: These are the divine ancestors known as Agni-shvas.

original: amīṣāṃ mānasī kanyā menā nāmnāsti devatāḥ // / //
analyzed: amīṣām mānasī kanyā menā nāmnā asti devatāḥ
translated: O gods, they have a mental daughter named Mena.

analyzed: tām ārādhya mahā ātithyām śraddhayā parayā amarāḥ
translated: O gods, having propitiated her with great faith on the day of Maha-tithi,

analyzed: prārthayadhvam satīm menām prāleyādreḥ iha arthataḥ
translated: you should request Satya-Mena, the daughter of the Himalayas, for your sake.

analyzed: tasyām sā rūpa saṃyuktā bhaviṣyati tapasvinī
translated: In her will be born that ascetic endowed with beauty.

analyzed: dakṣa kopāt yayā muktam malavat jīvitam priyam
translated: By whom, out of anger towards Daksha, the dear life was abandoned like a piece of filth...

original: sā śaṅkarāt svatejoṃ'śaṃ janayiṣyati yaṃ sutam /
analyzed: sā śaṅkarāt sva tejaḥ oṃśam janayiṣyati yam sutam
translated: She will give birth to a son who will be a part of Shankara's own energy.

analyzed: sa haniṣyati daitya indram mahiṣam sa padānugam
translated: He will kill the demon king Mahishasura along with his followers...

original: tasmād gacchata puṇyaṃ tat kurukṣetraṃ mahāphalam /
analyzed: tasmāt gacchata puṇyam tat kurukṣetram mahā phalam
translated: Therefore, go to that holy Kurukshetra, which is of great fruit.

analyzed: tatra pṛthūdake tīrthe pūjyantām pitaraḥ vyayaḥ
translated: There, at the tirtha of Prithudaka, let the imperishable ancestors be worshipped...

analyzed: mahātithyām mahā puṇye yadi śatru parābhavam
translated: On the day of Maha-tithi, if you wish to defeat the enemy,

analyzed: jihāsata ātmanaḥ sarve ittham vai kriyatām iti
translated: all of you should do this...

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: iti uktvā vāsudevena devāḥ śakra purogamāḥ
translated: Having said this, the gods with Indra at their head,

analyzed: kṛta añjali puṭāḥ bhūtvā papracchuḥ para mūvaram
translated: with folded hands, asked the Supreme Lord...

analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: ko 'yaṃ kurukṣetra iti yatra puṇyaṃ pṛthūdakam /
analyzed: kaḥ yam kurukṣetre iti yatra puṇyam pṛthūdakam
translated: What is this place called Kurukshetra, where the holy Prithudaka is?

original: udbhavaṃ tasya tīrthasya bhagavān prabravītu naḥ // / //
analyzed: udbhavam tasya tīrthasya bhagavān prabravītu naḥ
translated: May the Lord tell us the origin of that tirtha...

analyzed: kā iyam proktā mahā puṇyā tithīnām uttamā tithiḥ
translated: What is this said to be the most auspicious and best of days?

original: yasyāṃ hi pitaro divyāḥ pūjyāsmābhiḥ prayantataḥ // / //
analyzed: yasyām hi pitaraḥ divyāḥ pūjyāḥ asmābhiḥ
translated: In which the divine ancestors are to be worshipped by us in the end.

analyzed: tatas surāṇām vacanāt murāriḥ kaiṭabha ardanaḥ
translated: Then, at the words of the gods, Murari, the slayer of Kaitabha,

analyzed: kurukṣetra udbhavam puṇyam proktavān tām tithīm api
translated: Spoke of the holy Kurukshetra and also of that lunar day.

analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

analyzed: soma vaṃśa udbhavaḥ rājā ṛkṣaḥ nāma mahā balaḥ
translated: There was a king of great strength born in the lunar dynasty, named Riksha.

analyzed: kṛsi ādau samabhavat ṛkṣāt saṃvaraṇaḥ vat
translated: From Riksha was born Samvarana at the beginning of Krita Yuga.

original: sa ca pitrā nije rājye bāla evābhiṣecitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca pitrā nije rājye bālaḥ evā abhiṣecitaḥ
translated: And he was consecrated by his father in his own kingdom even in his childhood.

analyzed: bālye dharma nirataḥ mad bhaktaḥ ca sadā abhavat
translated: Even in his childhood, he was devoted to dharma and was always a devotee of mine.

analyzed: purohitaḥ tu tasya āsīt vasiṣṭhaḥ varuṇa ātmajaḥ
translated: His priest was Vasishtha, the son of Varuna.

analyzed: sa ca asya adhyāpayāmāsa sa aṅgān vedān udāra dhīḥ
translated: And he, of lofty intellect, taught him the Vedas with their auxiliaries.

analyzed: tatas jagāma ca araṇyam tu anadhyāye nṛpa ātmajaḥ
translated: Then, on an unexplainable day, the prince went to the forest,

analyzed: sarva karmasu nikṣipya vasiṣṭham tapasām nidhim
translated: Entrusting all his duties to Vasishtha, the treasure of austerities.

analyzed: tatas mṛgayā vyākṣepāt ekākī vijanam vanam
translated: Then, due to the distraction of hunting, alone in the desolate forest,

analyzed: vaibhrājam sa jagāma atha atha unmādanam abhyayāt
translated: He went to Vaibhrāja and then to Unmadana.

analyzed: tatas tu kautuka āviṣṭaḥ vane
translated: Then, filled with curiosity, in a forest full of flowers everywhere,

analyzed: a vitṛpataḥ sugandhasya samantāt vyacarat vanam
translated: And wandered all around in the forest, not satisfied with the sweet fragrance.

analyzed: sa vanantam ca dadṛśe phulla kokanada āvṛtam
translated: He saw a forest covered with blooming red and blue lotuses,

analyzed: kahlāra padma kumudaiḥ kamala indīvaraiḥ api  tatra krīḍanti satatam apsaraḥ mara kanyakāḥ
translated: And also with white lotuses, blue lotuses, and lilies.🔽There, the celestial nymphs and daughters of the gods always play.

original: tāsāṃ madhye dadarśātha kanyāṃ saṃvaraṇo 'dhikām // / //🔽darśanādeva sa nṛpaḥ kāmamārgaṇapīḍitaḥ /
analyzed: tāsām madhye dadarśa atha kanyām saṃvaraṇaḥ dhikām  darśanāt eva sa nṛpaḥ kāma mārgaṇa pīḍitaḥ
translated: In their midst, Samvarana saw a maiden superior to them all.🔽As soon as the king saw her, he was afflicted by the arrows of Kama.

analyzed: jātaḥ sā ca tam īkṣya eva kāma bāṇa āturā abhavat
translated: And she, seeing him, became afflicted by the arrows of Kama.

original: ubhau tau pīḍitau mohaṃ jagmatuḥ kāmamārgaṇaiḥ /
analyzed: ubhau tau pīḍitau moham jagmatuḥ kāma mārgaṇaiḥ
translated: Both of them, afflicted by the arrows of Kama, fell into a swoon.

analyzed: rājā cala āsanaḥ bhūmyām nipapāta turaṅgamāt
translated: The king fell down on the ground from his horse.

original: tamabhyetya mahātmāno gandharvāḥ kāmarūpiṇaḥ /🔽siṣicurvāriṇābhyetya labdhasaṃjño 'bhavat kṣaṇāt // / //
analyzed: tam abhyetya mahātmānaḥ gandharvāḥ kāmarūpiṇaḥ  siṣicuḥ vāriṇā abhyetya labdha saṃjñaḥ bhavat kṣaṇāt
translated: Then the great Gandharvas, who can assume any form at will,🔽approached him and sprinkled him with water. In a moment, he regained consciousness.

analyzed: sā ca apsarobhiḥ utpātya nītā pitṛ kulam nijam
translated: And she was carried away by the celestial nymphs to her own father's house.

analyzed: tābhiḥ āśvāsitā ca api madhuraiḥ vacana ambubhiḥ
translated: And she was comforted by them with sweet words of water.

analyzed: sa ca api a ruhya turagam pratiṣṭhānam pura uttamam
translated: And he, mounting his horse, set out for the excellent city of Pratiṣṭhāna.

analyzed: gataḥ tu meru śikharam kāma cārī yathā amaraḥ
translated: And went to the peak of Meru, moving about as he pleased, like an immortal.

original: yadāprabhṛti sā dṛṣṭā ārkṣiṇā tapatī girau /
analyzed: yadā prabhṛti sā dṛṣṭā ārkṣiṇā tapatī girau
translated: From the time she was seen by the son of Raghu on the mountain,

original: tadāprabhṛti nāśnāti divā svapiti no niśi // / //
analyzed: tadā prabhṛti na aśnāti divā svapiti no niśi
translated: from that time he did not eat during the day, nor sleep at night.

analyzed: tatas sarva vid avyagraḥ viditvā varuṇa ātmajaḥ
translated: Then, knowing everything, the son of Varuna, the great ascetic,

analyzed: tapatītāpitam vīram pārthivam tapasām nidhiḥ
translated: the treasure of austerities, saw the king tormented by Tapati.

original: samutpatya mahāyogī gaganaṃ ravimaṇḍalam /🔽viveśa devaṃ tigmāṃśu dadarśa syandane sthitam // / //🔽taṃ dṛṣṭvā bhāskaraṃ devaṃ praṇamad dvijasattamaḥ /
analyzed: samutpatya mahā yogī gaganam ravi maṇḍalam  viveśa devam tigmāṃśu dadarśa syandane sthitam  tam dṛṣṭvā bhāskaram devam praṇamat dvijasattamaḥ
translated: The great yogi rose up into the sky to the solar orb,🔽and saw the god of blazing rays standing on his chariot.🔽Seeing the god Surya, the best of Brahmins bowed down.

analyzed: pratipraṇamitaḥ ca asau bhāskareṇa āviśat rathe
translated: And he was greeted by Surya and entered his chariot.

analyzed: jvalat jaṭā kalāpaḥ sau divākara samīpa gaḥ
translated: With his blazing matted locks, he approached the sun,

original: śobhate vāruṇiḥ śrīmān dvitīya iva bhāskaraḥ // / //
analyzed: śobhate vāruṇiḥ śrīmān dvitīyaḥ iva bhāskaraḥ
translated: the glorious son of Varuna shines like a second sun.

analyzed: tatas saṃpūjita ūrghārbhāskareṇa tapodhanaḥ
translated: Then the ascetic, worshipped with the offering of arghya by Surya,

analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ ca āgamane hetum pratyuvāca divākaram
translated: was asked about the reason for his visit and replied to Surya.

analyzed: samāyātaḥ smi deveśa yācitum tvām mahā dyute
translated: I have come, O lord of gods, to ask you, O greatly radiant one, for a boon.

analyzed: sutām saṃvaraṇasya arthe tasya tvam dātum arhasi
translated: You should give her in marriage to Samvarana.

original: tato vasiṣṭhāya divākareṇa niveditā sā tapatī tanūjā /
analyzed: tatas vasiṣṭhāya divākareṇa niveditā sā tapatī tanūjā
translated: Then, O gods, the daughter Tapati was presented by Divakar to Vasishtha,

analyzed: gṛhāgatāya dvija puṅgavāya rājñaḥ ūrthataḥ saṃvaraṇasya devāḥ
translated: to the foremost of Brahmanas who had come to the house for the sake of king Samvarana.

analyzed: sāvitrim ādāya tatas vasiṣṭhaḥ svam āśramam puṇyam upājagāma
translated: Then Vasishtha, taking Savitri, went to his own sacred hermitage.

original: sā cāpi saṃsmṛtya nṛpātmajaṃ taṃ kṛtāñjalirvāruṇimāha devī // / //
analyzed: sā ca api saṃsmṛtya nṛpa ātmajam tam kṛtāñjaliḥ vāruṇim āha devī
translated: And that goddess, the princess, remembering that prince, spoke to Varuna's son with folded hands.

original: tapatyuvāca /🔽brahman mayā khedamupetya yo hi sahāpsarobhiḥ paricārikābhiḥ /
analyzed: tapatī uvāca  brahman mayā khedam upetya yaḥ hi saha apsarobhiḥ paricārikābhiḥ
translated: Tapati said:

original: dṛṣṭo hyaraṇye 'maragarbhatulyo nṛpātmajo lakṣaṇato 'bhijāne // / //🔽pādau śubhau cakragadāsicihnau jaṅghe tathorū karihastatulyau /🔽kaṭistathā siṃhakaṭiryathaiva kṣāmaṃ ca madhyaṃ tribalīnibaddham // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ hi araṇye mara garbha tulyaḥ nṛpa ātmajaḥ lakṣaṇataḥ bhijāne  pādau śubhau cakra gadā asi cihnau jaṅghe tathā ūrū kari hasta tulyau  kaṭiḥ tathā siṃha kaṭiḥ yathā eva kṣāmam ca madhyam tri balī nibaddham
translated: O Brahmana, I saw him in the forest, accompanied by celestial nymphs and female attendants, resembling the son of an immortal, and recognized the prince by his marks.🔽His feet are auspicious, marked with a wheel, a mace, and a sword; his shanks and thighs are like the trunk of an elephant;🔽his waist is like that of a lion; his slender waist is girdled by three folds;

original: grīvāsya śaṅkhākṛtimādadhāti bhujau ca pīnau kaṭhanausudīrghau /
analyzed: grīvā asya śaṅkha ākṛtim ādadhāti bhujau ca pīnau
translated: his neck and face have the shape of a conch; his arms are plump, hard, and very long;

original: hastau tathā padmadalodbhavāṅkau chatrākṛtistasya śiro vibhāti // / //
analyzed: hastau tathā padma dala udbhava aṅkau chatra ākṛtiḥ tasya śiraḥ vibhāti
translated: His hands are marked with lotus petals, and his head shines like a parasol.

original: nīlāśca keśāḥ kuṭilāśca tasya karṇau samāṃsau susamā ca nāsā /
analyzed: nīlāḥ ca keśāḥ kuṭilāḥ ca tasya karṇau sa māṃsau su samā ca nāsā
translated: His hair is dark and curly, his ears are fleshy and even, and his nose is well-shaped.

original: dīrghāśca tasyāṅgulayaḥ suparvāḥ padbhyāṃ karābhyāṃ daśanāśca subhrāḥ // / //
analyzed: dīrghāḥ ca tasya aṅgulayaḥ su parvāḥ padbhyām karābhyām daśanāḥ ca su bhrāḥ
translated: His fingers are long and well-jointed, and his teeth and nails are bright.

analyzed: samunnataḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ udāra vīryaḥ tribhiḥ gabhīraḥ tripu ca pralambaḥ
translated: He is tall and has six broad shoulders, three deep navel, and three long arms.

analyzed: raktaḥ tathā pañcasu rāja putraḥ kṛṣṇaḥ caturbhiḥ tribhiḥ ānataḥ
translated: The prince is red in five places, black in four, and bent in three.

original: dvābhyāṃ ca śuklaḥ surābhiścaturbhiḥ dṛśyanti padmāni daśaiva cāsya /
analyzed: dvābhyām ca śuklaḥ surābhiḥ caturbhiḥ dṛśyanti padmāni daśa eva ca asya
translated: He is white in two places, and his ten lotuses are seen in four places.

original: vṛtaḥ sa bhartā bhagavān hi pūrvaṃ taṃ rājaputraṃ bhuvi saṃvicintya // / //🔽dadasva māṃ nātha tapasvine 'smai guṇopapannāya samīhitāya /
analyzed: vṛtaḥ sa bhartā bhagavān hi pūrvam tam rāja putram bhuvi saṃvicintya  dadasva mām nātha tapasvine smai guṇa upapannāya samīhitāya
translated: The lord, the husband, surrounded by the gods, having thought about that prince on earth,🔽Give me, O lord, to this ascetic who is endowed with virtues and is desired by me.

original: nehānyakāmāṃ pravadanti santo dātuṃ tathānyasya vibho kṣamasva // / //
analyzed: na iha anya kāmām pravadanti santaḥ dātum tathā anyasya vibho kṣamasva
translated: The virtuous ones do not speak of any other desire here. O lord, be pleased to give me to him.

analyzed: devadevaḥ uvāca
translated: The god of gods said:

original: ityevamuktaḥ savituśca putryā ṛṣistadā dhyānaparo babhūva /
analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ savituḥ ca putryāḥ ṛṣiḥ tadā dhyāna paraḥ babhūva
translated: Thus addressed by the daughter of Savita, the rishi then became absorbed in meditation.

original: jñātvā ca tatrārkasutāṃ sakāmāṃ mudā yuto vākyamidaṃ jagāda // / //
analyzed: jñātvā ca tatra arkasutām sa kāmām mudā yutaḥ vākyam idam jagāda
translated: And knowing that the daughter of Surya was in love with him, he was filled with joy and spoke these words:

original: sa eva putri nṛpatestanūjo dṛṣṭaḥ purā kāmayase yamadya /
analyzed: saḥ eva putri nṛpateḥ tanūjaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ purā kāmayase yam adya
translated: O daughter, is it he, the son of the king, whom you saw before and love now?

original: sa eva cāyāti mamāśramaṃ vai ṛkṣātmajaḥ saṃvaraṇo hi nāmnā // / //
analyzed: saḥ eva ca āyāti mama āśramam vai ṛkṣa ātmajaḥ saṃvaraṇaḥ hi nāmnā
translated: And it is he who is coming to my hermitage, the son of the bear, named Samvarana.

analyzed: atha ājagāma sa nṛpasya putraḥ tam āśramam brāhmaṇapuṅkavasya
translated: Then the son of the king came to that hermitage of the best of Brahmanas.

original: dṛṣṭvā vasiṣṭhaṃ praṇipatya mūrdhnā sthitastvapaśyat tapatīṃ narendraḥ // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā vasiṣṭham praṇipatya mūrdhnā sthitaḥ tu apaśyat tapatīm narendraḥ
translated: Seeing Vasishtha, the lord of men bowed his head and stood, not seeing Tapati.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca tāṃ padmaviśālanetrāṃ tāṃ pūrvadṛṣṭāmiti cintayitvā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca tām padma viśāla netrām tām pūrva dṛṣṭām iti cintayitvā
translated: Seeing her with eyes wide as lotuses, he thought, I have seen her before.

original: papraccha keyaṃ lalanā dvijendra sa vāruṇiḥ prāha narādhipendram // / //
analyzed: papraccha kā iyam lalanā dvijendra sa vāruṇiḥ prāha narādhipa indram
translated: And he asked, Who is this maiden, O best of Brahmanas? Varuna's son replied to the lord of kings:

original: iyaṃ vivasvadduhitā narendra nāmnā prasiddhā tapatī pṛthivyām /
analyzed: iyam vivasvat duhitā narendra nāmnā prasiddhā tapatī pṛthivyām
translated: O lord of men, this is the daughter of Vivasvat, known on earth by the name of Tapati.

analyzed: mayā tava arthāya divākaraḥ rthitaḥ prādāt mayā tu āśramam ānininye
translated: For your sake I requested the Sun, and he gave her to me. I brought her to the hermitage.

original: tasmāt masuttiṣcha narendra devyāḥ pāṇiṃ tapatyā vidhivad gṛhāṇa /
analyzed: tasmāt narendra devyāḥ pāṇim tapatyāḥ vidhivat gṛhāṇa
translated: Therefore, O lord of men, take the hand of the queen Tapati in accordance with the rites.

original: ityevamukto nṛpatiḥ prahṛṣṭo jagrāha pāṇiṃ vidhivat tapatyāḥ // / //
analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ nṛpatiḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ jagrāha pāṇim vidhivat tapatyāḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the king, delighted, duly took Tapati's hand.

original: sā taṃ patiṃ prāpya mano 'bhirāmaṃ sūryāmajā śakrasamāprabhāvam /
analyzed: sā tam patim prāpya manaḥ abhirāmam sūryām ajā śakra samā prabhāvam
translated: That slender maiden, having obtained that husband, dear to the mind, equal to Surya and Indra in prowess,

original: rarāma tanvī bhavanottameṣu yatā mahaindraṃ divi daityakanyā // / //
analyzed: rarāma tanvī bhavana uttameṣu yatā mahā aindram divi daitya kanyā
translated: delighted in excellent palaces, just as the daughter of the demon (Pulastya's son) delights in the great Indra's abode in heaven.

analyzed: devadevaḥ uvāca
translated: The God of gods said:

original: tasyāṃ tapatyāṃ narasattamena jātaḥ sutaḥ pārthivalakṣaṇastu /
analyzed: tasyām tapatyām nara sattamena jātaḥ sutaḥ pārthiva lakṣaṇaḥ tu
translated: On that Tapati, by that best of men, was born a son, endowed with the marks of a king.

original: sa jātakarmādibhireva saṃskṛto vivarddhatājyena huto yathāgniḥ // / //
analyzed: sa jātakarma ādibhiḥ eva saṃskṛtaḥ vivarddhata ājyena hutaḥ yathā agniḥ
translated: He was duly consecrated with the birth rites, and grew like a fire fed with clarified butter.

analyzed: kṛtaḥ sya cūḍākaraṇaḥ ca devāḥ mitrāvaruṇa ātmajena
translated: His naming ceremony was performed by the son of Mitra and Varuna (Vishvamitra).

original: navābdikasya vratabandhanaṃ ca vede ca śāstre vidhipārago 'būt // / //
analyzed: nava ābdikasya vrata bandhanam ca vede ca śāstre vidhi pāragaḥ
translated: At the age of nine, he was invested with the sacred thread, and became proficient in the Vedas and scriptures.

analyzed: tatas catur paḍbhiḥ api iha varṣaiḥ sarvajña tām abhyagamata
translated: Then, in four and ten years, he attained omniscience.

original: khyātaḥ pṛthivyāṃ puruṣottamo 'sau nāmnā kuruḥ saṃvaraṇasya putraḥ // / //
analyzed: khyātaḥ pṛthivyām puruṣa uttamaḥ sau nāmnā kuruḥ saṃvaraṇasya putraḥ
translated: He became famous on earth as Kuru, the son of Samvarana, the best of men.

analyzed: tatas narapatiḥ dṛṣṭvā dharmikam tanayam śubham
translated: Then the king, seeing his auspicious son devoted to dharma,

analyzed: dārakriyā artham akarot yatnam śubha kule tatas
translated: He then made efforts to marry her in an auspicious family.

analyzed: sodāminīm sudāmnaḥ tu sutām rūpa adhikām napaḥ
translated: The king obtained the daughter of Sudaman, named Sudamini, who was superior in beauty.

original: kurorarthāya vatavān sa prādāt kurave 'pi tām // / //
analyzed: kuroḥ arthāya sa prādāt kurave pi tām

analyzed: sa tām nṛpa sutām labdhvā dharma arthau avirodhayan
translated: Having obtained that princess, he did not contradict Dharma and Artha.

analyzed: reme tanvyā saha tayā paulomyā maghavān iva  tatas narapatiḥ putram rājya bhāra kṣamam balī
translated: He enjoyed with that slender-bodied one, like Maghavan with Paulomi.🔽Then the powerful king, knowing that his son was capable of bearing the burden of the kingdom,

analyzed: viditvā yovarājyāya vidhānena abhyaṣecayat  tatas rājye bhiṣiktaḥ tu kuruḥ pitrā nije pade
translated: consecrated him as the prince in accordance with the injunctions.🔽Then Kuru, consecrated by his father in his own kingdom,

original: pālayāmāsa sa mahīṃ putravacca svayaṃ prajāḥ // / //
analyzed: pālayāmāsa sa mahīm putra vat ca svayam prajāḥ
translated: ruled the earth and the subjects like his own sons.

analyzed: saḥ eva kṣetrapālaḥ bhūt paśupālaḥ saḥ eva hi
translated: He alone became the protector of the fields, the protector of the cattle,

analyzed: sa sarva pālakaḥ ca āsīt prajāpālaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: he was the protector of all, the protector of the subjects, the greatly powerful one.

analyzed: tatas sya buddhiḥ upannā kīrtiḥ loke garīyasī
translated: Then he had this thought: Fame is the greatest in the world.

original: yāvatkīrtiḥ susaṃsthā hi tāvadvāsaḥ suraiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: yāvat kīrtiḥ su saṃsthā hi tāvat vāsaḥ suraiḥ saha
translated: As long as fame is well-established, one dwells with the gods.

analyzed: sa tu evam nṛpati śreṣṭhaḥ yāthātathyam avekṣya ca
translated: That best of kings, having considered the truth,

analyzed: vicacāra mahīm sarvām kīrti artham tu narādhipaḥ
translated: And roamed the entire earth, that king, for the sake of fame.

analyzed: tatas dvaitavanam nāma puṇyam loka īśvaraḥ balī

analyzed: tatra devīm dadarśa atha puṇyām pāpa vimocanīm
translated: There he saw the sacred goddess, the liberator from sin,

analyzed: plakṣajām brahmaṇaḥ putrīm hari jihvām sarasvatīm

translated: The mother of Sudarshana, having performed extensive austerities,

analyzed: tasyāḥ tat jalam īkṣya eva snātvā prītaḥ bhavat nṛpaḥ

analyzed: samājagāma ca punar brahmaṇaḥ vedim uttarām
translated: And he again came to the northern altar of Brahma,

analyzed: samantapañcakam nāma dharma sthānam anuttamam

analyzed: ākamantāt yojanāni pañca ca sarvatas

analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

analyzed: yena uttara tayā vediḥ gāditā sarva pañcakā

analyzed: devadevaḥ uvāca
translated: The Lord of gods said:

translated: There are five altars of the Lord of the world, the bridge of Dharma,

analyzed: virajāḥ dakṣiṇā vediḥ ananta phala dāyinī

analyzed: pratīcī puṣkarā vediḥ tribhiḥ kuṇḍaiḥ alaṅkṛtā
translated: The western altar Pushkara, adorned with three pits.

analyzed: samantapañcakā ca uktā vediḥ evā uttarā avyayā
translated: And the northern altar Samantapanchaka is said to be imperishable.

analyzed: tam amanyata rājarṣiḥ idam kṣetram mahā phalam

analyzed: kariṣyāmi kṛṣiṣyāmi sarvān kāmān yathā īpsitān
translated: I will do, I will cultivate, all desires as desired.

translated: Having made a golden plow, the lord took the Rudra bull.

analyzed: pauṇḍrakam yāmya mahiṣam svayam karṣitum udyataḥ
translated: The Pundrakam, the southern buffalo, he was ready to plow himself.

analyzed: tam karṣantam nara varam samabhyetya takratuḥ

analyzed: tam karṣantam nara varam samabhyetya śatakratuḥ
translated: To that best of men who was plowing, Shatakratu, the performer of a hundred sacrifices, approached.

analyzed: provāca rājan kim idam bhavān kartum iha udyataḥ
translated: and said, O king, what are you attempting to do here?

analyzed: rājā abravīt suravaram tapaḥ satyam kṣamām dayām

analyzed: labdhaḥ u ṣṭa aṅgā iti sahasā avahasya gataḥ tatas

analyzed: gate pi śakra rājarṣiḥ ahani ahani sīradhṛk
translated: Even when Shakra had left, the royal sage, the holder of the plough, day after day,

analyzed: yāvat etat mayā kṛṣṭam dharma kṣetram tat astu ca

analyzed: upavāsam ca dānam ca snānam japyam ca mādhava
translated: O Madhava, fasting, giving, bathing, muttering,

translated: and other auspicious or inauspicious things like oblations and sacrifices, O lord,

translated: by your grace, O Hrishikesha, holder of the conch, discus and mace,

analyzed: akṣayam pravare kṣetre bhavatu atra mahā phalam
translated: may they be imperishable and have great fruit in this excellent field.

analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ tena aham rājñā bāḍham uvāca tam

analyzed: tathā ca tvam divya vapuḥ bhava bhūyas mahīpate

analyzed: tathā antakāle mām eva layaṭam eṣyasi suvrata

analyzed: kīrtiḥ ca śāśvatī tubhyam bhaviṣyati na saṃśayaḥ

analyzed: tatra eva yājakāḥ yajñān yajiṣyanti sahasraśas
translated: And there itself, thousands of priests will perform sacrifices.

analyzed: tasya kṣetrasya rakṣā artham dadau sa puruṣottamaḥ
translated: For the protection of that holy place, that Supreme Being

analyzed: vidyādharam śaṅkukarṇam sukeśim rākṣaseśvaram
translated: The Vidyadhara Shankukarna, the lord of the Rakshasas Sukesha,

analyzed: etāni sarvatas bhyetya rakṣanti kurujāṅgalam

analyzed: amīṣām balinaḥ nye ca bhṛtyāḥ ca eva anuyāyinaḥ

analyzed: tasya eva madhye bahu puṇyaḥ uktaḥ pṛthūdakaḥ pāpa haraḥ śivaḥ ca

translated: The sacred river, flowing eastwards, where the auspicious current is rich with good fortune.

translated: The Lord of gods said:

analyzed: tiṣṭhanti sā tithiḥ puṇyā tu akṣayā parigīyate  tam gacchadhvam sura śreṣṭhāḥ yatra prācī sarasvatī

analyzed: pitṝn ārādhayadhvam hi tatra śrāddhena bhakti tatas

translated: Then, having heard the words of Murari (Vishnu), the gods along with Indra,

analyzed: tatra snātvā surāḥ sarve bṛhaspatim acodayan
translated: Having bathed there, all the gods urged Brihaspati, saying,

analyzed: puṇyām tithim pāpa harām tava kālaḥ yam āgataḥ

analyzed: pravartate raviḥ tatra candramāḥ api viśati asau

analyzed: tvad āyattam guro kāryam surāṇām tat kuruṣva ca

analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ devaiḥ tu devācāryaḥ bravīt idam

analyzed: tatas prītāḥ tu pitaraḥ tām prāhuḥ tanayām nijāma  menām devāḥ ca śailāya hima yuktāya vai daduḥ

analyzed: tām menām himavān labdhvā prasādāt daivateṣu atha
translated: Having obtained Menaka through the grace of the gods, Himavat,

translated: When he, the leader of the demon army, was slain, those demons wailed even more pitifully.

original: hā tāta ha bhrātariti bruvantaḥ kta yāsi tiṣṭhasva muhūrttamehi // / //
analyzed: hā tāta ha bhrātar iti bruvantaḥ kta yāsi tiṣṭhasva muhūrttam ehi
translated: Saying Alas, father! Alas, brother! they cried out, Where are you going? Stay for a moment! Come back!

analyzed: tathā apare vilulita keśapāśāḥ viśīrṇa varma ābharaṇāḥ digambarāḥ
translated: And others, with their hair disheveled, their armor and ornaments torn, naked,

analyzed: nipātitāḥ dharaṇi tale mṛḍānyā pradudruvuḥ giri varam uhya daityāḥ
translated: thrown down on the ground by Mṛḍānī, the demons fled to the best of mountains.

original: viśīrṇavarmāyudhabhūṣaṇaṃ tat balaṃ nirīkṣyaiva hi dānavendraḥ /
analyzed: viśīrṇa varma āyudha bhūṣaṇam tat balam nirīkṣya eva hi dānava indraḥ
translated: Seeing that army, with its armor, weapons, and ornaments shattered, the lord of the demons,

analyzed: viśīrma cakra akṣa rathaḥ niśumbhaḥ krodhāt mṛḍānīm samupājagāma
translated: Niśumbha, with his chariot's wheels and axles shattered, approached Mṛḍānī out of anger.

original: khaḍgaṃ samādāya ca carma bhāsvaraṃ dhunvan śiraḥ prekṣya ca rūpamasyāḥ /
analyzed: khaḍgam samādāya ca carma bhāsvaram dhunvan śiraḥ prekṣya ca rūpam asyāḥ
translated: Taking up his sword and shining shield, and shaking his head, beholding her beauty,

analyzed: saṃstambha moha jvara pīḍite citre yathā asau likhitaḥ babhūva
translated: He stood as if painted in a picture, afflicted with the fever of stupefaction and delusion.

original: taṃ stambhitaṃ vīkṣya surāmagre provāca devī vacanaṃ vihasya /
analyzed: tam stambhitam vīkṣya surām agre provāca devī vacanam vihasya
translated: Seeing him thus paralysed, the goddess, smiling, spoke these words in his presence:

original: anena vīryeṇa surāstvayā jitā anena māṃ prārthayase balena // / //
analyzed: anena vīryeṇa surāḥ tvayā jitāḥ anena mām prārthayase balena
translated: By this prowess of yours, the gods have been conquered by you. By this power, you solicit me.

original: śrutvā tu vākyaṃ kauśikyā dānavaḥ sucirādiva /
analyzed: śrutvā tu vākyam kauśikyāḥ dānavaḥ su cirāt iva
translated: Hearing the words of Kausika, the Danava, as if after a long time,

original: provāca cintayitvātha vacanaṃ vadatāṃ varaḥ // / //🔽sukumārarīro 'thaṃ macchastrapatanādapi /
analyzed: provāca cintayitvā atha vacanam vadatām varaḥ  mad śastra patanāt api
translated: Spoke, having reflected, the best of speakers:

analyzed: śatadhā yāsyate bhīru āma pātram iva ambhasi
translated: Your body is delicate, O timid one, it will be shattered into a hundred pieces by the fall of my weapon,🔽Like an unbaked vessel in water.

original: etad vicintayannartha tvāṃ praharttu na sundari /
analyzed: etat vicintayan artha tvām praharttu na sundari
translated: Thinking of this, O fair one, I do not strike you.

original: karomi buddhi tasmāt tvaṃ māṃ bhajasvāyatekṣaṇe // / //
analyzed: karomi tasmāt tvam mām bhajasva āyata īkṣaṇe
translated: Therefore, O large-eyed one, be devoted to me.

original: mama khaṅganipātaṃ hi nendro dhārayituṃ kṣamaḥ /
analyzed: mama khaṅga nipātam hi nā indraḥ dhārayitum kṣamaḥ
translated: Indra himself is not able to bear the fall of my sword.

original: nivarttaya matiṃ yuddhād bhāryā me bhava sāmpratam // / //
analyzed: nivarttaya matim yuddhāt bhāryā me bhava sāmpratam
translated: Turn your mind from battle, be my wife now.

analyzed: ittham niśumbha vacanam śrutvā yogi īśvarī mune
translated: O sage, having heard these words of Nisumbha, the Goddess of Yogins,

original: vihasya bhāvagambhīraṃ niśumbhaṃ vākyamabravīt // / //🔽nājitāhaṃ raṇe vīra bhave bhāryā hi kasyacit /
analyzed: vihasya bhāvagambhīram niśumbham vākyam abravīt  na ajitā aham raṇe vīra bhave bhāryā hi kasyacid
translated: smiling deeply, spoke these words to Nisumbha.🔽O hero, I have not been conquered in battle, and I can be the wife of anyone.

original: bhavān yadiha bhāryārtho tato māṃ jaya saṃyuge // / //
analyzed: bhavān yat iha tatas mām jaya saṃyuge
translated: If you are here for a wife, then conquer me in battle.

analyzed: iti evam ukte vacane khaṅgam udyamya dānavaḥ
translated: When these words were spoken, the demon raised his sword

original: pracikṣepa tadā vegāt kauśikīṃ prati nārada // / //
analyzed: pracikṣepa tadā vegāt kauśikīm prati nārada
translated: and hurled it with force towards Kaushiki, O Narada.

analyzed: tam āpatantam nistriṃśam ṣaḍbhiḥ barhiṇa rājitaiḥ
translated: As that sword descended, she cut it off with six arrows adorned with peacock feathers,

analyzed: ciccheda carmaṇā sārddha tat adbhutam iva abhavat
translated: along with the shield. It was as if a miracle had occurred.

original: khaḍge sacarmaṇi chinne gadāṃ gṛhya mahāsuraḥ /
analyzed: khaḍge sa carmaṇi chinne gadām gṛhya mahā asuraḥ
translated: When the sword and shield were cut off, the great demon,

original: samādravat kośabhavāṃ vāyuvegasamo jave // / //🔽tasyāpatata evāśu karau śliṣṭau samau dṛḍhau /
analyzed: samādravat kośabhavām vāyu vega samaḥ jave  tasya apatata eva āśu karau śliṣṭau samau dṛḍhau
translated: taking up a club, rushed towards the Goddess, with the speed of the wind.🔽Even as he was quickly descending, with his two arms firmly joined,

analyzed: gadayā saha ciccheda kṣurepreṇa raṇe mbikā
translated: Ambika cut them off along with the club in the battle with a razor-sharp arrow.

analyzed: tasmin apatite raudre sura śatrau bhayaṅkare
translated: When that terrible and fearful enemy of the gods fell,

analyzed: caṇḍa adya mātaraḥ hṛṣṭāḥ cakruḥ kilakilā dhvanim
translated: the delighted Mothers led by Chandika made a loud noise.

analyzed: gagana sthāḥ tatas devāḥ śatakratu purogamāḥ
translated: Then the gods stationed in the sky, with Indra at their head,

analyzed: jayasva vijaya iti ūcuḥ hṛṣṭāḥ śatrau nipātite
translated: joyfully said Be victorious! and Be victorious! when the enemy was overthrown.

analyzed: tatas tūryāṇi avādyanta bhūta saṃghaiḥ samantataḥ
translated: Then musical instruments were played by the hosts of spirits all around,

original: puṣpavṛṣṭiṃ ca mumucuḥ surāḥ kātyāyanīṃ prati // / //
analyzed: puṣpa vṛṣṭim ca mumucuḥ surāḥ kātyāyanīm prati
translated: and the gods showered flowers upon Katyayani.

analyzed: niśumbham patitam dṛṣṭvā śumbhaḥ krodhāt mahā mune
translated: Seeing Nisumbha fallen, Shumbha, out of anger, O great sage,

analyzed: vṛndārakam samāruhya pāśa pāṇiḥ samabhyagāt
translated: mounted Vridaraka and, with a noose in his hand, came forward.

analyzed: tam āpatantam dṛṣṭvā atha sa gajam dānava īśvaram
translated: Seeing that lord of the demons, along with his elephant, coming,

original: jagrā ha caturo vāṇāṃścandrārdhākaravarcasaḥ // / //🔽kṣuraprābhyāṃ samaṃ pādau dvau ciccheda dvipasya sā /🔽dvābhyāṃ kumbhe jaghānātha hasantī līlayāmbikā // / //
analyzed: jagrā ha caturaḥ vāṇān candra ardha ākara varcasaḥ  kṣuraprābhyām samam pādau dvau ciccheda dvipasya sā  dvābhyām kumbhe jaghāna atha hasantī līlayā ambikā
translated: she took four arrows, shining like the crescent moon,🔽and with two razor-sharp arrows, she cut off the two feet of the elephant,🔽and with two, she playfully struck the temples, laughing.

analyzed: nikṛttābhyām gajaḥ padmyām nipapāta tathā icchayā
translated: The elephant, as if willing, fell down on its knees,

analyzed: śakra vajra samākrāntam śailarāja śiraḥ yathā
translated: as if struck by Indra's thunderbolt on the head of the king of mountains.

analyzed: tasya āvarjita nāgasya śumbhasya api utpatiṣyataḥ
translated: Even as Shumbha, with his elephant restrained, was about to rise up,

analyzed: śiraḥ ciccheda bāṇena kuṇḍala alaṅkṛtam śivā
translated: Shiva cut off his head adorned with earrings with an arrow.

analyzed: chinne śirasi daitya indraḥ nipapāta sa kuñjaraḥ
translated: When the head was cut off, the lord of demons fell down along with the elephant,

analyzed: yathā sa mahiṣaḥ kroñcaḥ mahāsena samāhataḥ
translated: just as Krouncha, along with the buffalo, fell down when struck by the great army.

original: śrutvā surāḥ suraripu nihatau mṛḍānyā sendrāḥ sasūryamarudaśvivasupradhānāḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā surāḥ sura ripu nihatau sa indrāḥ sa sūrya marut aśvi vasu pradhānāḥ
translated: Hearing that the enemies of the gods were killed by Mridani, the gods, along with Indra, Surya, Marut, Ashvins, and the Vasus,

original: āgatya taṃ girivaraṃ vinayāvanamrā devyāstadā stutipadaṃ tvidamīrayantaḥ // / //
analyzed: āgatya tam giri varam vinaya avanamrāḥ devyāḥ tadā stuti padam tu idam īrayantaḥ
translated: came to that excellent mountain, humbly bowing down, and uttered these words of praise to the Goddess.

analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: namo 'stu te bhagavati pāpanāśini namo 'stu te suraripudarpaśātani /
analyzed: namaḥ stu te bhagavati pāpa nāśini namaḥ stu te sura ripu darpa śātani
translated: Salutations to you, O Goddess, the destroyer of sins! Salutations to you, the crusher of the pride of enemies of the gods!

original: namo 'stu te harihararājyadāyini namo 'stu te makhabhujakāryakāriṇi // / //🔽namo 'stu te tridaśaripukṣayaṅkari namo 'stu te śatamakhapādapūjite /
analyzed: namaḥ stu te hari hara rājya dāyini namaḥ stu te makha bhuja kārya kāriṇi  namaḥ stu te tridaśa ripu kṣayaṅkari namaḥ stu te śatamakha pāda pūjite
translated: Salutations to you, the bestower of kingdoms to Hari, Hara, and others! Salutations to you, the performer of the duties of those who partake of the sacrificial offerings!🔽Salutations to you, the destroyer of the enemies of the gods! Salutations to you, who are worshipped by the feet of Indra and others!

original: namo 'stu te mahiṣavināsakāriṇi namo 'stu te hariharabhāskarastute // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu te mahiṣa vināsa kāriṇi namaḥ stu te hari hara bhāskara stute
translated: Salutations to you, the destroyer of Mahiṣa! Salutations to you, who are praised by Hari, Hara, and the Sun!

analyzed: namaḥ stu te ṣṭādaśa bāhu śālini namaḥ stu te śumbha niśumbha ghātini
translated: Salutations to you, the possessor of eighteen arms! Salutations to you, the slayer of Śumbha and Niśumbha!

original: namo 'stu lokārttihare triśūlini namo 'stu nārāyaṇi cakradhāriṇi // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu loka ārtti hare triśūlini namaḥ stu nārāyaṇi cakra dhāriṇi
translated: Salutations to you, the trident-wielding remover of the distress of the world! Salutations to you, O Nārāyaṇi, the wielder of the discus!

original: namo 'stu vārāhi sadā dharādhare tvāṃ nārasiṃhi praṇatā namo 'suta te /
analyzed: namaḥ stu vārāhi sadā dharādhare tvām nārasiṃhi praṇatā namaḥ suta te
translated: Salutations to you, O Varahi, the supporter of the earth, I bow to you, O Narasimhi, salutations to you.

analyzed: namaḥ stu nārasiṃhi praṇatā namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O Narasimhi, I bow to you, salutations to you.

original: namo 'stu te vajradhare gajadhvaje namo 'suta kaumāri mayūravāhini // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu te vajradhare gajadhvaje namaḥ suta kaumāri mayūra vāhini
translated: Salutations to you, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O Gajadhvaja, salutations to you, O Kaumari, O rider of the peacock.

analyzed: namaḥ stu paitāmaha haṃsa vāhane namaḥ stu mālā vikaṭe su keśini
translated: Salutations to you, O rider of the grandfather's swan, salutations to you, O Malavikata, O Sukeśini.

analyzed: namaḥ tu mālā vikaṭe su keśini
translated: Salutations to you, O Malavikata, O Sukeśini.

original: namo 'stu te rāsabhapṛṣṭhavāhini namo 'stu sarvārttihare jaganmaye // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu te rāsabha pṛṣṭha vāhini namaḥ stu sarva ārtti hare jagat maye
translated: Salutations to you, O rider of the donkey's back, salutations to you, O remover of all afflictions, O essence of the universe.

original: namo 'stu viśveśvari pāhi viśvaṃ niṣūdayārīn dvijadevatānām /
analyzed: namaḥ stu viśveśvari pāhi viśvam niṣūdaya arīn dvijadevatānām
translated: Salutations to you, O Goddess of the universe, protect the universe, destroy the enemies of the twice-born and the deities.

original: namo 'stu te sarvamayi trinetre namo namaste varade prasīda // / //
analyzed: namaḥ stu te sarva mayi trinetre namaḥ namaḥ te vara de prasīda
translated: Salutations to you, O all-pervading one, O three-eyed one, salutations again and again to you, O bestower of boons, be pleased.

original: brahmāṇī tvaṃ mṛḍānī varaśikhigamanā śaktihastā kumārī vārāhī tvaṃ suvaktrā khagapatigamanā vaiṣṇavī tvaṃ saśārṅgo /
analyzed: brahmāṇī tvam mṛḍānī vara śikhi gamanā śakti hastā kumārī vārāhī tvam su vaktrā khaga pati gamanā vaiṣṇavī tvam
translated: You are Brahmani, Mridani, riding the excellent peacock, with a spear in hand, you are Kumari. You are Varahi, with an excellent face, riding the lord of birds, you are Vaishnavi, with a bow.

original: durdṛśyā nārasiṃhī ghuraghuritaravā tvaṃ tathaindrī savajrā tvaṃ mārī carmamuṇḍāśavagamanaratā yoginī yogasiddhā // / //
analyzed: durdṛśyā nārasiṃhī tvam tathā aindrī sa vajrā tvam mārī carma muṇḍa āśava gamana ratā yoginī yoga siddhā
translated: You are Narasimhi, difficult to behold, with the sound of ghur ghur, and you are Indrani with the thunderbolt, and you are the yogini Marichi, engaged in moving with the corpse of a severed head, and you are the accomplished yogini.

original: namaste trinetre bhagavati tavacaraṇānuṣitā ye aharaharvinataśiraso 'vanatāḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ te trinetre bhagavati tava caraṇa anuṣitāḥ ye ahar ahar vinata śirasaḥ vanatāḥ
translated: Salutations to you, O three-eyed one, O blessed one, those who constantly attend at your feet, with their heads bowed down day after day,

original: nahi nahi paribhavamastyaśubhaṃ ca stutibalikusumakarāḥ satataṃ ye // / //
analyzed: nahi nahi paribhavam asti aśubham ca stuti bali kusuma karāḥ satatam ye
translated: they have no humiliation or misfortune, they always have praise, offerings, flowers and hands.

original: evaṃ stutā suravaraiḥ suraśatrunāśinī prāha prahasya surasiddhamaharṣivaryān /
analyzed: evam stutā sura varaiḥ sura śatru nāśinī prāha prahasya sura siddha mahā ṛṣi varyān
translated: Thus praised by the best of the gods, the destroyer of the enemies of the gods, she laughed and said to the best of the gods, siddhas and great sages:

original: prāpto mayād bhutatamo bhavatāṃ prasādāt saṃgrāmamūrdhvi suraśatrujayaḥ pramardāt // / //
analyzed: prāptaḥ mayāt bhutatamaḥ bhavatām prasādāt saṃgrāmam ūrdhvi sura śatru jayaḥ pramardāt
translated: By your grace, I have attained the highest bliss, and by crushing the enemies of the gods in the forefront of battle, I have won victory.

analyzed: imām stutim bhakti parāḥ nara uttamāḥ bhavadbhiḥ uktām anukīrttayanti
translated: The best of men, devoted to this praise sung by you, will recite it.

original: duḥsvapnanāśo bhavitā na saṃśayo varastathānyo vriyatāmabhīpsitaḥ // / //
analyzed: duḥsvapna nāśaḥ bhavitā na saṃśayaḥ varaḥ tathā anyaḥ vriyatām abhīpsitaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that bad dreams will be destroyed, and let another boon be chosen as desired.

analyzed: devāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The gods said:

original: yadi varadā bhavatī tridaśānāṃ dvijaśiśugoṣu yatasva hitāya /
analyzed: yadi vara dā bhavatī tridaśānām dvija śiśu goṣu yatasva hitāya
translated: If you are the granter of boons to the thirty gods, then strive for the welfare of the young brahmins and cows.

analyzed: punar api deva ripūn aparān tvam pradaha hutāśana tulya śarīre
translated: Again, you will burn the enemies of the gods, with a body similar to the sacrificial fire.

analyzed: devī uvāca
translated: The Goddess said:

analyzed: bhūyas bhaviṣyāmi asṛj ukṣita ānanā hara ānana sveda jala udbhavā surāḥ
translated: I will be born again with a face covered in blood, the gods born from the sweat of Shiva's face,

original: andhāsurasyāpratipoṣaṇe ratā nāmnā prasiddhā bhuvaneṣu carcikā // / //
analyzed: andha asurasya a pratipoṣaṇe ratā nāmnā prasiddhā bhuvaneṣu carcikā
translated: Delighting in the non-nourishment of the demon Andhaka, famous in the worlds by the name Charcika.

original: bhūyo vadhiṣyāmi surārimuttamaṃ saṃbhūya nandasya gṛhe yaśodayā /
analyzed: bhūyas vadhiṣyāmi surārim uttamam saṃbhūya nandasya gṛhe yaśodayā
translated: Again, I will kill the excellent enemy of the gods, being born in the house of Nanda with Yashoda,

original: taṃ vipracittiṃ lavaṇaṃ tathāparau śumbhaṃ niśumbhaṃ daśanaprahārimī // / //🔽bhūyaḥ surāstiṣyayuge nirāśinī nirīkṣya mārī ca gṛhe śatakratoḥ /
analyzed: tam vipracittim lavaṇam tathā aparau śumbham niśumbham daśana prahārimī  bhūyas surāḥ tiṣya yuge nirāśinī nirīkṣya mārī ca gṛhe śatakratoḥ
translated: And the other two, Viprachitti, Lavana, Shumbha and Nishumbha, who strike with their teeth.🔽Again, O gods, in the Tishya Yuga, I will be born as a daughter of Shatakratu, the king of the gods, in the house of Mara, without hope and without desire,

original: saṃbhūya devyāmitasatyadhāmayā surā bhariṣyāmi ca śākambharī vai // / //🔽bhūyo vipakṣakṣapaṇāya devā vindhye bhaviṣyamyṛṣirakṣaṇārtham /
analyzed: saṃbhūya devyā amita satya dhāmayā surā bhariṣyāmi ca śākambharī vai  bhūyas vipakṣa kṣapaṇāya devāḥ vindhye bhaviṣyami ṛṣi rakṣaṇa artham
translated: And I will nourish the gods, O gods, as Shakambhari, the goddess of infinite truth.🔽Again, O gods, for the destruction of the enemies and for the protection of the sages, I will be born as a sage in the Vindhya mountains,

original: durvṛttaceṣṭān vinihatya daityān bhūyaḥ sameṣyāmi surālayaṃ hi // / //
analyzed: durvṛtta ceṣṭān vinihatya daityān bhūyas sameṣyāmi surālayam hi
translated: And having killed the demons of evil conduct, I will return to the abode of the gods.

original: yadāruṇākṣo bhavitā mahāsuraḥ tadā bhaviṣyāmi hitāya devātāḥ /
analyzed: yadā aruṇākṣaḥ bhavitā mahā asuraḥ tadā bhaviṣyāmi hitāya devātāḥ
translated: When the great demon Aruna-aksha will be born, then, O gods, I will be born for the welfare of the gods.

analyzed: mahā ali rūpeṇa vinaṣṭa jīvitam kṛtvā punar triviṣṭapam
translated: Having destroyed the life of Mahali in the form of a great serpent, I shall again return to heaven.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: ityevamuktvā varadā surāṇāṃ kṛtvā praṇāmaṃ divajapuṅgavānām /
analyzed: iti evam uktvā vara dā surāṇām kṛtvā praṇāmam divaja puṅgavānām
translated: Having said this, the boon-giver of the gods, having bowed to the best of the gods,

original: visṛjya bhūtāni jagāma devī khaṃ siddhasaṃghairanugamyamānā // / //
analyzed: visṛjya bhūtāni jagāma devī kham siddha saṃghaiḥ anugamyamānā
translated: and having dismissed the beings, the goddess went to the sky, followed by the assembly of Siddhas.

original: idaṃ purāṇaṃ paramaṃ pavitraṃ devyā jayaṃ maṅgaladāyi puṃsām /
analyzed: idam purāṇam paramam pavitram devyāḥ jayam maṅgala dāyi puṃsām
translated: This Purana is supreme and pure, the victory of the Goddess, which brings auspiciousness to men.

analyzed: śrotavyam etat niyataiḥ sadā eva rakṣaḥ ghnam etat bhagavān uvāca
translated: This should always be heard by the disciplined, for the Lord has said that it destroys demons.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe triṃśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirtieth chapter in the Vamana Purana.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

original: kathaṃ samahiṣaḥ kroñco bhinnaḥ skandena suvrata /
analyzed: katham sa mahiṣaḥ kroñcaḥ bhinnaḥ skandena suvrata
translated: O one of good vows, how was the buffalo-demon Krouncha pierced by Skanda?

analyzed: etat me vistarāt brahman kathayasva amita dyute
translated: O Brahman, tell me this in detail, O you of immeasurable splendor.

analyzed: pulasatyaḥ uvāca
