analyzed: pañca bāhu śatena api su cakra akṣam babandha saḥ
translated: And with five hundred arms, he bound the well-wheeled-eyed one.

original: balavānapi bāṇena niṣprayatnagatiḥ kṛtaḥ // / //🔽sucakrākṣaṃ sacakraṃ hi baddhaṃ bāṇāsureṇa hi /
analyzed: balavān api bāṇena niṣprayatna gatiḥ kṛtaḥ  su cakra akṣam sa cakram hi baddham bāṇāsureṇa hi
translated: Though powerful, he was made to move with little effort by the arrow.🔽The great demon Bana bound the well-wheeled-eyed one with the discus.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā adravat gadā pāṇiḥ makara akṣaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Seeing this, the greatly powerful Makaraka, with a mace in his hand, ran.

original: gadayā mūrdhni bāṇaṃ hi nijaghāna mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: gadayā mūrdhni bāṇam hi nijaghāna mahā balaḥ
translated: The greatly powerful one struck Bana on the head with the mace.

analyzed: vedanā ārttaḥ mumoca atha sucakrākṣam mahā asuraḥ
translated: The great demon, afflicted with pain, released the well-wheeled-eyed one.

original: sa cāpi tena saṃyukto vrīḍāyukto mahāmanāḥ // / //
analyzed: sa ca api tena saṃyuktaḥ vrīḍā yuktaḥ mahā manāḥ
translated: And he, the great-minded one, joined with him, was filled with shame.

analyzed: sa saṃgrāmam parityajya sāligrāmam upāyayau
translated: Abandoning the battle, he went to the village of Sali.

analyzed: bāṇaḥ pi makārākṣeṇa tāḍitaḥ bhūt parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: Bana, too, struck by Makaraka, became averse.

analyzed: prabhajyata balam sarvam daityānām sura tāpasa
translated: The entire army of the demons was shattered, O divine ascetic.

analyzed: tatas sva balam īkṣya eva prabhagnam tārakaḥ balī
translated: Then the powerful Taraka, seeing his own army shattered,

analyzed: khaḍga udyata karaḥ daityaḥ pradudrāva gaṇeśvarān
translated: the demon, with a sword raised in his hand, rushed at the lords of the Ganas.

original: tatastu tenāpratimena sāsinā te haṃsavaktrapramukhā gaṇeśvarāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tu tena apratimena sa asinā te haṃsa vaktra pramukhāḥ gaṇeśvarāḥ
translated: Then those lords of the Ganas, headed by the swan-faced one, with that incomparable sword,

original: samātaraścāpi parājitā raṇe skandaṃ bhayārttāḥ śaraṇaṃ prapedire // / //
analyzed: sa mātaraḥ ca api parājitāḥ raṇe skandam bhaya ārttāḥ śaraṇam prapedire
translated: And their mother was also defeated in battle. Afflicted with fear, they sought refuge with Skanda.

original: bhaganān gaṇān vīkṣya maheśvarātmajastaṃ tārakaṃ sāsinamāpatantam /
analyzed: gaṇān vīkṣya maheśvara ātmajaḥ tam tārakam sa asinam āpatantam
translated: Seeing the Bhaganas and the Gaṇas, the son of Maheśvara,

original: dṛṣṭvaiva śaktyā hṛdaye bibheda sa bhinnamarmā nyapatat pṛthivyām // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā eva śaktyā hṛdaye bibheda sa bhinna marmā nyapatat pṛthivyām
translated: Seeing Tāraka with the moon, he pierced his heart with a spear. His heart pierced, he fell on the ground.

original: tasminhate bhrātari bhagnadarpo bhayāturo 'bhūnmahiṣo maharṣe /🔽saṃtyajya saṃgrāmaśiro durātmā jagāma śailaṃ sa dimācalākhyam // / //🔽bāṇo 'pi vīre nihate 'tha tārake gate himādriṃ mahiṣe bhayātte /
analyzed: tasmin hate bhrātari bhagna darpaḥ bhaya āturaḥ bhūt mahiṣaḥ mahā ṛṣe  saṃtyajya saṃgrāma śiraḥ durātmā jagāma śailam sa dimācala ākhyam  bāṇaḥ pi vīre nihate tha tārake gate himādrim mahiṣe bhayāt te
translated: When his brother was killed, the demon Mahiṣa, O great sage, became dejected and afflicted with fear.🔽Abandoning the battlefield, the evil-minded one went to the mountain called Himavat.🔽When the hero Tāraka was killed, and the demon Mahiṣa fled out of fear to the Himalayas,

original: bhayād viveśogramapāṃ nidhānaṃ garṇairbale vadhyati sāparādhe // / //
analyzed: bhayāt viveśa ugram apām nidhānam garṇaiḥ bale vadhyati sa aparādhe
translated: Out of fear, he entered the terrible abode of waters, where the powerful one kills the guilty.

original: hatvā kumāro raṇamurdhni tārakaṃ pragṛhya śaktiṃ mahatā javena /
analyzed: hatvā kumāraḥ raṇa murdhni tārakam pragṛhya śaktim mahatā javena
translated: Having killed Tāraka on the battlefield, Kumāra, with great speed, took up his spear

analyzed: mayūram āruhya śikhaṇḍa maṇḍitam yayau nihantum mahiṣa asurasya
translated: And mounted his peacock adorned with a crest, he went to kill the demon Mahiṣa.

original: sa pṛṣṭhataḥ prekṣya śikaṇḍiketanaṃ samāpatantaṃ varaśaktipāṇinam /
analyzed: sa pṛṣṭhatas prekṣya śikaṇḍi ketanam samāpatantam vara śakti pāṇinam
translated: Seeing him coming from behind, with the banner of a peacock, holding an excellent spear,

original: kailāsamutsṛjya himācalaṃ tathā krauñcaṃ samabhyetva guhaṃ viveśa // / //
analyzed: kailāsam utsṛjya himācalam tathā krauñcam samabhyetvā guham viveśa
translated: Having abandoned Kailash and the Himalayas, he went to Krouncha and entered the cave.

original: daityaṃ praviṣṭaṃ sa pinākisūnurjugopa yatnād bhagavān suho 'pi /
analyzed: daityam praviṣṭam sa pināki sūnuḥ jugopa yatnāt bhagavān
translated: The illustrious Suha, the son of Pinaki, carefully guarded the demon who had entered.

original: svabandhuhantā bhavitā kathaṃ tvahaṃ saṃcintayanneva tataḥ sthito 'bhūt // / //
analyzed: sva bandhu hantā bhavitā katham tu aham saṃcintayan eva tatas sthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Thinking, How can I become the slayer of my own relatives? he remained there.

analyzed: tatas bhyagāt puṣkarasaṃbhavaḥ tu haraḥ murāriḥ tridaseśvaraḥ ca
translated: Then Hari, born from the lotus, Shiva, and Vishnu, the lord of the gods, came there.

original: abhyetya cocurmahiṣaṃ saśailaṃ bhindasva śaktyā kuru devakāryam // / //
analyzed: abhyetya ca ūcuḥ mahiṣam sa śailam bhindasva śaktyā kuru deva kāryam
translated: Having come, they said to Mahisha, Break the mountain with your spear and perform the task of the gods.

original: tat kārtikeyaḥ priyameva tathyaṃ śrutvā vacaḥ prāha surān vihasya /
analyzed: tat kārtikeyaḥ priyam eva tathyam śrutvā vacaḥ prāha surān vihasya
translated: Having heard those true and beloved words, Kartikeya, laughing, spoke to the gods:

original: kathaṃ hi mātāmahanaptṛkaṃ vadhe svabhrātaraṃ bhrātṛsutaṃ ca mātuḥ // / //
analyzed: katham hi mātāmaha naptṛkam vadhe sva bhrātaram bhrātṛ sutam ca mātuḥ
translated: How can I kill my maternal uncle's grandson, my brother, and my mother's brother's son?

original: eṣā śrutiścāpi purātanī kila gāyanti yāṃ vedavido maharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: eṣā śrutiḥ ca api purātanī kila gāyanti yām veda vidaḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: This ancient scripture is said to be sung by the great sages who know the Vedas.

original: kṛtvā ca yasyā matamuttamāyāḥ svargaṃ vrajanti tvatipāpino 'pi // / //
analyzed: kṛtvā ca yasyāḥ matam uttamāyāḥ svargam vrajanti tu ati pāpinaḥ
translated: Having done what is pleasing to this excellent one, even the greatest sinners go to heaven.

original: gāṃ brāhmaṇaṃ vṛddhamathāptavākyaṃ bālaṃ svabandhuṃ lalanāmaduṣṭām /
analyzed: gām brāhmaṇam vṛddham atha āpta vākyam bālam sva bandhum lalanām aduṣṭām
translated: A cow, a Brahmin, an old person, one whose words are trusted, a child, one's own relative, a beloved one, and an innocent one -

original: kṛtāparādhā api naiva vadhyā ācāryamukhyā guravastathaiva // / //
analyzed: kṛta aparādhāḥ api nā eva vadhyāḥ ācārya mukhyāḥ guravaḥ tathā eva
translated: Even if they have committed offenses, teachers and preceptors, especially the chief ones, should not be killed.

original: evaṃ jānan dharmamagryaṃ surendrā nāhaṃ hanyāṃ bhātaraṃ mātuleyam /
analyzed: evam jānan dharmam agryam sura indrāḥ na aham hanyām bhātaram mātuleyam
translated: Knowing this to be the foremost dharma, O Indra of the gods, I will not kill my brother, my mother's son.

original: yadā daityo nirgāmiṣyad guhāntaḥ tadā śaktyā ghātāyiṣyāmi śatrum // / //
analyzed: yadā daityaḥ nirgāmiṣyat guhā antar tadā śaktyā śatrum
translated: When the demon comes out from the cave, then I will strike the enemy with my spear.

original: śrutvā kumāravacanaṃ bhagavānmaharṣe kṛtvā matiṃ svahṛdaye guhamāha śakraḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā kumāra vacanam bhagavān mahā ṛṣe kṛtvā matim sva hṛdaye guham āha śakraḥ
translated: Having heard Kumara's words, the illustrious great sage Shakra, having made up his mind in his heart, said to Guha:

original: matto bhavān na matimān vadase kimarthaṃ vākyaṃ śṛṇuṣva hariṇā gaditaṃ hi pūrvam // / //
analyzed: mattaḥ bhavān na matimān vadase kimartham vākyam śṛṇuṣva hariṇā gaditam hi pūrvam
translated: Why do you speak thus, not being wiser than me? Listen to the words spoken by Hari in the past.

analyzed: na ekasya arthe bahūn hanyāt iti śāstreṣu niścayaḥ
translated: The conclusion in the scriptures is that one should not kill many for the sake of one.

original: ekaṃ hanyād bahubhyor'the na pāpī tena jāyate / //
analyzed: ekam hanyāt bahubhyaḥ ṛthe na pāpī tena jāyate
translated: One may kill one for the sake of many, and thereby does not become sinful.

analyzed: etat śrutvā mayā pūrvam samaya sthena ca agnija
translated: Having heard this before, O Agni's son, while observing the rule,

analyzed: nihataḥ namuciḥ pūrvam sodaraḥ mama anujaḥ
translated: Namuchi was killed by me in the past, though he was my brother and younger.

analyzed: tasmāt bahūnām arthāya sa kroñcam mahiṣa asuram
translated: Therefore, for the sake of many, kill the demon Mahiṣa along with his Kṛiñca,

analyzed: ghātayasva parākramya śaktyā pāvaka dattayā
translated: by displaying your prowess with the spear given by Agni.

analyzed: purandara vacaḥ śrutvā krodhāt ārakta locanaḥ
translated: Having heard Purandara's words, his eyes reddened with anger,

analyzed: kumāraḥ prāha vacanam kampamānaḥ śatakratum
translated: The prince, trembling, spoke these words to Shatakratu:

original: mūḍha kiṃ te balaṃ bāhvoḥ śārīraṃ cāpi vṛtrahan /
analyzed: mūḍha kim te balam bāhvoḥ śārīram ca api vṛtrahan
translated: O fool, what is the strength of your arms and your physical prowess, O slayer of Vritra?

original: yenādhikṣipase māṃ tvaṃ dhruvaṃ na matimānasi // / //🔽tamuvāca sahasrākṣastvatto 'haṃ balavān guha /
analyzed: yena adhikṣipase mām tvam dhruvam na matimān asi  tam uvāca sahasrākṣaḥ tvattaḥ ham balavān guha
translated: By which you are reproaching me, you are certainly not intelligent.🔽The thousand-eyed one said to him, O Guha, I am stronger than you.

original: taṃ gṛhaḥ prāha ehyehi yuddhyasva balavān yadi // / //
analyzed: tam gṛhaḥ prāha ehi ehi yuddhyasva balavān yadi
translated: Guha said to him, Come, come, fight if you are strong.

analyzed: śakraḥ prāha atha balavān jñāyate kṛttikāsuta
translated: Shakra then said, The strong one is known to be the son of Krittika.

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ śīghrataraṃ yaḥ kuryāt krauñcameva hi // / //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam śīghrataram yaḥ kuryāt krauñcam eva hi
translated: He who would quickly perform the circumambulation of the Krouncha mountain.

original: śrutvā tadvacanaṃ skando mayūraṃ prohya vegavān /
analyzed: śrutvā tat vacanam skandaḥ mayūram prohya vegavān
translated: Hearing those words, Skanda, the swift one, threw off the peacock.

original: pradakṣiṇaṃ pādacārī karttu tūrṇataro 'byagāt // / //🔽śakro 'vatīrya nāgendrāt pādenātha pradakṣiṇam /
analyzed: pradakṣiṇam pāda cārī karttu tūrṇataraḥ byagāt  śakraḥ vatīrya nāga indrāt pādena atha pradakṣiṇam
translated: He quickly went to perform the circumambulation on foot.

analyzed: kṛtvā tasthau guhaḥ bhyetya mūḍham kim saṃsthitaḥ bhavān
translated: Shakra, having descended from the lord of elephants, then stood, having circumambulated on foot. Guha approached and said, O fool, why are you standing?

original: tamindraḥ prāha kauṭilyaṃ mayā pūrvaṃ pradakṣiṇaḥ /
analyzed: tam indraḥ prāha kauṭilyam mayā pūrvam pradakṣiṇaḥ
translated: Indra said to him, The circumambulation was performed by me first.

original: kṛto 'sya na tvayā pūrvaṃ kumāraḥ śakramabravīt // / //
analyzed: kṛtaḥ sya na tvayā pūrvam kumāraḥ śakram abravīt
translated: It was not performed by you first. Kumara said to Shakra,

original: mayā pūrvaṃ mayā pūrvaṃ vivadanatau parasparam /
analyzed: mayā pūrvam mayā pūrvam vivadanatau parasparam
translated: They argued with each other, By me first, by me first.

analyzed: prāpya ūcatuḥ maheśāya brahmaṇe mādhavāya ca
translated: Having obtained, they said to Mahesha, Brahma, and Madhava, ...

analyzed: athā uvāca hariḥ skandam praṣṭum arhasi parvatam
translated: Then Hari said to Skanda, You should ask the mountain.

analyzed: yaḥ yam vacakṣyati pūrvam krauñcam abhyetya pāvakiḥ
translated: He who will speak first, O son of Agni, having approached Krouncha,

analyzed: papraccha adrim idam kena kṛtam pūrvam pradakṣiṇam
translated: By whom was this mountain circumambulated first?...

analyzed: tat mādhava vacaḥ śrutvā krauñcam abhyetya pāvakiḥ
translated: Having heard those words of Madhava, the son of Agni, having approached Krouncha,

analyzed: papraccha adrim idam kena kṛtam pūrvam pradakṣiṇam
translated: asked the mountain, By whom was this circumambulated first?...

analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ krauñcaḥ tu prāha pūrvam mahāmatiḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Krouncha, the greatly wise one, said first,

analyzed: cakāra gotrabhid kṛtam atho guha
translated: The one who knows the lineage did it later. O Guha, it was done by you...

analyzed: evam bruvantam krauñcam sa krodhāt prasphurita adharaḥ
translated: Krouncha, who was speaking thus, with lips trembling in anger,

original: bibheda śaktyā kauṭilyo mahiṣeṇa samaṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: bibheda śaktyā kauṭilyaḥ mahiṣeṇa samam tadā
translated: Kautilya pierced him with a spear, along with a buffalo, at that time...

original: tasminhate 'tha tanaye balavān sunābho vegena bhūmidharapārthivastathāgāt /
analyzed: tasmin hate tha tanaye balavān sunābhaḥ vegena bhūmidhara pārthivaḥ tathā agāt
translated: When his son was killed, the powerful Sunabha, the king of the mountain people, came with force in the same way.

original: brahmendrarudraśvivasupradhānā jagmurdivaṃ mahiṣamīkṣya hataṃ guhena // / //🔽svamātulaṃ bīkṣya balī kumāraḥ śaktiṃ samutpāṭya nihantukāmaḥ /
analyzed: brahma indra rudra śvi vasu pradhānāḥ jagmuḥ divam mahiṣam īkṣya hatam guhena  sva mātulam bīkṣya balī kumāraḥ śaktim samutpāṭya nihantu kāmaḥ
translated: Brahmā, Indra, Rudra, and the Vasus, headed by Śiva, went to heaven, having seen the buffalo slain by Guha.🔽Seeing his powerful maternal uncle, Kumāra, desiring to kill him, uprooted his Śakti.

original: nivāritaścakradhareṇa vegādāliṅgya dorbhyā gururityudīrya // / //🔽sunābhamabhyetya himācalastu pragṛhya haste 'nyata eva nītavān /
analyzed: nivāritaḥ cakradhareṇa vegāt āliṅgya dorbhyāḥ guruḥ iti udīrya  sunābham abhyetya himācalaḥ tu pragṛhya haste nyatas eva nītavān
translated: And was restrained by the wielder of the discus, having embraced him with his arms, saying He is your guru.🔽And the Himālaya mountain, having approached Sunābha, took him away by the hand to another place.

analyzed: hariḥ kumāram sa śikhaṇḍinam nayat vegāt divam pannaga śatru patraḥ
translated: And Hari, the enemy of the serpents, having taken Kumāra with Śikhaṇḍin, carried him to heaven with speed.

original: tato guhaḥ prāha hariṃ sureśaṃ mohena naṣṭo bhagavan vivekaḥ /
analyzed: tatas guhaḥ prāha harim sureśam mohena naṣṭaḥ bhagavan vivekaḥ
translated: Then Guha said to Hari, the lord of the gods, O Lord, my discrimination has been lost through delusion.

original: bhrātā mayā mātulajo nirastastasmāt kariṣye svaśarīraśoṣam // / //
analyzed: bhrātā mayā mātula jaḥ nirastaḥ tasmāt kariṣye sva śarīra śoṣam
translated: My brother, the son of my maternal uncle, has been overthrown by me, therefore I shall dry up my own body.

original: taṃ prāha viṣṇurvraja tīrthavarthaṃ pṛthūdakaṃ pāpataroḥ kuṭhāram /
analyzed: tam prāha viṣṇuḥ vraja pṛthu udakam pāpa taroḥ kuṭhāram
translated: To him Viṣṇu said, Go to the holy place Pṛthūdaka, the axe for the tree of sin.

analyzed: snātvā oghavatyām haram īkṣya bhaktyā bhaviṣyase sūrya sama prabhāvaḥ
translated: Having bathed in Oghavati and seen Hara with devotion, you will become equal to the sun in radiance.

original: ityevamukto hariṇā kumārastvabhyetya tīrthaṃ prasamīkṣya śaṃbhum /
analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ hariṇā kumāraḥ tu abhyetya tīrtham prasamīkṣya śaṃbhum
translated: Thus addressed by Hari, Kumāra, having approached and seen Śambhu in the holy place,

original: snātvārcya devān sa raviprakāśo jagāma śailaṃ sadanaṃ harasya // / //
analyzed: snātvā arcya devān sa ravi prakāśaḥ jagāma śailam sadanam harasya
translated: Having bathed and worshipped the gods, he, shining like the sun, went to the mountain, the abode of Hara.

analyzed: sucakranetraḥ pi mahā āśrame tapaḥ cacāra śaile pavanāśanaḥ tu
translated: Suchakra-netra also practiced austerities in that great penance grove on the mountain, subsisting on air.

original: ārādhayāno vṛṣabhadhvajaṃ tadā haro 'sya tuṣṭo varado babhūva // / //
analyzed: ārādhayānaḥ vṛṣabhadhvajam tadā tuṣṭaḥ vara daḥ babhūva
translated: Worshiping the bull-bannered one then, Hara was pleased with him and became the giver of boons.

original: devāt sa vavre varamāyudhārthe cakraṃ tathā vai ripubāhuṣaṇḍam /🔽chindyādyathā tvapratimaṃ kareṇa bāṇasya tanme bhagavān dadātu // / //
analyzed: devāt sa vavre varam āyudha arthe cakram tathā vai ripu bāhu ṣaṇḍam  chindyāt yathā tu apratimam kareṇa bāṇasya tat me bhagavān dadātu
translated: From the god, he chose a boon for his weapon, a discus and also the arms of enemies.🔽May the Lord give me that incomparable weapon which I can wield with my hand and cut off the arms of Bana.

original: tamāha śaṃbhurvraja dattametad varaṃ hi cakrasya tavāyudhāsya /
analyzed: tam āha śaṃbhuḥ vraja dattam etat varam hi cakrasya tava āyudha asya
translated: To him, Shambhu said, Go, this boon has been granted to you. This discus will be your weapon.

original: bāṇasya tadbāhubalaṃ pravṛddhaṃ saṃchetsyate nātra vicāraṇāsti // / //
analyzed: bāṇasya tat bāhu balam pravṛddham saṃchetsyate na atra vicāraṇā asti
translated: The strength of Bana's arms will be increased, but it will be cut off by this. There is no doubt about it.

analyzed: vare pradatte tripurāntakena gaṇeśvaraḥ skandam upājagāma
translated: When the Destroyer of Tripura granted the boon, the lord of the Ganas, Skanda, approached him.

original: nipatya pādau prativandya hṛṣṭo nivedayāmāsa haraprasādam // / //
analyzed: nipatya pādau prativandya hṛṣṭaḥ nivedayāmāsa hara prasādam
translated: Falling at his feet and joyfully worshipping him, he joyfully informed him of Shiva's grace.

analyzed: evam tava uktam mahiṣa asurasya vadham trinetra ātmaja śakti bhedāt
translated: Thus the slaying of the demon Mahiṣa has been told to you, through the power of the son of the Three-eyed One.

original: krauñcasya mṛtyuḥ śaraṇāgatārthaṃ pāpāpahaṃ puṇyavivardhanaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: krauñcasya mṛtyuḥ śaraṇa āgata artham pāpa apaham puṇya vivardhanam ca
translated: The death of Krouncha, for the sake of those who had sought refuge, which removes sin and increases merit.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe dvātriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-second chapter in the Vamana Purana - 32.

analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

analyzed: mantrayatām prāptaḥ daityānām śara tāḍitaḥ
translated: He who was struck by an arrow and reached the assembly of the demons,

original: sa kena vada nirbhinnaḥ śareṇa ditijeśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: sa kena vada nirbhinnaḥ śareṇa ditija īśvaraḥ

analyzed: namaḥ stu srva debhyaḥ provāca prahasan haraḥ
translated: Salutations to all gods, Hara spoke with a smile.

original: sa cāgataḥ suraiḥ sendraḥ praṇato vinayānvitaiḥ // / //
analyzed: sa ca āgataḥ suraiḥ sa indraḥ praṇataḥ vinaya anvitaiḥ
translated: And he came with the gods and Indra, bowed down by those endowed with humility.

analyzed: tam ūcuḥ devatāḥ sarvaḥ tyajyatām
translated: All the gods said to him, Let the great vow of Śaṅkara be abandoned.

analyzed: mahāvratam trayaḥ lokāḥ kṣubdhāḥ tvattaḥ sāvṛtāḥ
translated: The three worlds are agitated, filled with your austerities.

original: athovāca mahādevo mayā tyakto mahāvrataḥ /🔽tataḥ surā divaṃ jagmurhṛṣṭāḥ prayatamānasāḥ // / //
analyzed: athā uvāca mahādevaḥ mayā tyaktaḥ mahā vrataḥ  tatas surāḥ divam jagmuḥ hṛṣṭāḥ prayata mānasāḥ
translated: Then Mahādeva said, The great vow has been abandoned by me.🔽Then the gods went to heaven, delighted, with restrained minds.

analyzed: tatas pi kampate pṛthvī sa abdhi dvīpa acalā mune
translated: Then, O sage, the earth with its oceans, islands and mountains trembled again.

analyzed: tatas bhicintayat rudraḥ kimartham kṣubhitā mahī
translated: Then Rudra thought, Why is the earth agitated?

analyzed: tatas paryacarat śūlī kurukṣetram samantataḥ
translated: Then the trident-holder wandered all around Kurukshetra.

analyzed: dadarśa ughavatī tīre uśanasam tapaḥ nidhim
translated: He saw Ushanasa, the treasure of austerities, on the banks of the Oghavati river.

analyzed: tatas bravīt surapatiḥ kimartham tapyate tapaḥ
translated: Then the lord of the gods said, For what purpose are austerities being performed?

analyzed: jagat kṣobha karam vipra tat śīghram kathyatām mama
translated: O brahmin, which causes agitation in the world, tell me that quickly.

analyzed: uśanāḥ uvāca
translated: Ushanas said:

analyzed: tava ārādhana kāma artham tapyate hi mahat tapaḥ
translated: For the sake of pleasing you, great austerities are indeed being performed.

analyzed: saṃjīvanīm śubhām vidyām jñātum icche trilocana
translated: O three-eyed one, I wish to know the auspicious knowledge of Sanjivani.

analyzed: haraḥ uvāca
translated: Shiva said:

analyzed: tapasā parituṣṭaḥ smi su taptena tapodhana
translated: I am satisfied with your well-performed austerities, O treasure of austerities.

analyzed: tasmāt saṃjīvanīm vidyām bhavān jñāsyati tat tavattaḥ
translated: Therefore, you will know the knowledge of Sanjivani as you wish.

analyzed: varam labdhvā tatas śukraḥ tapasaḥ saṃnyavarttata
translated: Having obtained the boon, Shukra desisted from austerities.

analyzed: tathā api calate pṛthvī sa abdhi bhūbhṛt naga āvṛtā
translated: Nevertheless, the earth trembled with the oceans, mountains and forests.

analyzed: tatas gamat mahādevaḥ saptasārasvatam śuciḥ
translated: Then the great god Mahadeva went to the pure Sapta-Sarasvata.

analyzed: dadarśa nṛtyamānam ca ṛṣim maṅkaṇa saṃjñitam
translated: And he saw the sage known as Mankanaka dancing.

original: bhāvena poplūyati bālavat sa bhujau prasāryaiva nanartta vegāt /
analyzed: bhāvena poplūyati bāla vat sa bhujau prasārya eva nanartta vegāt
translated: He was floating like a child, spreading out his arms, he was dancing with speed.

original: tasyaiva vegena samāhatā tu cacāla bhūrbhūmidharaiḥ sahaiva // / //
analyzed: tasya eva vegena samāhatā tu cacāla bhūḥ bhūmidharaiḥ saha eva
translated: And by the force of that, the earth with its mountains trembled.

original: taṃ śaṅgaro 'bhyetya kare nigṛhya provāca vākyaṃ prahasan maharṣe /
analyzed: tam śaṅgaraḥ bhyetya kare nigṛhya provāca vākyam prahasan mahā ṛṣe
translated: Then Śaṅkara approached him, seized him by the hand, and spoke these words, laughing, to the great sage:

original: kiṃ bhāvito nṛtyasi kena hetunā vadasva māmetya kimatra tuṣṭiḥ // / //
analyzed: kim bhāvitaḥ nṛtyasi kena hetunā vadasva mām etya kim atra tuṣṭiḥ
translated: Why are you dancing, what is the reason? Tell me, what is the satisfaction here?

original: sa brāhmaṇaḥ prāha mamādya tuṣṭiryeneha jātā śṛṇu tad dvijendra /
analyzed: sa brāhmaṇaḥ prāha mama adya tuṣṭiḥ yena iha jātā śṛṇu tat dvijendra
translated: That brahmin said: Today I am satisfied, O best of brahmins, listen to how it happened.

original: bahūn gaṇān vai mama tapyatastapaḥ saṃvatsarān kāyaviśoṣaṇārtham // / //
analyzed: bahūn gaṇān vai mama tapyataḥ tapaḥ saṃvatsarān kāya viśoṣaṇa artham
translated: For many years, while I was practicing austerities, I dried up my body.

original: tato 'nupaśyāmi karāt kṣatotthaṃ nirgacchate śākarasaṃ mameha /
analyzed: tatas nu paśyāmi karāt kṣata uttham nirgacchate śāka rasam mama iha
translated: Then I saw the juice of vegetables coming out from my hand.

original: tenādya tuṣṭo 'smi bhṛśaṃ dvijendra yenāsmi nṛtyāmi subhāvitātmā // / //
analyzed: tena adya tuṣṭaḥ smi bhṛśam dvijendra yena asmi nṛtyāmi su bhāvita ātmā
translated: By that, O best of brahmins, I am greatly satisfied today, and therefore I am dancing, my mind well-composed.

original: taṃ prāha śaṃbhurdvija paśya mahyaṃ bhasma pravṛtto 'ṅgulito 'tiśuklam /
analyzed: tam prāha śaṃbhuḥ dvija paśya mahyam bhasma
translated: Then Śaṃbhu said to him: O brahmin, see, very white ash is coming from my finger.

original: saṃtāḍanādeva na ca praharṣo mamāsti nṛnaṃ hi bhavān pramattaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃtāḍanāt eva na ca praharṣaḥ mama asti hi bhavān pramattaḥ
translated: But I have no joy from just striking, for you are heedless, O man.

original: śrutvātha vākyaṃ vṛṣabhadhvajasya matvā munirmaṅkaṇako maharṣe /
analyzed: śrutvā atha vākyam vṛṣabhadhvajasya matvā muniḥ maṅkaṇakaḥ mahā ṛṣe
translated: Then the sage Maṅkaṇaka, having heard the words of the bull-bannered one, O great sage,

original: nṛtyaṃ parityajya suvismito 'tha vavanda pādau vinayāvanamraḥ // / //
analyzed: nṛtyam parityajya vavanda pādau vinaya avanamraḥ
translated: Abandoning his dance, he then respectfully bowed down and saluted the feet of Shiva.

original: tamāha śaṃbhurdvija gaccha lokaṃ taṃ brahmaṇo durgamamavyayasya /
analyzed: tam āha śaṃbhuḥ dvija gaccha lokam tam brahmaṇaḥ durgamam avyayasya
translated: Shiva said to him, O Brahmin, go to that world of Brahma, which is inaccessible and imperishable.

original: idaṃ ca tīrthaṃ pravaraṃ pṛthivyāṃ pṛthūdakasyāstu samaṃ phalena // / //
analyzed: idam ca tīrtham pravaram pṛthivyām pṛthūdakasya astu samam phalena
translated: And let this best of holy places on earth be equal in fruit to Prithudaka.

analyzed: sāṃnidhyam atra eva sura asurāṇām gandharva vidyādhara kinnarāṇām
translated: The presence of gods, demons, gandharvas, vidyadharas and kinnaras here,

analyzed: sadā astu dharmasya nidhānam agryam sārasvatam pāpa mala apahāri
translated: Let it always be the foremost abode of Dharma, Saraswati, the remover of sins and impurities.

analyzed: suprabhā kāñcānākṣī ca suveṇuḥ vimalodakā
translated: Suprabha, Kanchanakshi, Suvenu, Vimalodaka,

analyzed: manoharā ca oghavatī viśālā ca sarasvatī
translated: Manohara, Aghuvati, and the vast Saraswati.

analyzed: etāḥ sapta sarasvatyaḥ nivisiṣyanti nityaśas
translated: These seven Sarasvatis will always reside here.

analyzed: somapāla phalam sarvāḥ prayacchanti su puṇya dāḥ
translated: All of them bestow the fruits of Somapal, and are givers of great merit.

analyzed: bhavān api kurukṣetre mūrtim sthāpya garīyasīm
translated: You too, having established a great form in Kurukshetra,

analyzed: gamiṣyati mahā puṇyam brahma lokam su durgamam
translated: Will go to the great and difficult to attain Brahmaloka.

analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ devena tapodhanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Shiva, the ascetic,

analyzed: sthāpya kurukṣetre brahma lokam agāt vaśī
translated: Having installed his form in Kurukshetra, the self-controlled one went to Brahmaloka.

original: gate maṅkaṇake pṛthvī niścalā samajāyata /🔽athāgānmandaraṃ śaṃbhurnijamāvasathaṃ śuciḥ // / //
analyzed: gate maṅkaṇake pṛthvī niścalā samajāyata  athā agāt mandaram śaṃbhuḥ nijam āvasatham śuciḥ
translated: When Mankana had departed, the earth became still and motionless.🔽Then Shambhu went to Mandara, his own pure abode.

original: etat tavoktaṃ dvija śaṅkarastu gatastadāsīt tapase 'tha śaile /
analyzed: etat tava uktam dvija śaṅkaraḥ tu gataḥ tadā āsīt tapase śaile
translated: O Brahmin, I have told you this. Then Shankara went to perform austerities on the mountain.

original: śūnye 'bhyagād dṛṣṭamatirhi devyā saṃyodhito yena hi kāraṇena // / //
analyzed: śūnye bhyagāt dṛṣṭa matiḥ hi devyā saṃyodhitaḥ yena hi kāraṇena
translated: When the empty place was seen by the goddess, he was challenged by her for a reason.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe ṣaṭtriśaḥ adhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-sixth chapter in the Vamana Purana-Samhita.

analyzed: nārādaḥ uvāca  gataḥ ndhakaḥ tu pātāle kim aceṣṭata dānavaḥ
translated: Narada said:🔽When Andhaka went to the nether world, what did the demon do?

analyzed: śaṅkaraḥ yat ca akāra tat ucyatām
translated: And what did Shankara do when he was on Mandara? Please tell me that.

analyzed: pulāstyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: pātāla sthaḥ ndhakaḥ brahman bādhyate madana agninā
translated: O Brahmin, Andhaka, residing in the nether world, was tormented by the fire of passion.

analyzed: saṃtpata vigrahaḥ sarvān dānavān idam abravīt
translated: With his body trembling, he said this to all the demons:

original: sa me suhṛtsa me bandhuḥ sa bhrāta sa pitā mama /
analyzed: sa me suhṛd sa me bandhuḥ sa bhrāta sa pitā mama
translated: He is my friend, he is my relative, he is my brother, he is my father,

analyzed: yaḥ tām adri sutām śīghnam mama anti kam upānayet
translated: who will quickly bring me that daughter of the mountain.

analyzed: evam bruvati daitya inde andhake madana andhake
translated: When the lord of demons, Andhaka, blinded by passion, said this,

analyzed: megha gambhīra nirghoṣam prahalādaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: And said to him in a voice deep as the rumbling of clouds: O Prahlada, listen to the reason why the three-eyed god is your mother.

original: yeyaṃ girisutā vīra sā mātā dharmatastava /
analyzed: yā iyam girisutā vīra sā mātā dharmataḥ tava
translated: O hero, the daughter of the mountain is your mother in the true sense.

analyzed: pitā trinayanaḥ devaḥ śrūyatām atra kāraṇam
translated: The three-eyed god is your father. Listen to the reason here.

analyzed: tava pitrā hi aputrā ima dharma nityena dānava
translated: O demon, your father, who was devoted to dharma and had no son,

original: ārādhito mahādevaḥ putrārthāya purā kila // / //🔽tasmai trilocananāsīd datto 'ndho 'pyeva dānava /
analyzed: ārādhitaḥ mahādevaḥ putra arthāya purā kila  tasmai dattaḥ dānava
translated: is said to have worshipped Mahadeva in the past for the sake of a son.

original: putrakaḥ putrakāmāsya proktvetyaṃ vacanaṃ vibho // / //🔽netratrayaṃ hiraṇyākṣa narmārthamumayā mama /
analyzed: putrakaḥ putra kāmā asya proktvā ityam vacanam vibho  netra trayam hiraṇyākṣa narma artham umayā mama
translated: O demon, the three-eyed one gave him a blind son, saying these words: O one who desires a son, take this son.🔽O Hiranyaksha, for the sake of sport, I closed my three eyes with Uma.

analyzed: pihitam yoga saṃsthasya tatas ndham abhavat tamaḥ
translated: Then darkness arose.

analyzed: tasmāt ca tamasaḥ jātaḥ bhūtaḥ nīla ghana svanaḥ
translated: From that darkness, a being with the sound of dark clouds arose.

analyzed: tat itam gṛhyatām daitya tava upayikam ātmajam
translated: O demon, take this son who is suitable for you.

original: yadā tu lokavidviṣṭaṃ duṣṭaṃ karma kariṣyati /
analyzed: yadā tu loka vidviṣṭam duṣṭam karma kariṣyati
translated: But when he will perform wicked deeds hated by the world,

analyzed: trailokya jananīm ca api dhamaḥ
translated: and the lowest one will desire the mother of the three worlds,

original: ghātayiṣyati vā vipraṃ yadā prakṣipta cāsurān /
analyzed: ghātayiṣyati vā vipram yadā ca asurān
translated: and when he will kill the Brahmins and cast the demons aside,

analyzed: tadā asya svayam eva aham kariṣye kāya śodhanam
translated: I myself will perform this purification of his body.

analyzed: evam uktvā gataḥ śaṃbhum sva sthānam mandara acalam
translated: Having said this, Shambhu went to his own abode, the Mandara mountain.

analyzed: tvad pitā api samabhyāgāt tvām ādāya rasātalam
translated: Your father also came, taking you to Rasatala.

analyzed: etena kāraṇena ambā śaileyī bhavitā tava
translated: For this reason, Amba will become the daughter of the mountain for you.

original: sarvasyāpīha jagato guruḥ śaṃbhuḥ pitā dhruvam // / //
analyzed: sarvasya api iha jagataḥ guruḥ śaṃbhuḥ pitā dhruvam
translated: The guru of the entire world, Shambhu, is certainly the father.

analyzed: bhavān api tapaḥ yuktaḥ śāstra vettā guṇa āplutaḥ
translated: You too are endowed with austerities, know the scriptures, and are full of virtues.

analyzed: na īdṛśe pāpa saṃkalpe matim kuryāt bhavadvidhaḥ
translated: One like you should not set his mind on such a sinful resolve.

original: trailokyaprabhuravyakto bhavaḥ sarvairnamaskṛtaḥ /🔽ajeyastasya bhāryeyaṃ na tvamarhe 'marārdana // / //
analyzed: trailokya prabhuḥ avyaktaḥ bhavaḥ sarvaiḥ namaskṛtaḥ  ajeyaḥ tasya bhāryā iyam na tvam arhe marārdana
translated: The lord of the three worlds, the unmanifest Bhava, is revered by all.🔽She is his invincible wife. You do not deserve to torment her, O tormentor of the immortals.

original: na cāpi śaktaḥ prāptuṃ tāṃ bhavāñśailanṛpātmajām /
analyzed: na ca api śaktaḥ prāptum tām bhavān śaila nṛpa ātmajām
translated: And you are not able to obtain that daughter of the king of mountains.

original: ajitvā sagaṇaṃ rudraṃ sa ca kāmo 'dya durlabhaḥ // / //🔽yastaret sāgaraṃ dorbhyā pātayed bhuvi bhāskaram /
analyzed: a jitvā sa gaṇam rudram sa ca kāmaḥ durlabhaḥ  yaḥ taret sāgaram dorbhyā pātayet bhuvi bhāskaram
translated: Without conquering Rudra and his followers, that desire is difficult to fulfill today.🔽He who can cross the ocean with his arms, bring down the sun to the earth,

analyzed: merum utpāṭayet vā api sa jayet śūlapāṇinam
translated: or uproot Mount Meru, can conquer the trident-wielding Shiva.

analyzed: uta āhosvit imāḥ śakyāḥ kriyāḥ kartum nareḥ balāt
translated: Or can these acts be done by the power of men?

original: na ca śakyo haro jetuṃ satyaṃ satyaṃ mayoditam // / //
analyzed: na ca śakyaḥ haraḥ jetum satyam satyam mayā uditam
translated: And it is not possible to conquer Hara. Truth, truth, I have spoken.

original: kiṃ tvayā na śrutaṃ daitya yathā daṇḍo mahīpaliḥ /
analyzed: kim tvayā na śrutam daitya yathā daṇḍaḥ mahī paliḥ
translated: But, O Daitya, have you not heard how the king Danda,

analyzed: para strī kāmavān mūḍhaḥ sa rāṣṭraḥ nāśam āptavān
translated: who coveted another's wife, was destroyed along with his kingdom?

analyzed: āsīt daṇḍaḥ nāma nṛpaḥ prabhūta bala vāhanaḥ
translated: There was a king named Danda, having a large army and vehicles.

original: sa ca vavre mahātejāḥ paurohityāya bhārgavam // / //
analyzed: sa ca vavre mahā tejāḥ paurohityāya bhārgavam
translated: And he, of great splendour, chose Bhargava for the office of priest.

analyzed: īje ca vividhaiḥ yajñaiḥ nṛpatiḥ
translated: And the king, attended by Sukra, performed various sacrifices.

analyzed: sukrasya āsīt ca duhitā arajā nāma nāmataḥ
translated: And Sukra had a daughter named Araja by name.

analyzed: śukraḥ kadācid agamat vṛṣuparvāṇam āsuram
translated: Once Sukra went to the Asura Vrishaparva.

analyzed: tena arcitaḥ ciram tatra tasthau bhārgava sattmaḥ
translated: And the best of the Bhargava race stayed there for a long time, being worshipped by him.

analyzed: arajā sva gṛhe vahnim śuśruṣantī mahā asura
translated: O great Asura, Araja, tending the fire in her own house,

analyzed: atiṣṭhata su cāru aṅgī tatas byāgāt narādhipaḥ
translated: remained there, having a very beautiful form. Then the king came there.

original: sa papraccha kva śukroti tamūcuḥ paricārikāḥ /
analyzed: sa papraccha kva śukrā iti tam ūcuḥ paricārikāḥ
translated: He asked, Where is Sukra? The female attendants said to him,

original: gataḥ sa bhagavān śukro yājanāya danoḥ sutam // / //
analyzed: gataḥ sa bhagavān śukraḥ yājanāya danoḥ sutam
translated: That revered Sukra has gone to officiate at the sacrifice of the son of Danu.

original: papraccha nṛpatiḥ kā tu tiṣṭhate bhārgavāśrame /
analyzed: papraccha nṛpatiḥ kā tu tiṣṭhate bhārgava āśrame
translated: The king asked, But who remains in the Bhargava hermitage?

original: tāstamūcurguroḥ putrī saṃtiṣṭhatyarajā nṛpa // / //🔽tāmāśrame śukrasutāṃ draṣṭumikṣvākunandanaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ tam ūcuḥ guroḥ putrī saṃtiṣṭhati arajā nṛpa  tām āśrame śukra sutām draṣṭum ikṣvāku nandanaḥ
translated: They said to him, O king, the daughter of our preceptor, Araja, is present.

analyzed: praviveśa mahā bāhuḥ dadarśa arajasam tatas
translated: The descendant of Ikshvaku, the mighty-armed one, entered the hermitage to see Shukra's daughter. He saw Araja.

analyzed: tām tṛṣṭvā kāma saṃtaptaḥ tad kṣaṇāt eva pārthivaḥ
translated: Seeing her, the king, burning with passion,

analyzed: saṃjātaḥ daṇḍaḥ tu kṛtānta bala coditaḥ
translated: became Andhaka Dandaka, impelled by the power of death.

analyzed: tatas visarjayāmāsa bhṛtyān bhrātṛn suhṛttamān
translated: Then the powerful one dismissed his servants, brothers and well-wishers,

analyzed: śukra śiṣyān api balī ekākī nṛpaḥ āvrajat
translated: and alone, O king, he went to Shukra's disciple.

analyzed: tam āgatam śukra sutā pratyutthāya yaśasvinī
translated: The illustrious daughter of Shukra,

original: pūjayāmāsa saṃhṛṣṭā bhrātṛbhāvena dānava // / //🔽tatastāmāha nṛpatirbāle kāmāgnivāriṇā /
analyzed: pūjayāmāsa saṃhṛṣṭā bhrātṛ bhāvena dānava  tatas tām āha nṛpatiḥ bāle kāma agni vāriṇā
translated: having seen him come, joyfully worshipped him as her brother, O Danava.

analyzed: mām samāhlādayasva adya sva pariṣvaṅga vāriṇā
translated: Then the king said to her, O girl, delight me today with the water of your embrace, with the water that extinguishes the fire of passion.

original: sāpi prāha nṛpaśreṣṭha mā vinīnasa āturaḥ /
analyzed: sā api prāha nṛpa śreṣṭha mā vinīnasaḥ āturaḥ
translated: She said, O best of kings, do not grieve in vain.

analyzed: pitā mama mahā krodhāt tridaśān api nirdahet
translated: My father, in great anger, would burn even the thirty gods.

analyzed: mūḍha buddhe bhavān bhrātā mama asi tu anayā āplutaḥ
translated: O foolish one, you are my brother, overwhelmed by this sin.

analyzed: bhaginī dharmataḥ te ham bhavān śiṣyaḥ pituḥ mama
translated: You are my sister by virtue of Dharma, and you are my father's disciple.

original: so 'brovīd bhīru māṃ śukraḥ kālena paridhakṣyati /
analyzed: saḥ brovīt bhīru mām śukraḥ kālena paridhakṣyati
translated: He said, O timid one, Shukra will consume me in due course.

analyzed: kāma agniḥ nirdahati mām adyā eva tanu madhyame
translated: The fire of desire burns me today itself, O slender-waisted one.

original: sā prāha daṇḍaṃ nṛpātiṃ muhūrta paripālaya /
analyzed: sā prāha daṇḍam nṛpātim muhūrta paripālaya
translated: She said, O king, protect me for a moment.

original: tameva yācasva guruṃ sa te dāsyatyasaṃśayam // / //
analyzed: tam eva yācasva gurum sa te dāsyati asaṃśayam
translated: Request that very preceptor himself. He will undoubtedly give you.

original: daṇḍo 'bravīt sutanvaṅgi kālakṣepo na me kṣamaḥ /
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ bravīt su tanu aṅgi kālakṣepaḥ na me kṣamaḥ

translated: and quickly seated him on the lion throne belonging to Shakra, O Brahmin.🔽Seated on the auspicious and splendid throne of the great Indra, made of all jewels,

analyzed: siṃha hāsane daitya patiḥ śuśubhe maghavān iva
translated: the lord of the daityas shone like Indra.

analyzed: tatra upaviṣṭaḥ ca eva asau kṛta añjali puṭaḥ nataḥ
translated: Seated there, he bowed with folded palms,

analyzed: prahlādam prāha vacanam megha gambhīrayā girā
translated: and spoke to Prahlada with a voice deep like the thunder of clouds.

analyzed: yat mayā tāta kartavyam trailokyam parirakṣatā
translated: What is to be done by me, O father, in protecting the three worlds,

analyzed: dharma artha kāma mokṣebhyaḥ tat ādiśatu me bhavān
translated: may you command me in regard to Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha.

analyzed: tad vākya sama kālam ca śukraḥ prahlādam abravīt
translated: At the same time as his words, Shukra spoke to Prahlada,

analyzed: yat yuktam tat mahā bāho vadasva adya uttaram vacaḥ
translated: If it is proper, O mighty-armed one, speak the next words.

analyzed: vacanam bali śukrābhyām śrutvā suraḥ
translated: Having heard the words of Bali and Shukra, the devotee of Vishnu, the demon,

analyzed: prāha dharma artha saṃyuktam prahlādaḥ vākyam uttamam
translated: Prahlada spoke excellent words full of Dharma and Artha.

original: yadāyatyāṃ kṣamaṃ rājan yaddhitaṃ bhuvanasya ca /
analyzed: yat āyatyām kṣamam rājan yat hitam bhuvanasya ca
translated: O king, that which is proper for the future, that which is beneficial for the world,

analyzed: avirodhena dharmasya arthasya upārjanam ca yat
translated: and the acquisition of Artha without contradicting Dharma,

analyzed: sarva sattva anugamanam kāma varga phalam ca yat
translated: that which follows all beings, the fruit of the group of desires,

original: paratreha ca yacchreyaḥ putra tatkarma āraca // / //
analyzed: paratra iha ca yat śreyaḥ putra tat karma
translated: O son, perform that action which is good in the next world and here,

analyzed: yatā ślāghyam prayāsi adya yathā kīrtiḥ bhavet tava
translated: so that you will attain praise, so that fame will be yours,

analyzed: yatā na ayaśasaḥ yogaḥ tathā kuru mahāmate
translated: so that you will not be connected with infamy, act thus, O greatly wise one.

analyzed: etad artha śriyam dīptām kāṅkṣante puruṣa uttamāḥ
translated: For this purpose, the best of men desire brilliant prosperity,

analyzed: yena etāni gṛhe smākam nivasanti su nirvṛtāḥ
translated: by which these are happily dwelling in our house.

original: kulajo vyasane magnaḥ sakhā cārthabahiḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: kula jaḥ vyasane magnaḥ sakhā ca artha bahis kṛtaḥ
translated: A person born in a noble family, sunk in adversity, and a friend who has been excluded from wealth,

original: vṛddho jñātirguṇī vipraḥ kīrtīśca yaśasā saha // / //
analyzed: vṛddhaḥ jñātiḥ guṇī vipraḥ kīrtīḥ ca yaśasā saha
translated: An aged relative, a virtuous Brahmin, and fame along with glory.

original: tasmād yathaite nivasanti putra rājyasthitasyeha kulodgatādyāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt yathā ete nivasanti putra rājya sthitasya iha kula udgata ādyāḥ
translated: Therefore, O son, just as these born in the family and others reside here for one who is established in the kingdom,

original: tathā yatsvāmalasattvaceṣṭa yathā yaśasvī bhavitāsi loke // / //
analyzed: tathā yathā yaśasvī bhavitāsi loke
translated: In the same way, O one whose conduct is pure and good, you will become famous in the world.

original: bhūbhyāṃ sadā brāhmaṇabhūṣitāyāṃ kṣatrānvitāyāṃ dṛḍhavāpitāyām /🔽śuśruṣaṇāsaktasamudbhavāyā mṛddhiṃ prayāntīha narādhipendrāḥ // / //
analyzed: bhūbhyām sadā brāhmaṇa bhūṣitāyām kṣatra anvitāyām dṛḍha vāpitāyām  śuśruṣaṇa āsakta samudbhavāyāḥ mṛddhim prayānti iha narādhipa indrāḥ
translated: Kings attain prosperity here on earth, always adorned with Brahmins, accompanied by Kshatriyas, firmly established,🔽And arising from being devoted to serving.

original: tasmād dvijāgryāḥ śrutiśāstrayuktā narādhipāṃste kratubhirdvijendrā yajñāgnidhūmena nṛpasya śāntiḥ // / //
analyzed: tasmāt dvijāgryāḥ śruti śāstra yuktāḥ narādhipān te kratubhiḥ dvijendrāḥ yajña agni dhūmena nṛpasya śāntiḥ
translated: Therefore, O foremost of Brahmins, you foremost of Brahmins, with the Vedas and scriptures, perform sacrifices for the kings. The peace of the king is by the smoke of the sacrificial fire.

analyzed: tapaḥ dhyayana saṃpannāḥ yājana adhyāpane ratāḥ
translated: Endowed with austerities and learning, engaged in officiating at sacrifices and teaching,

analyzed: santu viprāḥ bale pūjyāḥ tvattaḥ nujñām avāpya hi
translated: May the Brahmins be worshipped by you, O Bali, having obtained your permission.

analyzed: svādhyāya yajña niratāḥ dātāraḥ śastra jīvinaḥ
translated: Devoted to the sacrifice of self-study, givers, and living by arms,

analyzed: kṣatriyāḥ santu daitya indra prajā pālana dharmiṇaḥ
translated: May the Kshatriyas be, O lord of demons, having the duty of protecting the subjects.

analyzed: yajña adhyayana saṃpannāḥ dātāraḥ kṛṣi kāriṇaḥ
translated: Endowed with sacrifices and self-study, givers, and engaged in agriculture,

original: pāśupālyaṃ prakurvantu veśyā vipaṇijīvinaḥ // / //🔽brāhmaṇakṣatriyaviśāṃ sadā śuśruṣaṇe ratāḥ /
analyzed: pāśupālyam prakurvantu veśyāḥ vipaṇi jīvinaḥ  brāhmaṇa kṣatriya viśām sadā śuśruṣaṇe ratāḥ
translated: Let the cowherds and shepherds follow their own occupations, and let the harlots and traders live their own lives.🔽Let the Shudras always be engaged in serving the Brahmanas, Kshatriyas and Vaishyas.

analyzed: śūdrāḥ santu asura śreṣṭha tava ājñā kāriṇaḥ sadā
translated: O best of the Asuras, let them always obey your commands.

analyzed: yadā varṇāḥ svadharma sthāḥ bhavanti ditija īśvara
translated: When the Varnas are established in their own duties, O lord of the Daityas,

analyzed: dharma vṛddhiḥ tadā syāt vai dharma vṛddhau nṛpa udayaḥ
translated: then there will be an increase in righteousness, and when righteousness increases, there will be prosperity for the king.

original: tasmād varṇāḥ svadharmasthāstvayā kāryāḥ sadā bale /
analyzed: tasmāt varṇāḥ svadharma sthāḥ tvayā kāryāḥ sadā bale
translated: Therefore, O Bali, you should always make the Varnas adhere to their own duties.

analyzed: tad vṛddhau bhavataḥ vṛddhiḥ tad vā anau hāniḥ ucyate
translated: In their increase, there is your increase, and in their decrease, your decrease is declared.

original: itthaṃ vacaḥ śrāṇya mahāsurendro baliṃ mahātmā sa babhūva tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: ittham vacaḥ śrāṇya mahā asura indraḥ balim mahātmā sa babhūva tūṣṇīm
translated: Having heard these words, the great Asura king Bali became silent.

original: tato yadājñāpayase kariṣye itthaṃ baliḥ prāha vaco maharṣe // / //
analyzed: tatas yadā ājñāpayase kariṣye ittham baliḥ prāha vacaḥ mahā ṛṣe
translated: Then Bali said, I will do as you command. O great sage, thus spoke Bali.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe aṣṭacatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-eighth chapter in the Vamana Purana-Mahatmya.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: tato gateṣu deveṣu brahmalokaṃ prati dvija /
analyzed: tatas gateṣu deveṣu brahma lokam prati dvija
translated: O Brahmin, when the gods went to the world of Brahma,

analyzed: trailokyam pālayāmāsa baliḥ dharma anvitaḥ sadā
translated: Bali, endowed with righteousness, always ruled the three worlds.

original: kalistadā dharmayutaṃ jagad dṛṣṭvā kṛte yathā /
analyzed: kaliḥ tadā dharma yutam jagat dṛṣṭvā kṛte yathā
translated: Then Kali, seeing the world full of righteousness like in Krita Yuga,

analyzed: brahmāṇam śaraṇam bheje svabhāvasya niṣeṇāt
translated: And sought refuge in Brahma, due to the destruction of his nature.

original: gatvā sa dadṛśe devaṃ sendrairdevaiḥ samanvitam /
analyzed: gatvā sa dadṛśe devam sa indraiḥ devaiḥ samanvitam
translated: Having gone there, he saw the god, along with Indra and other gods,

analyzed: sva dīptyā dyotayantam ca sva deśam sa sura asuram
translated: Illuminating his own region, along with the gods and demons, with his own radiance.

analyzed: praṇipatya tam āha atha tiṣyaḥ brahmāṇam īśvaram
translated: Then Tishya bowed to Brahma, the lord, and said:

analyzed: mama svabhāvaḥ balinā nāśitaḥ deva sattama
translated: O best of gods, my nature has been destroyed by the powerful one.

original: taṃ prāha bhagavān yogī svabhāvaṃ jagato 'pi hi /
analyzed: tam prāha bhagavān yogī svabhāvam jagataḥ u hi
translated: The Blessed Yogi said to him about the nature of the world also:

original: na kevalaṃ hi bhavato hṛtaṃ tena balīyasā // / //
analyzed: na kevalam hi bhavataḥ hṛtam tena balīyasā
translated: Not only yours has been taken away by that powerful one.

original: paśyasva tiṣya devendraṃ varuṇaṃ ca samārutam /
analyzed: paśyasva tiṣya deva indram varuṇam ca sa mārutam
translated: Look, Tishya, the lord of the gods, Varuna along with the Maruts,

original: bhāskaro 'pi hi dīnatvaṃ prayāto hi balād baleḥ // / //
analyzed: bhāskaraḥ u pi hi dīna tvam prayātaḥ hi balāt baleḥ
translated: Even the sun has become distressed due to the power of Bala.

original: na tasya kaścit trailokye pratiṣeddhāsti karmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: na tasya kaścid trailokye pratiṣeddhā asti karmaṇaḥ
translated: No one in the three worlds can oppose his actions,

analyzed: ṛte sahasram śirasam harim daśa śata aṅghrikam
translated: Except Hari, who has a thousand heads and a hundred thousand feet.

original: ma bhūmiṃ ca tathā nākaṃ rājyaṃ lakṣmīṃ yaso 'vyayaḥ /
analyzed: bhūmim ca tathā nākam rājyam lakṣmīm yasaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: He will take away the earth, heaven, kingdom, Lakshmi, and imperishable fame,

analyzed: samāhariṣyati baleḥ kartuḥ saddharma gocaram
translated: Of Bala, the doer, who has the domain of true dharma.

analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ devena brahmaṇā kaliḥ avyayaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Brahma, the imperishable Kali,

original: dīnān dṛṣṭvā sa śakrādīn vibhītakavanaṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: dīnān dṛṣṭvā sa śakra ādīn vibhītaka vanam gataḥ
translated: Seeing the distressed Shakra and others, he went to the Vibhitaka forest.

analyzed: kṛtaḥ prāvarttata tadā kaleḥ na āsāt jagattraye
translated: Then, in the three worlds, Kali began to flow from his nose.

analyzed: dharmaḥ bhavat catuṣpādaḥ cāturvarṇye nārada
translated: And Dharma became four-footed, even in the four varnas, O Narada.

analyzed: tapaḥ hiṃsā ca satyam ca śaucam indriya nigrahaḥ
translated: Austerity, non-violence, truth, purity, control of the senses,

original: dayā dānaṃ tvānṛśaṃsyaṃ śuśruṣā yajñakarma ca // / //
analyzed: dayā dānam tu ānṛśaṃsyam śuśruṣā yajña karma ca
translated: Compassion, charity, harmlessness, service, and sacrificial rites -

analyzed: etāni sarva jagataḥ parivyāpya sthitāni hi
translated: These pervade and abide in the entire world.

original: balinā balavān brahman tiṣyo 'pi hi kṛtaḥ kṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: balinā balavān brahman tiṣyaḥ u pi hi kṛtaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: O Brahmin, even the powerful Tishya was made powerful by the powerful one.

analyzed: svadharma sthāyinaḥ varṇāḥ hi āśramān ca aviśn dvijāḥ
translated: The varnas abiding in their own duties entered the ashramas, the twice-born.

analyzed: prajā pālana dharma sthāḥ sadā eva manuja ṛṣabhāḥ
translated: The best of men always abide by the duty of protecting the subjects.

analyzed: dharma uttare vartamāne brahman asmin jagattraye
translated: When Dharma was thus prevailing in the three worlds, O Brahmin,

analyzed: trailokya lakṣmīḥ vara dā tvā āyātā dānava īśvaram
translated: The prosperity of the three worlds, the bestower of boons, came to the lord of the demons.

analyzed: tām āgatām nirīkṣya eva sahasrākṣa śriyam baliḥ
translated: Seeing her who had come, the thousand-eyed Shri, Bali

original: papraccha kāsi māṃ brūhi kenāsyarthena cāgatā // / //
analyzed: papraccha kā asi mām brūhi kena asi arthena ca āgatā
translated: asked, Who are you? Tell me, for what purpose have you come?

analyzed: sā tad vacanam ākarṇya prāha śrīḥ padma mālinī
translated: Hearing those words, Shri, adorned with lotuses, said:

original: bale śṛṇuṣva yāsmi tvāmāyātā mahiṣi balāt // / //
analyzed: bale śṛṇuṣva yā asmi tvām āyātā mahiṣi balāt
translated: Listen, O mighty queen, as to why I have come to you by force.

analyzed: aprameya balaḥ devaḥ sau cakra gadā dharaḥ
translated: The god who holds the discus and the mace, whose strength is immeasurable,

analyzed: tena tyaktaḥ tu maghavā tatas ham tvām iha āgatā
translated: by him was Maghavat abandoned, and therefore I have come to you here.

original: sa nirmame yuvatayaścāsro rūpasaṃyutāḥ /🔽śvetāmbaradharā caiva śvetasraganulepanā // / //🔽śvetavṛndārakārūḍhā sattvāḍhyā śvetavigrahā /
analyzed: sa nirmame yuvatayaḥ ca asraḥ rūpa saṃyutāḥ  śveta ambara dharā ca eva śveta sraj anulepanā
translated: He created young women endowed with beauty,🔽wearing white garments, with white garlands and unguents,🔽mounted on a white female elephant, full of goodness, with a white form.

analyzed: rakta ambara dharā ca anyā rakta sraj anulepanā
translated: Another one, wearing red garments, with red garlands and unguents,

analyzed: rakta vāji sāma ārūḍhā rakta aṅgī rājasī hi sā
translated: mounted on a red horse, with a red body, she is of the quality of passion.

analyzed: pīta ambarā pīra varṇā pīta mālya anulepanā
translated: Wearing yellow garments, of yellow complexion, with yellow garlands and unguents,

analyzed: sauvarṇa syandana carā tāmasam guṇam āśritā
translated: traveling in a golden chariot, she is of the quality of darkness.

analyzed: nīla ambarā nīla gandhām anulepanā
translated: Wearing blue garments, with blue garlands, blue scent and unguents,

analyzed: nīla vṛṣa samārūḍhā triguṇā sā prakīrtitā
translated: mounted on a blue bull, she is declared to be of the three qualities.

original: yā sā śvetāmbharā śvetā sattvāḍhyā kuñjarasthitā // / //
analyzed: yā sā śveta ambharā śvetā sattva āḍhyā kuñjara sthitā
translated: She who is white-garbed, white, full of goodness, and mounted on an elephant,

analyzed: sā brahmāṇam samāyātā candram candra anugān api
translated: she has come to Brahma, to Chandra, and to the followers of Chandra.

analyzed: yā raktā rakta vasanā vāji sthā rajasā anvitā
translated: She who is red, wearing red garments, mounted on a horse, endowed with passion,

original: tāṃ prādād devarājāya maneva tatsameṣu ca /
analyzed: tām prādāt devarājāya manā iva tad sameṣu ca
translated: He gave her to the king of gods and to those equal to him.

analyzed: pīta ambarā yā subhagā ratha sthā kanaka prabhā
translated: The one with yellow garments, the fortunate one, seated on a chariot, having the luster of gold...

original: prajāpatibhyastāṃ prādāt śukrāya ca viśaḥsu ca /
analyzed: prajāpatibhyaḥ tām prādāt śukrāya ca viśaḥsu ca
translated: He gave her to the Prajapatis, to Shukra, and to the Vaishyas.

analyzed: nīla vastra ali sadṛśī yā curthī vṛṣa sthitā
translated: The one similar to the blue-garmented one, the fourth one seated on a bull...

original: sā dānavān naiṛtāṃś ca śūdrān vidyādharānapi /
analyzed: sā dānavān naiṛtān ca śūdrān vidyādharān api
translated: She gave the Danavas, the Nairritas, the Shudras, and the Vidyadharas.

analyzed: vipra ādyāḥ śveta rūpām tām kathayanti sarasvatīm
translated: The Brahmins and others describe that Saraswati as having a white form.

original: stuvanti brahmaṇā sārdhaṃ makhe mantrādibhiḥ sadā /
analyzed: stuvanti brahmaṇā sārdham makhe mantra ādibhiḥ sadā
translated: They always praise her along with Brahma in the sacrifice with mantras and other things.

analyzed: kṣatriyāḥ rakta varṇām tām jaya śrīm iti śaṃsire
translated: The Kshatriyas proclaim that red-colored one as Jayashri (Victory-fortune).

analyzed: sā ca indreṇa asura śreṣṭha manunā ca yaśasvinī
translated: O best of the Asuras, that illustrious one was praised by Indra and Manu.

analyzed: vaiśyāḥ tām pīta vasanām kanaka aṅgīm sadā eva hi
translated: The Vaishyas always praise her as having yellow garments and a golden body.

analyzed: stuvanti lakṣmīm iti evam prajāpālāḥ tathā eva hi
translated: The Prajapalas praise her as Lakshmi in the same way.

original: śūdrāstāṃ nīlavarṇāṅgīṃ stuvanti ca subhaktitaḥ // / //🔽śriyā devīti nāmnā tāṃ samaṃ daityaiśca rākṣasaiḥ /
analyzed: śūdrāḥ tām nīla varṇa aṅgīm stuvanti ca su bhaktitaḥ  śriyā devī iti nāmnā tām samam daityaiḥ ca rākṣasaiḥ
translated: The Shudras praise her with great devotion as having a blue-colored body.🔽Along with the Daityas and Rakshasas, they praise her by the name of Shri Devi.

analyzed: evam vibhaktāḥ tāḥ nāryaḥ tena devena cakriṇā
translated: Thus, those women were divided by that discus-wielding god...

analyzed: etāsām ca sva rūpaḥ tāḥ tiṣṭhanti nidhayaḥ vyayāḥ
translated: And the forms of these are the immutable treasures that exist.

analyzed: itihāsa purāṇāni vedāḥ sa aṅgāḥ tathā uktayaḥ
translated: The histories, the Puranas, the Vedas with their limbs, and the sayings,

analyzed: catuḥṣaṣṭi kalāḥ śvetāḥ mahāpadmaḥ nidhiḥ sthitaḥ
translated: The sixty-four arts, the white great lotus treasure is present.

original: muktāsuvarṇarajataṃ rathāśvagajabhūṣaṇam // / //🔽śastrāstrādikavastrāṇi raktā padmo nidhiḥ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: muktā suvarṇa rajatam ratha aśva gaja bhūṣaṇam  śastra astra ādika vastrāṇi raktā padmaḥ nidhiḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Pearls, gold, silver, chariots, horses, elephants, ornaments,🔽Weapons, armor, and other garments, the red lotus treasure is remembered.

analyzed: go mahiṣyaḥ khara uṣṭram ca suvarṇa ambara bhūmayaḥ
translated: Cows, buffaloes, donkeys, camels, gold, cloth, and land,

original: oṣadhyaḥ paśavaḥ pītā mahānīlo nidhiḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: oṣadhyaḥ paśavaḥ pītāḥ mahānīlaḥ nidhiḥ sthitaḥ
translated: Herbs, animals, the yellow great blue treasure is present.

analyzed: sarvāsām api jātīnām jātiḥ ekā pratiṣṭhitā
translated: Of all the species, the one species is established,

original: anyeṣāmapi saṃhartrī nīlā śaṅkho nidhiḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: anyeṣām api saṃhartrī nīlā śaṅkhaḥ nidhiḥ sthitaḥ
translated: And the destroyer of others, the blue conch treasure is present.

original: etāsu saṃsthitānāṃ ca yāni rūpāṇi dānava /
analyzed: etāsu saṃsthitānām ca yāni rūpāṇi dānava
translated: And the forms that exist in these, O demon,

original: bhavanti suruṣāṇāṃ vai tān vibodha vadāmi te // / //
analyzed: bhavanti suruṣāṇām vai tān vibodha vadāmi te
translated: Of the gods and humans, I will tell you, understand them.

original: satyaśaucābhisaṃyuktā makhadānotsave ratāḥ /🔽bhavanti dāvanapate mahāpadmāśritā narāḥ // / //
analyzed: satya śauca abhisaṃyuktāḥ makha dāna utsave ratāḥ  bhavanti dāvana pate mahāpadma āśritāḥ narāḥ
translated: Endowed with truth and purity, devoted to the joy of sacrifice and giving,🔽Men who rely on the great lotus, O lord of demons,

analyzed: yajvinaḥ subhagāḥ dṛptāḥ māninaḥ bahu dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: Sacrificers, fortunate, arrogant, proud, with abundant gifts,

analyzed: sarva sāmānya sukhinaḥ narāḥ padma āśritāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: Men who are happy in all respects and are considered to be dependent on the lotus.

analyzed: satya anṛta samāyuktāḥ dāna āharaṇa dakṣiṇāḥ
translated: They are endowed with truth and falsehood, are skilled in giving and taking gifts,

analyzed: nyāya anyāya vyaya upetāḥ mahānīla āśritāḥ narāḥ
translated: And are associated with proper and improper expenses. Men who are dependent on the great sapphire.

analyzed: nāstikāḥ śauca rahitāḥ kṛpaṇāḥ bhoga varjitāḥ
translated: They are atheists, devoid of cleanliness, miserly, and devoid of enjoyments,

analyzed: steya anṛta kathā yuktāḥ narāḥ śaṅkha śritāḥ bale
translated: And are associated with stories of theft and falsehood. Men who are dependent on the conch, O Bala.

analyzed: irāvatyāḥ taṭe śrīmān rūpa dhāriṇam āsadat
translated: On the banks of the Iravati, he met the prosperous one, the bearer of beautiful forms.

analyzed: tam ārādhya jagannātham nakṣatrapuruṣeṇa hi
translated: Having propitiated that Lord of the universe through the Nakṣatra-puruṣa,

analyzed: surūpa tām avāpya agryām tasmin eva ca janmani
translated: he attained the highest beauty in that very birth.

analyzed: tatas priyaḥ bhūt bhāryāyāḥ bhogavān ca abhavat vaśī
translated: Then he became dear to his wife and became an enjoyer and a self-controlled one.

original: śravaṇadvādaśībhaktaḥ pūrvābhyāsādajāyata // / //🔽evaṃ purāsau dvijapuṅgavastu kurūparūpo bhagavatprasādāt /
analyzed: śravaṇa dvādaśī bhaktaḥ pūrva abhyāsāt ajāyata  evam purā asau dvija puṅgavaḥ tu ku rūpa rūpaḥ bhagavat prasādāt
translated: Due to his past practice, he became devoted to the Śravaṇa Dvādaśī.🔽Thus, in ancient times, that best of Brahmins, though ugly, became like the embodiment of love by the grace of the Lord.

original: anaṅgarūpapratimo babhūva mṛśca rājā sa purūravābhūt // / //
analyzed: anaṅga rūpa pratimaḥ babhūva mṛḥ ca rājā sa purūravā abhūt

analyzed: purūravāḥ dvijaśreṣṭha yathā devam śriyaḥ patim
translated: O best of the twice-born, how Pururava propitiated the god, the lord of Shri,

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: śrūyatām kathayiṣyāmi nakṣatrapuruṣa vratam
translated: Listen, I shall tell you about the Nakṣatra-puruṣa vow.

analyzed: nakṣatra aṅgani devasya yāni yāni iha nārada
translated: O Nārada, those nakṣatras which are the limbs of the god here...

analyzed: mūla ṛkṣam caraṇau viṣṇoḥ jaṅghe dve rohiṇī smṛte
translated: The Mūla lunar mansion is the feet of Viṣṇu, the two calves are said to be Rohiṇī,

analyzed: dve jānunī tathā aśvinyau saṃstite rūpadhārimaḥ
translated: the two knees are the Aśvinī lunar mansions, thus are established in the form-holder...

analyzed: āṣāḍham dve dvayam ca ūrvoḥ guhya stham phālgunī dvayam
translated: The two Āṣāḍha lunar mansions are the two thighs, the two Phālguni lunar mansions are in the genitals,

analyzed: kaṭi sthāḥ kṛttikāḥ ca eva vāsudevasya saṃsthitāḥ  prauṣṭhapadyā dvayam pārśve kukṣibhyām revatī sthitā
translated: the Kṛttikā lunar mansions are in the waist, thus are situated in Vāsudeva...🔽The two Prauṣṭhapada lunar mansions are the two sides, the Revatī lunar mansion is situated in the two flanks,

analyzed: uraḥsaṃsthā tu anurādhā śraviṣṭhā pṛṣṭhasaṃsthitā
translated: Anurādhā is situated in the chest, Śravaṇa is situated on the back...

analyzed: viśākhā bhujayoḥ hastaḥ kara dvayam udāhṛtam

analyzed: punarvasuḥ atha aṅgulyaḥ nakhāḥ sārpam tathā ucyate
translated: Punaḥvasu is the fingers, and the Sravaṇa lunar mansion is said to be the nails...

analyzed: grīvā sthā etā tathā jyeṣṭhā śravaṇam karṇayoḥ sthitam
translated: Jyeṣṭhā is situated in the neck, Śravaṇa is situated in the two ears,

analyzed: mukhasaṃsthaḥ tathā puṣyaḥ svātiḥ dantāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Pūṣya is declared to be on the face, and Svāti on the teeth.

original: hanū dve vāruṇaścokto nāsā paitra udāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: hanū dve vāruṇaḥ ca uktaḥ nāsā paitraḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: Varuṇa is said to be on the two jaws, and Pitṛ (i.e. Bharaṇī) on the nose.

analyzed: mṛgaśīrṣam nayanayoḥ rūpa dhāriṇi tiṣṭhati
translated: Mṛgaśiras is situated on the eyes, O you who bear the form of the world.

original: citrā caiva lalāṭe tu bharaṇī tu tathā śiraḥ /
analyzed: citrā ca eva lalāṭe tu bharaṇī tu tathā śiraḥ
translated: Citrā is on the forehead, and Bharaṇī on the head.

analyzed: śiroruha sthā ca eva ārdrā nakṣatra aṅgam idam hareḥ
translated: Ārdrā is situated on the head-hairs. These are the stars on the body of Hari.

analyzed: vidhānam saṃpravakṣyāmi yathāyogena nārada
translated: I shall now describe the rules, O Nārada, as they apply.

analyzed: saṃpūjitaḥ hariḥ kāmān vidadhāti yathā īpsitān
translated: When Hari is worshipped, he grants the desired objects.

analyzed: caitra māse sita aṣṭamyām yadā mūla gataḥ śaśī
translated: When on the eighth day of the bright fortnight in the month of Caitra, the moon is in the constellation Mūla,

analyzed: tadā tu bhagavat pādau pūjayet tu vidhānataḥ

analyzed: nakṣatra sannidhau dadyāt vipra indrāya ca bhojanam
translated: In the presence of the constellation, one should give food to the best of the brāhmaṇas.

analyzed: jānunī ca aśvinī yoge pūjayet atha bhaktitaḥ
translated: When the constellation Aśvinī is in conjunction with the knees, one should then worship them with devotion.

analyzed: dohade ca haviṣya annam pūrvavat dvija bhojanam
translated: And when the constellation Dohada is in conjunction with the knees, one should give food fit for sacrifice as before, and feed the brāhmaṇas.

original: āṣāḍhābhyāṃ tathā dvābhyāṃ dvāvūrū pūjayed budhaḥ /
analyzed: āṣāḍhābhyām tathā dvābhyām dvau ūrū pūjayet budhaḥ
translated: The wise one should worship the two thighs with the two constellations Āṣādhas.

original: salilaṃ śiśiraṃ tatra dohade ca prakīrtitam // / //
analyzed: salilam śiśiram tatra dohade ca prakīrtitam
translated: Cold water is recommended there in the Dohada.
In the two Phālguni (constellations), the secret parts should be worshipped by the wise.

original: dodahe ca payo gavyaṃ deyaṃ ca dvijabhojanam // / //
analyzed: dodahe ca payaḥ gavyam deyam ca dvija bhojanam
translated: In the Drodhas, cow's milk should be given and Brāhmaṇas should be fed.

analyzed: kṛttikāsu kaṭiḥ pūjyā sa upavāsaḥ jita indriyaḥ
translated: In the Kṛttikā (constellation), the hips should be worshipped, observing fast and controlling the senses.

analyzed: deyam ca dohadam viṣṇoḥ su gandha kusuma udakam

analyzed: pārśve bhādrapada yugme pūjayitvā vidhānataḥ
translated: In the two Bhadrapadās, having worshipped according to the rules,

analyzed: guḍam sa lehakam dadyāt dohade deva kīrtitam
translated: jaggery and candy should be given as Drodha, proclaimed by the gods.

analyzed: dve kukṣī revatī yoge dohade mudga modakāḥ
translated: In the Revatīs, the two sides of the belly should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, green gram and sweet cakes.

analyzed: anurādhāsu jaṭharam ṣaṣṭhikā annam ca dohade
translated: In the Anurādhās, the belly should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, rice cooked with six ingredients.

original: śraviṣṭhāyāṃ tathā pṛṣṭhaṃ sālibhaktaṃ ca dohade /
analyzed: śraviṣṭhāyām tathā pṛṣṭham sāli bhaktam ca dohade
translated: In the Śravaṇa, the back should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, rice cooked with Śāli.

analyzed: bhuja yugmam viśākhāsu dohade parama udanam
translated: In the Viśākhās, the two arms should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, excellent rice.

translated: In the Hasta, the two hands should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, barley is remembered.🔽In the Punarvasus, the fingers should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, Patola.🔽In the Āśleṣās, the nails should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, the flesh of Tittira.

analyzed: jyeṣṭhāyām pūjayet grīvām dohade tilamodakam
translated: In the Jyeṣṭhā, the neck should be worshipped, and in the Drodhas, sesamum and sweet cakes.

analyzed: śravaṇe śravaṇau pūjyau dadhi bhaktam ca dohade  puṣye mukham pūjayeta dohade ghṛta pāyasam
translated: In the constellation Shravana, the ears should be worshipped, and curd-rice should be offered as dohada.🔽In the constellation Pushya, the face should be worshipped, and ghee-rice should be offered as dohada.

analyzed: svāti yoge ca daśanāḥ dohade tilaśaṣkulī
translated: In the constellation Svati, the teeth should be worshipped, and sesame-rice cakes should be offered as dohada.

analyzed: dātavyā keśava prītyai ca bhojanam
translated: They should be given for the satisfaction of Keshava and Brahmana, and food should be given to Brahmins.

original: bharaṇīṣu śiraḥ pūjyaṃ cāru bhaktaṃ ca dohade // / //
analyzed: bharaṇīṣu śiraḥ pūjyam cāru bhaktam ca dohade
translated: In the constellation Bharani, the head should be worshipped, and delicious food should be offered as dohada.

analyzed: saṃpūjanīyāḥ vidvadbhiḥ ārdrā yoge śiroruhāḥ

translated: And Brahmins should be fed with devotion, and jaggery and ginger should be offered as dohada.

analyzed: nakṣetra yogeṣu eteṣu sampūjya jagataḥ patim
translated: In these constellations, having worshipped the lord of the universe,

analyzed: pārite dakṣiṇān dadyāt strī puṃsoḥ cāru vāsasī
translated: when it is over, gifts should be given, and beautiful garments for women and men.

analyzed: chatra upānah śveta yugam sapta dhānyāni kāñcanam
translated: An umbrella, a pair of white shoes, the seven grains, and gold,

analyzed: ghṛta pātram ca matiman brāhmaṇāya nivedayet
translated: And a wise man should offer a vessel of ghee to a Brahmin.

analyzed: prati nakṣatra yogena pūjanīyāḥ dvijātayaḥ  nakṣatra mayaḥ eva eṣa puruṣaḥ śāśvataḥ mataḥ
translated: The Brahmins should be worshipped according to the conjunction with each lunar mansion.🔽This man is considered to be composed of the lunar mansions alone, and is eternal.

analyzed: nakṣatrapuruṣa ākhyam hi vratānām uttamam vratam
translated: For the lunar mansion man is indeed the best of vows.

analyzed: aṅga upāṅgāni deva ṛṣe pūjayitvā jagadguroḥ
translated: O celestial sage, having worshipped the limbs and minor limbs of the Lord of the universe,

analyzed: surūpāmi abhijāyante pratyaṅga aṅgāni ca eva hi  sapta janma kṛtam pāpam kula saṃga āgatam ca yat

translated: And those arising from father and mother.

analyzed: sarvāṇi bhadrāṇi āpnoti śarīra ārogyam uttamam
translated: One obtains all that is auspicious, excellent physical health,

analyzed: anantām manasaḥ prītim rūpam ca atīva śobhanam
translated: Infinite mental delight, and extremely beautiful form.

analyzed: vāc mādhuryam tathā kānti yat ca anyat abhivāñchitam  dadāti nakṣatra pumān pūjitaḥ tu janārdanaḥ
translated: Sweetness of speech, radiance, and whatever else is desired,🔽Janardana, when worshipped as the lunar mansion man, grants it all.

translated: O Narada, having fasted properly on these lunar mansions in order,

analyzed: arundhatī mahābhāgā khyātim agryām jagāma ha

analyzed: ādityaḥ tanaya arthāya nakṣatra aṅgam janārdanam
translated: Aditya, for the sake of a son, worshipped Janardana, the embodiment of the stars,

analyzed: saṃpūjayitvā govindam revantam putram āptavān
translated: and by worshipping Govinda, obtained the son Revata.

analyzed: rambhā rūpam avāpa agryam vāc mādhuryam ca menakā
translated: Rambha attained supreme beauty, Menaka sweetness of speech,

analyzed: rājyam rājā pūrūvāḥ
translated: and King Puru obtained supreme splendor and kingdom.

analyzed: evam vidhānataḥ brahman nakṣatra aṅgaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, Janardana, the embodiment of the stars,

analyzed: nakṣatra puṃsaḥ paramam vidhānam śṛṇuṣva puṇyām iha tīrtha yātrām

translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: upoṣya kṣaṇadām bhaktyā kurudhvajam
translated: Having fasted for a night and worshipped the Kuru flag with devotion,

analyzed: kṛta śaucau jagāma atha draṣṭum puruṣakesarim

analyzed: puṇḍarīkam ca saṃpūjya uvāsa divasa trayam

analyzed: viśākha yūpe tadanu dṛṣṭvā devam tathā ajitam
translated: Then, having seen the unconquered god at Vishkhayupa,

analyzed: snātvā tathā kṛṣṇatīrthe tri rātram nyavasat śuciḥ  tatas haṃsa pade haṃsam dṛṣṭvā saṃpūjya ca īśvaram

analyzed: snātvā payoṣṇyāḥ salile pūjya akhaṇḍam jagatpatim

analyzed: draṣṭum jagāma matimān vitastāyām kumārilam

analyzed: tatra snātvā arcya deveśam bālakhilyaiḥ marīciṣaiḥ

translated: Where the goddess Surabhi created her own auspicious daughter Kapila,

analyzed: deva priya artham asṛjat hita artham jagataḥ tathā
translated: For the sake of pleasing the gods and for the welfare of the world,

original: tatra devahrade snātvā śaṃbhuṃ saṃpūjya bhaktitaḥ /
analyzed: tatra devahrade snātvā śaṃbhum saṃpūjya bhaktitaḥ
