analyzed: praṇataḥ smi dharādhāram sa me pāpam vyapohatu
translated: I bow to the support of the earth. May He remove my sins.
Keshava, with eyes like the moon and sun, the destroyer of Kamsa and Keshi,

original: praṇato 'smi mahābāhuṃ sa me pāpaṃ vyapohatu // / //
analyzed: praṇataḥ smi mahā bāhum sa me pāpam vyapohatu
translated: I bow to the mighty-armed one. May He remove my sins.
The one with the Shrivatsa mark on the chest, the lord of Shri, the supporter of Shri, the abode of Shri,

original: praṇato 'smi śriyaḥ kāntaṃ sa me pāpaṃ vyapohatu // / //
analyzed: praṇataḥ smi śriyaḥ kāntam sa me pāpam vyapohatu
translated: I bow to the beloved of Shri. May He remove my sins.

analyzed: yam īśam sarva bhūtānām dhyāyanti yatayaḥ kṣaram
translated: I have taken refuge in that imperishable Vāsudeva, whom the ascetics meditate upon as the Lord of all beings.

original: vāsudevamanirdeśyaṃ tamasmi śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / //🔽samastālambanebhyo yaṃ vyāvṛttya manaso gatim /
analyzed: vāsudevam anirdeśyam tam asmi śaraṇam gataḥ  samasta ālambanebhyaḥ yam vyāvṛttya manasaḥ gatim
translated: I have taken refuge in that Vāsudeva, who is beyond description, and in whom the darkness (of ignorance) has gone.

original: dhyāyanti vāsudevākhyaṃ tamasmi śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / //🔽sarvagaṃ sarvabhūtaṃ ca sarvasyādhāramīśvaram /
analyzed: dhyāyanti vāsudeva ākhyam tam asmi śaraṇam gataḥ  sarvagam sarva bhūtam ca sarvasya ādhāram īśvaram
translated: I have taken refuge in that Vāsudeva, whom the wise meditate upon as the object of the mind turned away from all other objects, and who is called Vāsudeva.

original: vāsudevaṃ paraṃ brahma tamasmi śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / //🔽paramātmānamavyaktaṃ yaṃ prayānti sumedhasaḥ /
analyzed: vāsudevam param brahma tam asmi śaraṇam gataḥ  paramātmānam avyaktam yam prayānti sumedhasaḥ
translated: I have taken refuge in that Vāsudeva, the Supreme Brahman, who is all-pervading, the soul of all, the support of all, and the Lord.

original: karmakṣaye 'kṣayaṃ devaṃ tamasmi śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / //🔽puṇyapāpavinirmuktā yaṃ praviśya punarbhavam /
analyzed: karma kṣaye kṣayam devam tam asmi śaraṇam gataḥ  puṇya pāpa vinirmuktāḥ yam praviśya punarbhavam
translated: I have taken refuge in that imperishable Supreme Self, into whom the wise enter at the end of their actions, and who is the imperishable God.

original: na yoginaḥ prāpnuvanti tamasmi śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / //🔽brahma bhūtvā jagat sarvaṃ sadevāsuramānuṣam /
analyzed: na yoginaḥ prāpnuvanti tam asmi śaraṇam gataḥ  brahma bhūtvā jagat sarvam sa deva asura mānuṣam
translated: I have taken refuge in that Vāsudeva, entering whom the yogis, free from merit and demerit, do not return to worldly existence.

original: yaḥ sṛjatyacyuto devastamasmi śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / //🔽brahmatve yasya vaktrebhyaścaturvedamayaṃ vapuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ sṛjati acyutaḥ devaḥ tam asmi śaraṇam gataḥ  brahmatve yasya vaktrebhyaḥ catur veda mayam vapuḥ
translated: I have taken refuge in that Acyuta, that God, who, becoming Brahman, creates the entire world with gods, demons, and humans.

original: prabhuḥ purātano jajñe tamasmi śaraṇaṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: prabhuḥ purātanaḥ jajñe tam asmi śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: I have taken refuge in that ancient Lord, from whose mouths the body consisting of the four Vedas was born in the beginning.

analyzed: brahma rūpa dharam devam jagadyoni janārdanam
translated: The god who assumes the form of Brahman, the womb of the universe, Janardana,

analyzed: sraṣṭṛ tve saṃsthitam sṛṣṭau praṇataḥ smi sanātanam
translated: I bow to the eternal one who is established in creation as the creator in creation.

analyzed: sraṣṭā bhūtvā sthitaḥ yogī sthitau asurasūdanaḥ
translated: Having become the creator, the yogi remains in existence, the slayer of demons,

analyzed: tam ādipuruṣam viṣṇum pramataḥ smi janārdanam
translated: I bow to that primordial being, Vishnu, Janardana.

original: dhṛtā mahī hatā daityāḥ paritrātāstathā surāḥ /
analyzed: dhṛtā mahī hatā daityāḥ paritrātāḥ tathā surāḥ
translated: The earth is supported, the demons are slain, and the gods are saved

analyzed: yena tam viṣṇum ādya īśam praṇataḥ smi janārdanam
translated: by whom, I bow to that Vishnu, the primordial lord, Janardana.

analyzed: yajñaiḥ yajanti yam viprāḥ yajñeśam yajña bhāvanam
translated: The Brahmins worship him with sacrifices, the lord of sacrifices, the creator of sacrifices,

analyzed: tam yajñapuruṣam viṣṇum praṇataḥ smi sanātanam
translated: I bow to that eternal Vishnu, the personified sacrifice.

analyzed: pātāla vīthī bhūta anu tathā lokān nihanti yaḥ
translated: And he who destroys the worlds that have become the streets of the nether regions,

analyzed: tam antapuruṣam rudram praṇataḥ smi sanātanam
translated: I bow to that eternal Rudra, the inner person.

analyzed: saṃbhakṣayitvā sakalam yathā sṛṣṭam idam jagat
translated: Having consumed this entire world as it was created,

original: yo vai nṛtyati rudrātmā praṇato 'smi janārdanam // / //
analyzed: yaḥ vai nṛtyati rudra ātmā praṇataḥ smi janārdanam
translated: I bow to Janardana, who dances as if he is Rudra.

analyzed: sura asurāḥ pitṛ gaṇāḥ yakṣa gandharva rākṣasāḥ
translated: The gods, demons, the hosts of ancestors, Yakshas, Gandharvas, and Rakshasas,

original: saṃbhūtā yasya devasya sarvagaṃ taṃ namāmyaham // / //
analyzed: saṃbhūtāḥ yasya devasya sarvagam tam namāmi aham
translated: I bow to that all-pervading god from whom they have originated.

analyzed: samasta devāḥ sakalāḥ manuṣyāṇām ca jātayaḥ
translated: All the gods and all the species of humans

analyzed: yasya aṃśa bhūtāḥ devasya sarvagam tam nataḥ
translated: Are partial manifestations of that all-pervading Lord. I bow to Him.

analyzed: vṛkṣa gulma ādayaḥ yasya tathā paśu mṛga ādayaḥ
translated: The trees, shrubs, and so on, as well as the animals, birds, and others,

analyzed: eka aṃśa bhūtā devasya sarvagam tam namāmi aham
translated: Are partial manifestations of that all-pervading Lord. I bow to Him.

original: yasmānnānyat paraṃ kiñcid yasmin sarvaṃ mahātmani /
analyzed: yasmāt na anyat param kiñcid yasmin sarvam mahātmani
translated: From whom there is nothing else higher, in whom everything rests,

analyzed: yaḥ sarva madhya gaḥ nantaḥ sarvagam tam namāmi aham
translated: The infinite one present in everything, I bow to that all-pervading Lord.

analyzed: yathā sarveṣu bhūteṣu gūḍhaḥ agniḥ iva dāruṣu
translated: Just as fire is hidden in wood in all beings,

analyzed: viṣṇuḥ evam tathā pāpam mama aśeṣam praṇaśyatu
translated: So may all my sins be destroyed, O Vishnu.

analyzed: yathā viṣṇu mayam sarvam sa carācaram
translated: Just as everything, from Brahma to the moving and unmoving world, is pervaded by Vishnu,

original: yacca jñānaparicchedyaṃ pāpaṃ naśyatu me tathā // / //
analyzed: yat ca jñāna paricchedyam pāpam naśyatu me tathā
translated: And whatever sin is to be destroyed by knowledge, may that be destroyed for me.

analyzed: śubha śubhāni karmāṇi rajaḥ sattva tamāṃsi ca
translated: Good and bad deeds, the qualities of rajas, sattva, and tamas,

original: anekajanmakarmotthaṃ pāpaṃ naśyatu me tathā // / //🔽yanniśāyāṃ ca yatprātaryanmadhyāhnāparāhṇayoḥ /
analyzed: aneka janma karma uttham pāpam naśyatu me tathā  yat niśāyām ca yat prātar yat madhyāhna aparāhṇayoḥ
translated: And the sins arising from actions in many births, may those be destroyed for me.🔽Whatever sins are committed during the night, in the morning, at midday, in the afternoon,

original: saṃdhyayośca kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ karmaṇā manasā girā // / //
analyzed: saṃdhyayoḥ ca kṛtam pāpam karmaṇā manasā girā
translated: During the two twilights, by action, thought, or word,

original: yat tiṣṭhatā yad vrajatā yacca śayyāgatena me /
analyzed: yat tiṣṭhatā yat vrajatā yat ca śayyā gatena me
translated: Whatever sinful act I have committed while standing, walking, or lying down,

original: kṛtaṃ yadaśubhaṃ karma kāyena manasā girā // / //
analyzed: kṛtam yat aśubham karma kāyena manasā girā
translated: Whatever inauspicious act I have done with body, mind, or speech,

analyzed: ajñānataḥ jñānataḥ vā madāt calita mānasaiḥ
translated: Whether out of ignorance or knowledge, or with a mind swayed by intoxication,

original: tat kṣipraṃ vilayaṃ yātu vāsudevasya kīrtanāt // / //
analyzed: tat kṣipram vilayam yātu vāsudevasya kīrtanāt
translated: May that quickly perish by the glorification of Vāsudeva.

analyzed: para dāra para dravya vāñchā droha udbhavam ca yat
translated: And whatever arises from desire for others' wives and wealth, or from malice,

analyzed: para pīḍā udbhavām nindām kurvatā yat mahātmanām
translated: And whatever slander I have uttered against great souls arising from harming others,

original: yacca bhojye tathā peye bhakṣye coṣye vilehane /
analyzed: yat ca bhojye tathā peye bhakṣye coṣye vilehane
translated: And whatever I have done in food, drink, edibles, and lickables,

original: tad yātu vilayaṃ toye yathā lavaṇabhājanam // / //🔽yad bālye yacca kaumāre yat pāpaṃ yauvane mama /
analyzed: tat yātu vilayam toye yathā lavaṇa bhājanam  yat bālye yat ca kaumāre yat pāpam yauvane mama
translated: May that perish in the water like a salt vessel.🔽Whatever sin I have committed in childhood, in youth, in my prime,

analyzed: vayaḥ pariṇatau yat ca yat ca janma ātare kṛtam
translated: And whatever I have done in my previous births,

analyzed: tat nārāyaṇa govinda hari kṛṣṇa īśa kīrtanāt
translated: By the glorification of Nārāyaṇa, Govinda, Hari, Kṛṣṇa, and Īśa,

original: prayātu vilayaṃ toye yathā lavaṇabhājanam // / //🔽viṣṇave vāsudevāya haraye keśavāya ca /🔽janārdanāya kṛṣṇāya namo bhūyo namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: prayātu vilayam toye yathā lavaṇa bhājanam  viṣṇave vāsudevāya haraye keśavāya ca  janārdanāya kṛṣṇāya namaḥ bhūyas namaḥ namaḥ
translated: May that perish in the water like a salt vessel.🔽Salutations again and again to Viṣṇu, Vāsudeva, Hari, Keśava,🔽Janārdana, and Kṛṣṇa.

analyzed: bhaviṣyat naraka ghnāya namaḥ kaṃsa vighātine
translated: Salutations to the future destroyer of hell, to the slayer of Kaṃsa,

analyzed: ariṣṭa keśi caṇūra deva ari kṣayiṇe namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the destroyer of Arishtas, Keshi, Chanura and Devaki's sons.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ baleḥ vañcayitā tvām ṛte vai bhaviṣyati
translated: Who else but you can deceive Bala?

original: ko 'nyo nāśayati balād darpaṃ haihayabhūpateḥ // / //🔽kaḥ kariṣyatyathānyo vai sāgare setubandhanam /
analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ nāśayati balāt darpam haihaya bhūpateḥ  kaḥ kariṣyati atha anyaḥ vai sāgare setu bandhanam
translated: Who else can forcibly destroy the pride of the Haihaya king?🔽Who else will build a bridge across the ocean?

analyzed: vadhiṣyati daśagrīvam kaḥ sa amātya puraḥsaram
translated: Who will kill Ravana along with his ministers and relatives?

analyzed: kaḥ tvām ṛte nyaḥ nandasya gokule ratim eṣyati
translated: Who else but you will find pleasure in Nanda's cowherds' colony?

analyzed: pralamba pūtanā ādīnām tvām ṛte madhusūdana
translated: O Madhusudana, who else but you will be the slayer or chastiser of Pralamba, Putana and others?

analyzed: nihantā api athabā śāstā devadeva bhaviṣyati
translated: O god of gods, who else but you will be the slayer or chastiser of Pralamba, Putana and others?

analyzed: japan evam naraḥ puṇyam vaiṣṇavam dharmam uttamam
translated: A man who recites this, attains the meritorious and excellent dharma of Vishnu.

analyzed: iṣṭa aniṣṭa prasaṃgebhyaḥ jñānataḥ vā
translated: Whether through the connection with the desirable or undesirable, or through knowledge or ignorance,

original: kṛtaṃ tena tu yat pāpaṃ saptajanmāntarāṇi vai /
analyzed: kṛtam tena tu yat pāpam sapta janma antarāṇi vai
translated: whatever sin he has committed in the course of seven rebirths,

original: mahāpātakasaṃjñaṃ vā tathā caivopapātakam // / //🔽jajñādīni ca puṇyāni japahomavratāni ca /
analyzed: mahāpātaka saṃjñam vā tathā ca eva upapātakam  jajña ādīni ca puṇyāni japa homa vratāni ca
translated: whether it be a major sin or a minor one,🔽and all the merits he has earned through Japa, Homa, vows and other rituals,

analyzed: nāśayet yoginām sarvam āma pātram iva ambhasi
translated: are destroyed by him, like water in a leaky vessel.

analyzed: naraḥ saṃvatsaram pūrṇam tila pātrāṇi ṣoḍaśa
translated: A man who offers sixteen pots of sesame seeds

analyzed: ahani ahani yaḥ dadyāt paṭhati etat ca tad samam
translated: One who recites this daily, obtains the same fruits as one who makes offerings daily.

analyzed: a vilupta brahmacaryam saṃprāpya smaraṇam hareḥ
translated: Having attained the memory of Hari, with unbroken celibacy,

analyzed: viṣṇu lokam avāpnoti satyam etat mayā uditam
translated: One attains the world of Vishnu. This is the truth I have spoken.

original: yathaitat stayamuktaṃ me na hyalpamapi me mṛṣā /
analyzed: yathā etat stayam uktam me na hi alpam api me mṛṣā
translated: As this truth has been spoken by me, there is not even a little falsehood in me.

analyzed: rākṣasaḥ trasta sarva aṅgam tathā mām eṣa muñcatu
translated: Let this Rakshasa release me with all his limbs trembling.

original: pulastya uvāca /🔽evamuccārite tena mukto viprastu rakṣasā /
analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca  evam uccārite tena muktaḥ vipraḥ tu rakṣasā
translated: Pulastya said:🔽When this was uttered by him, the Brahmana was released by the Rakshasa.

analyzed: akāmena dvijaḥ bhūyas tam āha rajanīcaram
translated: The Brahmana then spoke again to the night-walker without any desire.

analyzed: brahmaṇe uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: etad bhadra mayā khyātaṃ tava pātakanāśanam /
analyzed: etat bhadra mayā khyātam tava pātaka nāśanam
translated: O Bhadra, this destroyer of sins has been narrated to you by me,

analyzed: viṣṇoḥ sārasvatam stotram yat jagāda sarasvatī
translated: The hymn of Vishnu by Saraswati.

analyzed: hutāśanena prahitā mama jihvā agra saṃsthitā
translated: Sent by the fire god, it is present at the tip of my tongue.

original: jagādainaṃ stavaṃ viṣṇoḥ sarveṣāṃ copaśāntidam // / //🔽anenaiva jagannāthaṃ tvamārādhaya kesavam /
analyzed: jagāda enam stavam viṣṇoḥ sarveṣām ca upaśānti dam  anena eva jagannātham tvam ārādhaya kesavam
translated: It has spoken this hymn of Vishnu, which gives peace to all.🔽O Rakshasa, with this very hymn, worship the Lord of the world, Keshava.

original: tataḥ śāpāpanodaṃ tu stute lapsyasi keśave // / //
analyzed: tatas śāpa apanodam tu stute lapsyasi keśave
translated: Then, when Keshava is praised, you will get relief from the curse.

analyzed: aharniśam hṛṣīkeśam stavena anena rākṣasa
translated: O Rakshasa, day and night, praise Hrishikesha with this hymn.

original: stuhi bhaktiṃ dṛḍhāṃ kṛtvā tataḥ pāpād vimokṣyase // / //
analyzed: stuhi bhaktim dṛḍhām kṛtvā tatas pāpāt vimokṣyase
translated: Then you will be freed from sin.

analyzed: stutaḥ hi sarva pāpāni nāśayiṣyati asaṃśayam
translated: For, when praised, he will undoubtedly destroy all sins.

original: stuto hi bhaktyā nṝṇāṃ vai sarvapāpaharo hariḥ // / //
analyzed: stutaḥ hi bhaktyā nṝṇām vai sarva pāpa haraḥ hariḥ
translated: For, when praised with devotion, Hari, the remover of all sins of men,

original: pulastya uvāca /🔽tataḥ praṇamya taṃ vipraṃ prasādya sa niśācaraḥ /
analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca  tatas praṇamya tam vipram prasādya sa niśācaraḥ
translated: Pulastya said:🔽Then, bowing to that brahmin and pleasing him, the night wanderer

analyzed: tadā eva tapase śrīmān śālagrāmam agāt vaśī
translated: Immediately went to Shala grama for austerity, the prosperous and self-controlled one.

original: aharniśaṃ sa evainaṃ japan sārasvataṃ stavam /
analyzed: aharniśam saḥ eva enam japan sārasvatam stavam
translated: Meditating on this Sarasvatam Stuti day and night,

analyzed: deva kriyā ratiḥ bhūtvā tapaḥ tepe niśācaraḥ
translated: The night wanderer, becoming devoted to divine deeds, performed austerities.

analyzed: samārādhya jagannātham sa tatra puraṣa uttamam
translated: Having propitiated the Lord of the universe, the best of men there,

analyzed: sarva pāpa vinirmuktaḥ viṣṇu lokam avāptavān
translated: He, being freed from all sins, attained Vishnu's world.

original: etat te kathitaṃ brahman viṣṇoḥ sārasvataṃ stavam /
analyzed: etat te kathitam brahman viṣṇoḥ sārasvatam stavam
translated: This, O Brahmin, is told to you, the Sarasvatam Stuti of Vishnu,

analyzed: vipra vaktra sthayā samyak sarasvatyā samīritam
translated: Properly recited by Sarasvati residing in the mouth of the brahmin.

original: ya etat paramaṃ stotraṃ vāsudevasya mānavaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ etat paramam stotram vāsudevasya mānavaḥ
translated: The man who will recite this supreme hymn of Vasudeva,

original: paṭhaṣyati sa sarvebhyaḥ pāpebhyo mokṣamāpsyati // / //🔽iti śrīvāmanapurāṇe ekonaṣaṣṭitamo 'dhyāyaḥ
analyzed: paṭhaṣyati sa sarvebhyaḥ pāpebhyaḥ mokṣam āpsyati 🔽iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe ekonaṣaṣṭitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Will attain liberation from all sins.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: namaḥ te stu jagannātha devadevam namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O Lord of the universe, salutations to you, O Lord of gods.

analyzed: vāsudeva namaḥ te stu bahu rūpa namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O Vāsudeva, salutations to you, O multi-formed one.

analyzed: ekaśṛṅga namaḥ tubhyam namaḥ tubhyam vṛṣākape
translated: Salutations to you, O single-peaked one, salutations to you, O Vṛṣākapi.

analyzed: śrīnivāsa namaḥ te stu namaḥ te bhūtabhāvana
translated: Salutations to you, O abode of Shri, salutations to you, O creator of beings.

analyzed: viṣvaksena namaḥ tubhyam nārāyaṇa namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O Viṣvaksena, salutations to you, O Nārāyaṇa.

analyzed: dhruva dhvaja namastas stu satya dhvaja namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O firm-bannered one, salutations to you, O truth-bannered one.

analyzed: yajña dhvaja namaḥ tubhyam dharma dhvaja namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O sacrifice-bannered one, salutations to you, O dharma-bannered one.

analyzed: tāla dhvaja namaḥ te stu namaḥ te garuha dhvaja
translated: Salutations to you, O palm-bannered one, salutations to you, O Garuḍa-bannered one.

analyzed: vareṇya viṣṇo vaikuṇṭha namaḥ te puruṣottama
translated: O excellent one, O Viṣṇu, O Vaikuṇṭha, salutations to you, O Supreme Being.

analyzed: namaḥ jayanta vijaya jaya ananta parājita
translated: Salutations to you, O conqueror, O victorious, O victorious, O infinite, O vanquished.

analyzed: kṛtāvarta da mahā āvarta mahādeva namaḥ stu te
translated: O great one, O great whirl, O great god, salutations to you.

original: anādyādyanta madhyānta namaste padmajapriya // / //🔽purañjaya namastubhyaṃ śatruñjaya namo 'stu te /
analyzed: anādi ādi anta madhya anta namaḥ te padmaja priya  purañjaya namaḥ tubhyam śatruñjaya namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O beginningless, middleless, endless one, O lotus-born one's beloved.🔽Salutations to you, O conqueror of cities, salutations to you, O conqueror of enemies.

analyzed: śubhañjaya namaḥ te stu namaḥ te stu dhanañjaya
translated: Salutations to you, O conqueror of auspiciousness, salutations to you, O conqueror of wealth.

analyzed: sṛṣṭi garbha namaḥ tubhyam śuciśravaḥ vṛthuśravaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the embryo of creation, of pure fame, of extensive fame,

original: namo hiraṇyagarbhāya padmagarbhāya te namaḥ // / //🔽namaḥ kamalanetrāya kālanetrāya te namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ hiraṇyagarbhāya padmagarbhāya te namaḥ  namaḥ kamala netrāya kāla netrāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to Hiranyagarbha, salutations to you, the lotus-womb.🔽Salutations to the lotus-eyed one, salutations to you, the black-eyed one.

analyzed: kālanābha namaḥ tubhyam mahānābha namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the navel of time, salutations again and again to the great navel.

analyzed: vṛṣṭi mūla mahā mūla mūla āvāsa namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, the rain-rooted, the great-rooted, the abode of roots.

analyzed: dharmāvāsa jala āvāsa śrīnivāsa namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, the abode of Dharma, the abode of water, the abode of Shri.

analyzed: dharma adhyakṣa prajā adhyakṣa loka adhyakṣa namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the overseer of Dharma, the overseer of people, the overseer of the worlds.

analyzed: senā adhyakṣa namaḥ tubhyam kāla adhyakṣa namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the commander-in-chief, salutations again and again to the overseer of time.

analyzed: gadā dhara śruti dhara cakra dhārin śriyaḥ dhara
translated: Bearer of the mace, bearer of the Vedas, wielder of the discus, supporter of Shri,

analyzed: vanamālā dhara hare namaḥ te dharaṇīdhara
translated: Bearer of the garland of forest flowers, Hari, salutations to you, supporter of the earth.

analyzed: ārciṣeṇa mahā sena namaḥ te stu puruṣṭuta
translated: To the one with a banner of flames, to the great army, salutations to you, much praised.

analyzed: vahu kalpa mahā kalpa namaḥ te kalpanāmukha
translated: To the one of many kalpas, to the great kalpa, salutations to you, the face of imagination.

original: sarvātman sarvaga vibho viriñce śveta keśava /
analyzed: sarvātman sarvaga vibho viriñce śveta keśava
translated: To the all-souled one, the all-pervading lord, to the creator, to the white-haired one,

original: nīla rakta mahānīla aniruddha namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: nīla rakta mahānīla aniruddha namaḥ stu te
translated: To the blue, the red, the great blue, to Aniruddha, salutations to you.

analyzed: dvādaśa ātmaka kāla ātman sāma ātman parama ātmaka
translated: You who are of the nature of the twelve, of the nature of time, of the nature of Sama (chanting), of the nature of the supreme self,

analyzed: vyomaka ātmaka su brahman bhūta ātmaka namaḥ stu te
translated: Of the nature of the sky, of the nature of the good Brahman, of the nature of the elements, salutations to you.

analyzed: harikeśa mahākeśa guḍākeśa namaḥ stu te
translated: Harikesha, Mahakesha, Gudakesha, salutations to you.

analyzed: muñjakeśa hṛṣīkeśa sarvanātha mano stu te
translated: Munjakesha, Hrishikesha, lord of all, salutations to your mind.

analyzed: sukṣma sthūla mahā sthūla mahā sūkṣma śubhaṅkara
translated: Subtle, gross, very gross, very subtle, auspicious,

analyzed: śveta pīta ambara dhara nīla vāsa namaḥ stu te
translated: Wearing white and yellow garments, wearing blue garments, salutations to you.

analyzed: kuśeśaya namaḥ te stu sīra dhvaja naja ardhana
translated: Kusha flower, salutations to you, Sridhvaja, Janardana,

analyzed: govinda prīti kartā ca haṃsa pītāmbara priya
translated: Govinda, the delighter, the swan, the lover of yellow garments.

analyzed: adhokṣaja namaḥ tubhyam sīra dhvaja janārdana
translated: Adhokshaja, salutations to you, Sridhvaja, Janardana,

analyzed: vāmanāya namaḥ te stu namaḥ te madhusūdana
translated: Salutations to you, Vamana, salutations to you, Madhusudana.

analyzed: sahasra śīrṣāya namaḥ brahma śīrṣāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the thousand-headed one, salutations to you, the Brahman-headed one.

analyzed: namaḥ sahasranetrāya soma sūrya anala ikṣama
translated: Salutations to the thousand-eyed one, the one with eyes of the moon, sun, and fire.

analyzed: namaḥ ca atharvaśirase mahā śīrṣāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the head of the Atharva Veda, salutations to you, the great-headed one.

analyzed: namaḥ te dharma netrāya mahā netrāya te namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the one with dharma as your eye, salutations to you, the one with the great eye.

analyzed: namaḥ sahasra pādāya sahasra bhuja manyave
translated: Salutations to the thousand-footed one, the one with a thousand arms and eyes.

original: namo yajñavarāhāya mahārūpāya te namaḥ // / //🔽namaste viśvadevāya viśvātman viśvasaṃbhava /
analyzed: namaḥ yajñavarāhāya mahārūpāya te namaḥ  namaḥ te viśvadevāya viśvātman viśva saṃbhava
translated: Salutations to the Boar form of Vishnu, the great form of Vishnu.🔽Salutations to you, the god of the universe, the soul of the universe, the origin of the universe.

analyzed: viśvarūpa namaḥ te stu tvattaḥ viśvam abhūt idam
translated: Salutations to you, the one with the form of the universe, from you has this universe come into being.

analyzed: nyagrodha stavam mahā śākhaḥ tvam mūla kusuma arcitaḥ
translated: The banyan tree is you, with great branches, worshipped at the root and with flowers.

analyzed: skandha patra aṅkura latā pallavāya namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, the one with trunks, leaves, sprouts, creepers and shoots.

original: mūlaṃ te brāhmaṇā brahman skandhaste kṣatriyordiśaḥ /
analyzed: mūlam te brāhmaṇāḥ brahman skandhaḥ te
translated: O Brahman, the Brahmins are your root, the Kshatriyas are your trunk and the directions.

analyzed: nābhyāḥ hi abhūt antarikṣam śaśāṅkaḥ manasaḥ tava
translated: The sky was born from your navel, the moon from your mind.

original: brāhmaṇāḥ sāgnayo vaktrāḥ derdaṇḍāḥ sāyudhā nṛpāḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ sa agnayaḥ vaktrāḥ derdaṇḍāḥ sa āyudhāḥ nṛpāḥ
translated: The Brahmins with fire are your faces, the kings with staffs and weapons are your arms.

analyzed: pārśvāt viśaḥ ca īru yugāt jātāḥ śūdrāḥ ca pādataḥ
translated: The Vaishyas were born from the sides, the Shudras from the feet.

original: netrād bhānurabhūt tubhyaṃ padbhyāṃ bhūḥ śrotrayordiśaḥ /
analyzed: netrāt bhānuḥ abhūt tubhyam padbhyām bhūḥ śrotrayoḥ diśaḥ
translated: The sun was born from your eyes, the earth from your feet, the directions from your ears.

analyzed: nābhyāḥ hi abhūt antarikṣam śaśāṅkaḥ manasaḥ tava
translated: The sky was born from your navel, the moon from your mind.

original: prāṇād vāyuḥ samabhavat kāmād brahmā pitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇāt vāyuḥ samabhavat kāmāt brahmā pitāmahaḥ
translated: From your breath, the wind was born, from your desire, Brahma, the grandfather.

original: krodhāt trinayano rudraḥ śīrṣṇoḥ dyauḥ samavartata // / //
analyzed: krodhāt trinayanaḥ rudraḥ śīrṣṇoḥ dyauḥ samavartata
translated: From your anger, the three-eyed Rudra, from your head, the sky came into being.

analyzed: indra agnī vadanāt tubhyam paśavaḥ mala saṃbhavāḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, the animals born from your mouth are the source of impurity.

analyzed: oṣadhyaḥ roma saṃbhūtāḥ virājaḥ tvam namaḥ stu te
translated: The herbs born from your hair are the source of prosperity. Salutations to you.

analyzed: puṣpa hāsa namaḥ te stu mahā hāsa namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O one with a smiling face, salutations to you, O one with a great smile.

original: oṅkārastvaṃ vaṣaṭkāro vauṣaṭ tvaṃ ca svadhā sudhā // / //
analyzed: oṅkāraḥ tvam vaṣaṭkāraḥ vauṣaṭ tvam ca svadhā sudhā
translated: You are the syllable Om, the exclamation Vashat, the exclamation Vaushat, and the offering of oblations to the manes and the gods.

analyzed: svāhākāra namaḥ tubhyam hantakāra namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O exclamation Svaha, salutations to you, O exclamation Hantum.

analyzed: sarva ākāra nirākāra veda ākāra namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O one with all forms, O formless one, O one with the form of the Vedas.

analyzed: tvam hi veda mayaḥ devaḥ sarva deva mayaḥ tathā
translated: You are indeed the god full of the Vedas, and likewise full of all gods,

analyzed: sarva tīrtha mayaḥ ca eva sarva yajña mayaḥ tathā
translated: Full of all holy places, and full of all sacrifices.

analyzed: namaḥ te yajñapuruṣa yajña bhāga bhuje namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, O personified sacrifice, O enjoyer of the share in the sacrifice.

original: namaḥ sahasradhārāya śatadhārāya te namaḥ // / //🔽bhīrbhuvaḥsvaḥsvarūpāya godāyāmṛtadāyine /
analyzed: namaḥ sahasra dhārāya śata dhārāya te namaḥ  bhīḥ bhuvaḥ svar svarūpāya go dāya amṛta dāyine
translated: Salutations to you, O one with a thousand streams, salutations to you, O one with a hundred streams.🔽Salutations to you, O one whose form is the three worlds, Bhurbhuvaḥsvaḥ, O giver of immortality,

original: suvarṇabrahmadātre ca sarvadātre ca te namaḥ // / //🔽brahmeśāya namastubhyaṃ brahmāde brahmarūpadhṛk /
analyzed: suvarṇa brahma dātre ca sarva dātre ca te namaḥ  brahma īśāya namaḥ tubhyam brahma āde brahma rūpa dhṛk
translated: O giver of the golden Brahman, O giver of everything, salutations to you.🔽Salutations to you, O Brahman, O Ishvara, O Brahman, O one who holds the form of Brahman,

analyzed: para brahma namaḥ te stu śabdabrahma namaḥ stu te
translated: Salutations to you, O supreme Brahman, salutations to you, O Brahman in the form of sound.

analyzed: vidyāḥ tvam vedya rūpaḥ tvam vedanīyaḥ tvam eva ca
translated: You are the knowledge, you are the form of the knowable, and you are the object of knowledge.

original: buddhistvamapi bodhyaśca bodhastvaṃ ca namo 'stu te // / //🔽hotā homaśca havyaṃ ca hūyamānaścahavyāvāṭ /
analyzed: buddhiḥ tvam api bodhyaḥ ca bodhaḥ tvam ca namaḥ stu te  hotā homaḥ ca havyam ca hūyamānaḥ ca havyāvāṭ
translated: You are the intellect, and you are the object of knowledge, and you are the enlightenment. Salutations to you.🔽You are the offerer, the offering, the oblation, and the one who is being offered, and the recipient of oblations.

original: pātā potā ca putaśca pāvanīyaśca oṃ namaḥ // / //
analyzed: pātā potā ca putaḥ ca pāvanīyaḥ ca om namaḥ
translated: You are the protector, the one to be protected, the one who is protected, and the purifier. Om, salutations to you.

original: hantā ca hanyamānaś ca hrimāṇastvameva ca /
analyzed: hantā ca hanyamānaḥ ca hrimāṇaḥ tvam eva ca
translated: You are the slayer, the one being slain, and the one who is ashamed.

original: harttā netā ca nītiśca pūjyo 'gryo viśvadhāryasi // / //
analyzed: harttā netā ca nītiḥ ca pūjyaḥ gryaḥ viśva dhārī asi
translated: You are the taker, the leader, the policy, the one to be worshipped, the foremost, and the supporter of the universe.

analyzed: sruc sruvau para dhāmā asi kapāla ulūkhalaḥ raṇiḥ
translated: You are the sacrificial ladle, the spoon, the supreme abode, the skull, the mortar, and the churning stick.

analyzed: yajña pātrāṇeyaḥ tvam ekadhā bahudhā tridhā
translated: You are the sacrificial vessels, sometimes one, sometimes many, sometimes three.

analyzed: yajñaḥ tvam yajamānaḥ tvam īḍyaḥ tvam asi yājakaḥ
translated: You are the sacrifice, you are the sacrificer, you are the one to be worshipped, and you are the priest.

original: jñātā jñeyastathā jñānaṃ dhyeyo dhyātāsi ceśvara // / //
analyzed: jñātā jñeyaḥ tathā jñānam dhyeyaḥ dhyātāsi ca īśvara
translated: You are the knower, the object of knowledge, the knowledge, and the meditation, O Lord.

original: dhyānayogaśca yogī ca gatirmokṣo dhṛtiḥ sukham /
analyzed: dhyāna yogaḥ ca yogī ca gatiḥ mokṣaḥ dhṛtiḥ sukham
translated: You are the yoga of meditation, the yogi, the goal, liberation, patience, and happiness.

analyzed: yoga aṅgāni tvam īśānaḥ sarvagaḥ tvam namaḥ stu te
translated: You are the limbs of yoga, the Lord, and the all-pervading. Salutations to you.

original: brahma hotā tathodgātā sāma yūpo 'ta dakṣiṇā /
analyzed: brahma hotā tathā udgātā sāma dakṣiṇā
translated: You are Brahma, the Hotar priest, the Udgata priest, the Sama Veda, the sacrificial post, and the sacrificial fee.

original: dīkṣā tvaṃ tvaṃ puroḍāśastvaṃ paśuḥ paśuvāhyasi // / //
analyzed: dīkṣā tvam tvam puroḍāśaḥ tvam paśuḥ paśu vāhī asi
translated: You are the initiation, the sacrificial cake, and the animal to be sacrificed. You are the one who takes the animal for sacrifice.

original: guhyo dhātā ca paramaḥ śivo nārāyaṇastathā /
analyzed: guhyaḥ dhātā ca paramaḥ śivaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ tathā
translated: You are the secret creator, the supreme, Shiva, and Narayana.
You are the great people, the one in hell, and have the form of a thousand suns and moons.

analyzed: dvādaśa araḥ tha
translated: You have twelve spokes, six naves, three sections, and two wheels.

analyzed: kālacakraḥ bhavān īśaḥ namaḥ te puruṣottamaḥ
translated: You are the wheel of time, the lord of Bhavानी, I bow to you, the best of men.

analyzed: parākramaḥ vikramaḥ tvam hayagrīvaḥ hari īśvaraḥ
translated: You are valor, you are valor, you are Hayagriva, the lord of monkeys.

analyzed: brahma īśaḥ sūrya īśaḥ tvam namaḥ stu te
translated: You are the lord of men, the lord of Brahma, the lord of the sun, I offer salutations to you.
You are the horse-faced one, the great sage, Shambhu, Shakra, the wind god.

analyzed: mitrāvaruṇa mūrtiḥ tvam amūrtiḥ anaghaḥ paraḥ
translated: You are the form of Mitra and Varuna, you are formless, sinless, and supreme.

analyzed: prāc vaṃśa kāyaḥ bhūtādiḥ mahābhūtaḥ cyutaḥ dvijaḥ
translated: You are the body of the eastern beam, the beginning of beings, the great element, the unfallen one, the twice-born.

original: tvamūrdhvakarttā ūrdhvaś ca ūrdhvaretā namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: tvam ūrdhva karttā ūrdhvaḥ ca ūrdhvaretāḥ namaḥ stu te
translated: You are the one who acts above, you are above, you are the one with upward-moving semen, I offer salutations to you.

analyzed: mahāpātaka hā tvam ca upapātaka hā tathā
translated: You are the destroyer of great sins, and also the destroyer of minor sins.

analyzed: anīśaḥ sarva pāpebhyaḥ tvām aham śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: I am helpless before all sins, I have taken refuge in you.

analyzed: iti etat paramam stotram sarva pāpa pramocanam
translated: This is the supreme hymn, which liberates from all sins.

analyzed: maheśvareṇa kathitam vārāṇasyām purā mune
translated: It was spoken by Maheshavara in Varanasi in ancient times, O sage.

analyzed: keśavasya agratas gatvā snātvā tīrthe sitodake
translated: Having gone in front of Keshava and bathed in the tirtha of white water,

analyzed: upaśāntaḥ tathā jātaḥ rudraḥ pāpa vaśāt tatas
translated: Rudra became tranquil due to the power of sin.

original: etat pavitraṃ tripuradhnabhāṣitaṃ paṭhan naro viṣṇuparo maharṣe /
analyzed: etat pavitram tripura dhna bhāṣitam paṭhan naraḥ viṣṇu paraḥ mahā ṛṣe
translated: O great sage, the man who recites this sacred hymn spoken by the destroyer of Tripura, being devoted to Vishnu,

analyzed: vimukta pāpaḥ hi upaśānta mūrti saṃpūjyate deva varaiḥ prasiddhaiḥ
translated: becomes free from sins, his form tranquil, and is worshipped by the most famous gods.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe ṣaṣṭhitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixty-sixth chapter in the Vamana Purana-Mahatmya.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: dvitīyaṃ pāpaśamanaṃ stavaṃ vakṣyāmi te mune /
analyzed: dvitīyam pāpa śamanam stavam vakṣyāmi te mune
translated: O sage, I will tell you the second hymn that removes sins,

original: yena samyagadhītena pāpaṃ nāśaṃ tu gaccati // / //
analyzed: yena samyak adhītena pāpam nāśam tu gaccati
translated: by reciting which properly, sin goes to destruction.

original: matsyaṃ namasye deveśaṃ kūrmaṃ govindameva ca /
analyzed: matsyam namasye deveśam kūrmam govindam eva ca
translated: I pay homage to the fish, the lord of gods, to the tortoise, to Govinda,

analyzed: hayaśīrṣam namaḥ te haṃ bhavam viṣṇum trivikramam
translated: I pay homage to the horse-headed one, to you, to Bhava, to Vishnu, to the three-striding one.

analyzed: namasye mādhava īśānau hṛṣīkaśa kumāriṇau
translated: I pay homage to Madhava and Isana, the two youthful lords of the senses,

analyzed: nārāyaṇam namasye haṃ namasye garuḍa āsanam
translated: I pay homage to Narayana, I pay homage to the one seated on Garuda.

analyzed: ūrdhvakeśam nṛsiham ca rupadhāram kurudhvajam
translated: I pay homage to the one with upward-streaming hair, to Narasimha, to the one bearing the form, to the one with the Kuru flag,

analyzed: kāmapālam akhaṇḍam ca namasye brāhmaṇapriyam
translated: I pay homage to the protector of love, to the unbroken one, to the one who is dear to Brahmins.

analyzed: ajitam viśvakarmāṇam puṇḍarīkam dvija priyam
translated: I bow to Ajita (the unconquered), the creator of the universe, the lotus-born, the beloved of the Brahmanas,

original: haṃsaṃ śaṃbhuṃ namasye ca brahmāṇaṃ saprajāpatim // / //
analyzed: haṃsam śaṃbhum namasye ca brahmāṇam sa prajāpatim
translated: The swan, the auspicious one, and to Brahma with Prajapati.

original: namasye śūlabāhuṃ ca devaṃ cakradharaṃ tathā /
analyzed: namasye śūlabāhum ca devam cakradharam tathā
translated: I bow to the one with the trident in his hand, and to the god holding the discus,

analyzed: śivam viṣṇum suvarṇa akṣam gopatim pīta vāsasam
translated: Shiva, Vishnu, the golden-eyed one, the lord of cows, the one clad in yellow garments.

original: namasye ca gadāpāṇiṃ namasye ca kuśośayam /
analyzed: namasye ca gadā pāṇim namasye ca kuśa uśayam
translated: I bow to the one with the mace in his hand, and to the one lying on the kusha grass.

original: ardhanārīśvaraṃ devaṃ namasye pāpanāśanam // / //🔽gopālaṃ ca saivakuṇṭhaṃ namasye cāparājitam /
analyzed: ardhanārīśvaram devam namasye pāpa nāśanam  gopālam ca saivakuṇṭham namasye ca aparājitam
translated: I bow to the god who is half-woman, the destroyer of sins.🔽I bow to the cowherd, the one with a limp, the unconquered one.

analyzed: namasye viśvarūpam ca saugandhim sarvadāśivam
translated: I bow to the one with the universe as his form, to Saugandhi, always auspicious.

analyzed: pāñcālikam hayagrīvam svayambhuvam amara īśvaram
translated: I bow to Panchalika, Hayagriva, the self-existent one, the lord of the immortals,

original: namasye puṣkarākṣaṃ ca payogandhiṃ ca keśavam // / //🔽avimuktaṃ ca lolaṃ ca jyeṣṭheyaṃ madhyamaṃ tathā /
analyzed: namasye puṣkarākṣam ca payaḥ gandhim ca keśavam  avimuktam ca lolam ca jyeṣṭheyam madhyamam tathā
translated: The lotus-eyed one, and to Keshava who smells like a cow's foot.🔽I bow to Avimukta, Lolla, Jyeshtha, this middle one,

analyzed: upaśāntam tamasye ham mārkaṇḍeyam sa jambukam
translated: And to Upashanta, Tamasya, Markandeya with the jackal.

analyzed: namasye padmakiraṇam namasye vaḍavāmukham
translated: I bow to the one with rays like lotuses, I bow to the one with a mouth like a mare.

analyzed: kārttikeyam namasye haṃ vāhlīkam śikhinam tathā
translated: I bow to Kartikeya, the one from Bahlika, the one with a tuft of hair.

analyzed: namasye sthāṇum anagham namasye vanamālinam
translated: I bow to Sthanu, the sinless one, I bow to the one with a garland of forest flowers.

original: namasye lāṅgalīśaṃ ca namasye 'haṃ śriyaḥ patim // / //🔽namasye ca trinayanaṃ namasye havyavāhanam /🔽namasye ca trisauvarṇaṃ namasye śaśibhūṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: namasye lāṅgalīśam ca namasye haṃ śriyaḥ patim  namasye ca trinayanam namasye havyavāhanam  namasye ca tri sauvarṇam namasye śaśibhūṣaṇam
translated: I bow to the lord of the plough, I bow to the lord of Shri.🔽I bow to the three-eyed one, I bow to the bearer of oblations.🔽I bow to the one made of three golds, I bow to the one adorned with the moon.

analyzed: triṇāciketam brahma īśam namasye śaśibhūṣaṇam
translated: I bow to the one who knows the three Vedas, to the lord of Brahma, to the one adorned with the moon.

original: kapardinaṃ namasye ca sarvāmayavināśanam // / //🔽namasye śaśinaṃ sūryaṃ dhruvaṃ raudraṃ mahaujasam /
analyzed: kapardinam namasye ca sarva āmaya vināśanam  namasye śaśinam sūryam dhruvam raudram mahā ojasam
translated: I bow to the one with matted locks, the destroyer of all diseases.🔽I bow to the moon, the sun, the pole star, Rudra of great prowess.

analyzed: padmanābham hiraṇyākṣam namasye skandam avyayam
translated: I bow to the lotus-naveled one, the golden-eyed one, to Skanda, the imperishable one.

analyzed: namasye bhīma haṃsau ca namasye hāṭakeśvaram
translated: I bow to Bhima and Hamsa, I bow to Hatakeshvara.

original: sadā haṃsaṃ namasye ca namasye prāmatarpaṇam // / //
analyzed: sadā haṃsam namasye ca namasye prāma tarpaṇam
translated: I always bow to Hamsa, I bow to the one who satisfies the desires of all.

analyzed: namasye rukmakavacam mahā yoginam īśvaram
translated: I bow to the one with golden armor, to the great yogi, to the lord.

analyzed: namasye śrīnivāsam ca namasye puruṣottamam
translated: I bow to Srinivasa, I bow to Purushottama.

analyzed: tatas samāgaccati vāsudeve mahī cakampe girayaḥ ca celuḥ
translated: Then, when Vasudeva was coming, the earth trembled and the mountains shook,

original: kṣubdhāḥ samudrā śrīvāmanapurāṇaṃ pulastya uvāca /🔽tataḥ samāgaccati vāsudeve mahī cakampe girayaśca celuḥ /
analyzed: kṣubdhāḥ samudrā  tatas samāgaccati vāsudeve mahī cakampe girayaḥ ca celuḥ
translated: The oceans were agitated. Pulastya said:🔽Then, when Vasudeva arrived, the earth trembled and the mountains shook.

original: kṣubdhāḥ samudrā divi ṛkṣamaṇḍalo babhau viparyastagatirmaharṣe // / //
analyzed: kṣubdhāḥ samudrāḥ divi ṛkṣa maṇḍalaḥ babhau viparyasta gatiḥ mahā ṛṣe
translated: The oceans were agitated, and the constellation in the sky appeared with a reversed course, O great sage.

original: yajñaḥ samāgāt paramākulatvaṃ na vedmi kiṃ me madhuhā kariṣyati /
analyzed: yajñaḥ samāgāt parama ākula tvam na vedmi kim me madhuhā kariṣyati
translated: The sacrifice became extremely confused. I do not know what the slayer of Madhu will do to me.

original: yathā pradagdho 'smi maheśvareṇa kiṃ māṃ na saṃdhakṣyayati vāsudevaḥ // / //🔽ṛksāmamantrāhutibhirhutābhirvitānakīyān jvalanāstu bhāgān /
analyzed: yathā pradagdhaḥ smi maheśvareṇa kim mām na saṃdhakṣyayati vāsudevaḥ  ṛk sāma mantra āhutibhiḥ hutābhiḥ vitānakīyān jvalana astu bhāgān
translated: As I have been burned by Mahesvara, will not Vasudeva consume me?

original: bhaktyā dvijendrarapi saṃprapāditān naiva pratīccanti vibhorbhayena // / //
analyzed: bhaktyā saṃprapāditān nā eva vibhoḥ bhayena
translated: The flames, offered oblations of the Rig, Sama and Mantra hymns, and the portions offered by the best of Brahmins with devotion, do not accept them, out of fear of the Lord.

analyzed: tān dṛṣṭvā ghora rupān tu utpātān dānava īśvaraḥ
translated: Seeing those terrible portents, the lord of the demons,

analyzed: papraccha uśanasam śukram praṇipatya kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: bowing down with folded hands, asked Ushanas Shukra:

original: kimarthamācārya mahī saśailā rambheva vātābhihatā cacāla /
analyzed: kimartham ācārya mahī sa śailā rambhā iva vāta abhihatā cacāla
translated: O teacher, why does the earth with its mountains tremble, like a plantain tree struck by the wind?

original: kimāsurīyān suhutānapīha bhāgān na gṛhṇanti hutāśanāśca // / //
analyzed: kim āsurīyān su hutān api iha bhāgān na gṛhṇanti hutāśanāḥ ca
translated: And why do the sacrificial fires not accept the oblations offered to them, even though they are well-cooked?

original: kṣubdhāḥ kimarthaṃ makarālayāśca bho ṛkṣā na khe kiṃ pracaranti pūrvavat /
analyzed: kṣubdhāḥ kimartham makara ālayāḥ ca bho ṛkṣāḥ na khe kim pracaranti pūrvavat
translated: Why are the oceans agitated? Why do not the stars move in the sky as before?

original: diśaḥ kimarthaṃ tamasā pariplutā doṣeṇa kasyādya vadasva me guro // / //
analyzed: diśaḥ kimartham tamasā pariplutāḥ doṣeṇa kasya adya vadasva me guro
translated: Why are the quarters enveloped in darkness? For what fault do you tell me today, O Guru?

analyzed: pulstyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: śukraḥ tat vākyam ākarṇya virocana suta īritam
translated: Hearing those words spoken by Virochana's son, Shukra,

original: atha jñātvā kāraṇaṃ ca baliṃ vacanamabravīt // / //
analyzed: atha jñātvā kāraṇam ca balim vacanam abravīt
translated: and knowing the reason, spoke these words to Bali:

analyzed: śukraḥ uvāca
translated: Shukra said:

original: śṛṇuṣva daityeśvara yena bhāgān nāmī pratīcchanti hi āsurīyān /
analyzed: śṛṇuṣva daitya īśvara yena bhāgān nāmī pratīcchanti hi āsurīyān
translated: Listen, O lord of demons, for what reason the fires accept the offerings of the demons.

original: hutāśanā mantrahutānapīha nūnaṃ samāgacchati vāsudevaḥ // / //🔽tadaṅghrivikṣepamapārayantī mahī saśailā calitā ditīśa /
analyzed: hutāśanāḥ mantra hutān api iha nūnam samāgacchati vāsudevaḥ  tad aṅghri vikṣepam a pārayantī mahī sa śailā calitā ditīśa
translated: Indeed, Vasudeva has come here, to whom the fires offer oblations with mantras.🔽O lord of demons, the earth, unable to bear the shaking of his feet, with its mountains, has moved.

original: tasyāṃ calatyāṃ makarālayāmī udvṛttavelā ditijādya jātāḥ // / //
analyzed: tasyām calatyām makara ālayā amī udvṛtta velāḥ ditija adya jātāḥ
translated: When it moves, the oceans, with their shores agitated, have become turbulent from the beginning, O son of Diti.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: śukrasya vacanam śrutvā baliḥ bhārgavam abravīt
translated: Hearing the words of Shukra, Bali spoke to the son of Bhrigu:

original: dharmaṃ satyaṃ ca pathyaṃ ca sarvotsāhasamīritam // / //
analyzed: dharmam satyam ca pathyam ca sarva utsāha samīritam
translated: Truth, righteousness, and wholesome advice, all inspired by enthusiasm,

analyzed: baliḥ uvāca
translated: Bali said:🔽 O Shukra, tell me the means by which I can defeat Vishnu in battle.

original: āyāte vāsudeve vada mama bhagavan dharmakāmarthattattvaṃ kiṃ kāryaṃ kiṃ ca deyaṃ maṇikankamatho bhūgajāśvādikaṃ vā /
analyzed: āyāte vāsudeve vada mama bhagavan kim kāryam kim ca deyam maṇi kankam atho bhū gaja aśva ādikam vā
translated: When Vasudeva has come, tell me, O Lord, the truth about Dharma, Kama and Artha. What should be done, what should be given - jewels, gold, elephants, horses, etc.?

original: kiṃ vā vācyaṃ murārernijahitamathavā taddhitaṃ vā prayuḍhañje tathyaṃ pathyaṃpriyabhomama vadaśubhadantatkariṣye na cānyat // / //
analyzed: kim vā vācyam murāreḥ nija hitam athavā tad hitam vā prayuḍhan je tathyam pathyaṃpriya bho mama vat aśubha danta tkariṣye na ca anyat
translated: What should be said to Murari (Krishna), either for one's own benefit or for the benefit of others? Tell me the truth, the beneficial, the pleasing, the inauspicious, I will do that, not anything else.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

original: tad vākyaṃ bhārgavaṃ śrutvā daityanātheritaṃ varam /
analyzed: tat vākyam bhārgavam śrutvā daitya nātha īritam varam
translated: Having heard those words of the lord of demons, the best boon,

analyzed: vicintya nārada prāha bhūta bhavya vid īśvaraḥ
translated: the lord Nārada, the knower of the past and the future, thought and spoke:

original: tvāyā kṛtā yajñabhujo 'surendrā bahiṣkṛtā ye śrutidṛṣṭamārge /
analyzed: tvāyā kṛtāḥ yajñabhujaḥ sura indrāḥ bahiṣkṛtāḥ ye śruti dṛṣṭa mārge
translated: O lord of demons, those who have been excluded from the path seen in the Vedas, those who have been excluded from the Vedic sacrifices,

original: śrutipramāṇaṃ makhabhojino bahiḥ surāstadarthaṃ harir abhyupaiti // / //
analyzed: śruti pramāṇam makha bhojinaḥ bahis surāḥ tad artham hariḥ abhyupaiti
translated: the gods who are the recipients of the sacrifices, for their sake Hari (Vishnu) approaches.

original: tasyādhvaraṃ daityasamāgatasya kāryaṃ hi kiṃ māṃ paripṛcchase yat /
analyzed: tasya adhvaram daitya samāgatasya kāryam hi kim mām paripṛcchase yat
translated: For him who has come to the sacrifice, what should be done, that you ask me?

original: kāryaṃ na deyaṃ hi vibho tṛṇāgraṃ yadadhvare bhūkanakādikaṃ vā // / //
analyzed: kāryam na deyam hi vibho tṛṇa agram yat adhvare bhū kanaka ādikam vā
translated: O lord, not even a blade of grass should be given in the sacrifice, not even earth, gold, etc.

original: vācyaṃ tathā sāma nirarthakaṃ vibho kaste varaṃ dātumalaṃ hi śaknuyāt /
analyzed: vācyam tathā sāma nirarthakam vibho kaḥ te varam dātum alam hi śaknuyāt
translated: O Lord, your words and the Sama Veda are meaningless. Who is capable of giving you a boon?

analyzed: yasya udare bhūḥ bhuvana ākapāla rasātala īśāḥ nivasanti nityaśas
translated: In whose belly the parts of the earth, Bhu, Bhuva, and Kaa, and the nether regions always reside.

analyzed: baliḥ uvāca
translated: Bali said:

original: mayā na coktaṃ vacanaṃ hi bhārgava na cāsti mahyaṃ na ca dātumutsahe /
analyzed: mayā na ca uktam vacanam hi bhārgava na ca asti mahyam na ca dātum utsahe
translated: O Bhargava, I have not spoken those words. I do not have them and I am not able to give them.

original: samāgate 'pyayarthini hīnavṛtte janārdane lokapatau kathaṃ tu // / //
analyzed: samāgate hīna vṛtte janārdane lokapatau katham tu
translated: Even when Janardana, the Lord of the worlds, has come as a supplicant of inferior conduct, how can I?

original: evaṃ ca śruyate ślokaḥ satāṃ kathayatāṃ vibho /
analyzed: evam ca śruyate ślokaḥ satām kathayatām vibho
translated: And thus, O Lord, this verse is heard by the virtuous:

analyzed: sadbhāvaḥ brāhmaṇeṣu eva karttavyaḥ bhūtim icchatā
translated: One desiring prosperity should have good feelings only towards Brahmanas.

original: dṛśyate hi tathā tacca satyaṃ brāhmaṇasattama // / //
analyzed: dṛśyate hi tathā tat ca satyam brāhmaṇa sattama
translated: For it is seen thus, and that is true, O best of Brahmanas.

analyzed: pūrva abhyāsena karmāṇi saṃbhavanti nṛṇām sphuṭam
translated: Actions arise clearly for men due to their previous practice,

analyzed: vāc kāya manasāni iha yoni antara gatāni api
translated: Even when they have gone to another womb, in speech, body and mind.

original: kiṃ vā tvayā dvijaśreṣṭha paurāṇī na śrutā kathā /
analyzed: kim vā tvayā dvijaśreṣṭha paurāṇī na śrutā kathā
translated: Or what, O best of Brahmanas, has not been heard by you, the ancient story,

original: yā vṛttā malaye pūrvaṃ kośakārasutasya tu // / //
analyzed: yā vṛttā malaye pūrvam kośakāra sutasya tu
translated: Which took place formerly in Malaya, of the son of the silk-cotton tree?

analyzed: śukraḥ uvāca
translated: Sukra said:

analyzed: kathayasva mahā bāho kośakāra suta āśrayām
translated: Tell me, O mighty-armed one, about the son of the silk-cotton tree,

original: kathāṃ paurāṇikīṃ puṇyāṃ mahākautūhalaṃ hi me // / //
analyzed: kathām paurāṇikīm puṇyām mahā kautūhalam hi me
translated: The sacred story of the Puranas, for I have great curiosity.

analyzed: baliḥ uvāca
translated: Bali said:

analyzed: śṛṇuṣva kathayiṣyāmi kathām etām makha antare
translated: Listen, I will tell you this story in another sacrifice.

analyzed: pūrva abhyāsa nibaddhām hi satyām bhṛgukulodvaha
translated: For it is true, O perpetuator of the Bhrigu lineage, bound by past practice.

analyzed: mudgalasya muneḥ putraḥ jñāna vijñāna pāragaḥ
translated: The son of the sage Mudgala, who had mastered knowledge and wisdom,

original: kośakāra iti khyāta āsīd brahmaṃstaporataḥ // / //🔽tasyāsīd dayitā sādhvī dharmiṣṭhā nāmataḥ sutā /
analyzed: kośakāraḥ iti khyātaḥ āsīt brahman tapaḥ rataḥ  tasya āsīt dayitā sādhvī dharmiṣṭhā nāmataḥ sutā
translated: was known as Koshakar, O Brahmin, and was devoted to austerities.🔽He had a beloved virtuous wife named Dharma,

analyzed: satī vātsyāyana sutā dharma śīlā pativratā
translated: who was chaste, of good conduct, and devoted to her husband, like the daughter of Vatsayana.

original: tasyāmasya suto jātaḥ prakṛtyā vai jaḍākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: tasyām asya sutaḥ jātaḥ prakṛtyā vai jaḍa ākṛtiḥ
translated: In her, a son was born to him, by nature dull-witted and deformed.

original: mūkavannālapati sa na ca paśyati cāndhavat // / //
analyzed: mūka vat na ālapati sa na ca paśyati ca andha vat
translated: He spoke like a mute and saw like a blind man.

original: taṃ jātaṃ brāhmaṇī putraṃ jaḍaṃ mūkaṃ tvacakṣuṣam /
analyzed: tam jātam brāhmaṇī putram jaḍam mūkam tu acakṣuṣam
translated: The Brahmin woman, considering her son born as dull-witted, mute, and blind,

analyzed: manyamānā gṛha dvāri ṣaṣṭhe hani samutsṛjat
translated: abandoned him at the door of her house on the sixth day.

analyzed: tatas bhyāgāt durācārā rākṣasī jāta hāriṇī
translated: Then came a wicked demoness, a child-stealer,

original: svaṃ śiśuṃ kṛśamādāya sūrpākṣī nāma nāmataḥ // / //
analyzed: svam śiśum kṛśam ādāya sūrpākṣī nāma nāmataḥ
translated: named Surpakshi, carrying her own emaciated child.

analyzed: tatra utsṛjya sva putram sā jagrāha dvija nandanam
translated: There, leaving her own son, she took the son of the Brahmin.

analyzed: tam ādāya jagāma atha bhoktum śālodare girau
translated: Taking him, he went to the Shalu mountain cave to eat.

analyzed: tatas tām āgatām vīkṣya tasyāḥ bhartā ghaṭodaraḥ
translated: Then, seeing her come, her husband Ghatodara,

analyzed: netra hīnaḥ pratyuvāca kim ānītaḥ tvayā priye
translated: deprived of eyes, said, O beloved, why have you brought him?

original: sābravīt rākṣasapate mayā sthāpya nijaṃ śiśum /🔽kośakāradvijagṛhe tasyānītaḥ prabho sutaḥ // / //
analyzed: sā bravīt rākṣasa pate mayā sthāpya nijam śiśum  kośakāra dvija gṛhe tasya ānītaḥ prabho sutaḥ
translated: She said, O lord of demons, having left my own child🔽in the house of the spider-like brahmin, I have brought your son, O lord.

original: sa prāha na tvayā bhadre bhadramācaritaṃ tviti /
analyzed: sa prāha na tvayā bhadre bhadram ācaritam tu iti
translated: He said, O good one, you have not done well.

analyzed: mahā jñānī dvijendraḥ sau tatas śapsyati kopitaḥ
translated: That great wise lord of brahmins, being angry, will curse you.

analyzed: tasmāt śīghram imam tyaktvā manujam ghora rupiṇam
translated: Therefore, quickly leaving this man of terrible form,

analyzed: anyasya kasyacid putram śīghram ānaya sundari
translated: bring the son of some other person quickly, O beautiful one.

analyzed: iti evam uktā sā raudrā rākṣasī kāma cāriṇī
translated: Thus addressed, that terrible demoness, moving as she pleased,

analyzed: samājagāma tvaritā samutpatya vihāyasam
translated: quickly flew up into the sky and went away.

analyzed: sa ca api rākṣasa sutaḥ nisṛṣṭaḥ gṛha bāhyatas
translated: And that son of the demon, left outside the house,

analyzed: ruroda su svaram brahman prakṣipya aṅguṣṭham ānane
translated: cried out loudly, O brahmin, having put his thumb in his mouth.

analyzed: sā kranditam cirāt śrutvā dharmiṣṭhā patim abravīt
translated: She, being righteous, after a long time hearing his crying, said to her husband,

analyzed: paśya svayam muni śreṣṭha sa śabdaḥ tanayaḥ tava
translated: Look yourself, O best of sages, your son has a sound.

analyzed: trastā sā nirjagāma atha gṛha madhyāt tapasvinī
translated: The terrified ascetic woman then went out from the middle of the house.

original: sa cāpi brāhmaṇaśreṣṭhaḥ samapaśyata taṃ śiśum // / //
analyzed: sa ca api brāhmaṇa śreṣṭhaḥ samapaśyata tam śiśum
translated: And that best of Brahmins also saw that child.

analyzed: varṇa rūpa ādi saṃyuktam yathā sva tanayam tathā
translated: Endowed with complexion, form, and so on, just like his own son.

original: tato vihasya provāca kośakāro nijāṃ priyām // / //
analyzed: tatas vihasya provāca kośakāraḥ nijām priyām
translated: Then the creator of the sheath laughed and said to his beloved.

analyzed: etena āviśya dharmiṣṭhe bhāvyam bhūtena sāmpratam
translated: By this most righteous one, it is proper to be born now.

analyzed: kaḥ pi aṭ asmākam chalayitum surūpī bhuvi saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Some beautiful one has come to deceive us on earth.

analyzed: iti uktvā vacanam mantrī mantraiḥ tam rākṣasa ātmajam
translated: Having spoken these words, the minister, with mantras, bound that son of the demon.

analyzed: babandha ullikhya vasudhām sa kuśena atha pāṇinā
translated: Having drawn a line on the ground with a kuśa in his hand.

analyzed: etasmin antare prāptā sūrpākṣī vipra bālakam
translated: In the meantime, Sūrpākṣī, having reached the Brahmin boy,

original: antardhānagatā bhūmau cikṣepa gṛhadūrataḥ // / //🔽taṃ kṣiptamātraṃ jagrāha kośakāraḥ svakaṃ sutam /
analyzed: antardhāna gatā bhūmau cikṣepa gṛha dūrataḥ  tam kṣipta mātram jagrāha kośakāraḥ svakam sutam
translated: Disappeared into the ground and threw him far from the house.🔽As soon as he was thrown, the creator of the sheath took his own son.

original: sā cābhyetya grahītuṃ svaṃ nāśakad rākṣasī sutam // / //
analyzed: sā ca abhyetya grahītum svam nā aśakat rākṣasī sutam
translated: And that demoness, having come to seize her own son, was unable to do so.

analyzed: itas ca itas ca vibhraṣṭā sā bhartāram upāgamat
translated: Wandering here and there, she approached her husband.

original: kathayāmāsā yad vṛttaṃ svadvijātmajahīriṇam // / //🔽evaṃ gatāyaṃ rākṣasyāṃ brāhmaṇena mahātmanā /
analyzed: kathayāmāsā yat vṛttam sva dvija ātmaja hīriṇam  evam gatā ayam rākṣasyām brāhmaṇena mahātmanā
translated: and told her what had happened to the son of the Brāhman.🔽Thus the son of the Brāhman was carried off by the Rākṣasī.

original: sa rābhasaśiśurbrahman bhāryāyai viniveditaḥ // / //🔽sa cātmatanayaḥ pitrā kapilāyāḥ savatsayāḥ /
analyzed: sa rābhasa śiśuḥ brahman bhāryāyai viniveditaḥ  sa ca ātma tanayaḥ pitrā kapilāyāḥ sa vatsayāḥ
translated: The Brāhman, O good lady, gave that son of his to his wife.

analyzed: dadhnā saṃyojitaḥ tyartham kṣīreṇa ikṣu rasena ca
translated: And that son of his was nourished by his father with curd, milk and sugarcane juice, along with a tawny-coloured cow with a calf.

analyzed: dvau eva vardhitau bālau saṃjātau sapta vārṣikau
translated: The two boys grew up and became seven years old.

analyzed: pitrā ca kṛta nāmānau niśākara divākarau
translated: And their father gave them the names of Nishakara and Divakara.

analyzed: naiśācariḥ divākīrtiḥ niśākīrtiḥ sva putrakaḥ
translated: The son of the Brāhman was named Nishakara, and his own son was named Divakara.

analyzed: tayoḥ cakāra vipraḥ sau vrata bandha kriyām kramāt
translated: And he performed the ceremony of investiture with the sacred thread for them in due order.

analyzed: vrata bandhe kṛte vedam papāṭha asau divākaraḥ
translated: After the investiture with the sacred thread was performed, Divakara recited the Veda.

original: niśākaro jaḍatayā na papāṭheti naḥ śrutam // / //
analyzed: niśākaraḥ jaḍa tayā na papāṭha iti naḥ śrutam
translated: We have heard that Nishakara, out of dullness, did not recite it.

original: taṃ bāndhavāśca pitarau mātā bhrātā gurustathā /
analyzed: tam bāndhavāḥ ca pitarau mātā bhrātā guruḥ tathā
translated: His relatives, his father, mother, brother, and teacher,

analyzed: paryanindan tathā ye ca janāḥ malaya vāsinaḥ
translated: and all the people living in Malaya censured him.

original: tataḥ sa pitrā kruddhena kṣiptaḥ kūpe nirūdake /
analyzed: tatas sa pitrā kruddhena kṣiptaḥ kūpe nirūdake
translated: Then he was angrily thrown by his father into a waterless well.

analyzed: mahā śilām ca upari vai pidhānam avaropayat
translated: And placed a large stone on top as a cover.

analyzed: evam kṣiptaḥ tadā kūpe samatīteṣu bhārgava
translated: Thus thrown into the well, O Bhargava, after the lapse of some time,

analyzed: tasya mātā agamat kūpam tam andham śilayā ācitam
translated: His mother came to the well, where he was blindfolded with a stone.

original: tato daśasu varṣeṣu samatīteṣu bhārgava /🔽tasya mātāgamat kūpaṃ tamandhaṃ śilayācitam // / //
analyzed: tatas daśasu varṣeṣu samatīteṣu bhārgava  tasya mātā agamat kūpam tam andham śilayā ācitam
translated: Then, O Bhargava, after the lapse of ten years,🔽His mother came to the well, where he was blindfolded with a stone.

original: sā dṛṣṭāvā nicitaṃ kūpaṃ śilayā girikalpayā /
analyzed: sā dṛṣṭāva ā nicitam kūpam śilayā giri kalpayā
translated: She saw the well covered with a stone resembling a mountain,

original: uccaiḥ provāca keneyaṃ kūpopari śilā kṛtā // / //
analyzed: uccais provāca kena iyam kūpa upari śilā kṛtā

original: oṃ brahmādirasi brahmayo 'si yajño 'si vedakāmo 'si vedyo 'si yajñadhāro 'si mahāmīno 'si mahāseno 'si mahāśirā asi /
analyzed: om brahma ādiḥ asi si yajñaḥ si veda kāmaḥ si vedyaḥ si yajña dhāraḥ si mahā mīnaḥ si mahā senaḥ si mahā śirāḥ asi
translated: Om, you are Brahma and others, you are the cause of Brahma, you are the sacrifice, you are desirous of the Vedas, you are the knowable, you are the supporter of sacrifice, you are the great fish, you are the great army, you are the great head.

original: nṛkesaryasi hotāsi homyo 'si havyo 'si hūyamāno 'si hayamedho 'si potāsi pāvayitāsi pūto 'si pūjyo 'si dātāsi hanyamāno 'si hriyamāṇo
analyzed: nṛ kesarī asi hotā asi homyaḥ si havyaḥ si hūyamānaḥ si hayamedhaḥ si potā asi pāvayitā asi pūtaḥ si pūjyaḥ si dātā asi hanyamānaḥ si hriyamāṇaḥ
translated: You are the one with human hair, you are the Hotri priest, you are worthy of being offered, you are the oblation, you are being offered, you are the horse sacrifice, you are the protector, you are the purifier, you are purified, you are worthy of worship, you are the giver, you are being killed, you are being taken away,

analyzed: si harttā asi iti om
translated: you are the taker. Om.

original: nītirasi netāsi agryo 'si viśvadhāmāsi śubhāṇḍo 'si dhruvo 'si āraṇeyo 'si 🔽dhyāno 'si dhyeyo 'si jñeyo 'si jñāno 'si jñāno 'si yaṣṭāsi dāno 'si bhūmāsi īkṣyo
analyzed: nītiḥ asi netā asi agryaḥ si viśva dhāmā asi śubha aṇḍaḥ si dhruvaḥ si āraṇeyaḥ si  dhyānaḥ si dhyeyaḥ si jñeyaḥ si jñānaḥ si jñānaḥ si yaṣṭā asi dānaḥ si bhūmā asi īkṣyaḥ
translated: You are the policy, you are the leader, you are the foremost, you are the support of all, you are the auspicious egg, you are firm, you are the sacrificial fire,🔽you are the meditation, you are the object of meditation, you are the knowable, you are knowledge, you are the known, you are the sacrificial post, you are the giver, you are the earth, you are the object of sight,

original: 'si brahmāsi hotāsi udgātāsi gatimatāṃ gatirasi jñānināṃ jñānamasi yogināṃ yogo 'si
analyzed: si brahmā asi hotā asi udgātā asi gatimatām gatiḥ asi jñāninām jñānam asi yoginām yogaḥ si
translated: you are Brahma, you are the Hotri priest, you are the Udgata priest, you are the goal of those who have a goal, you are the knowledge of the wise, you are the yoga of the yogis,

original: mokṣagāmināṃ mokṣo 'si śrīmatāṃ śrīrasi gṛhyo 'si pātāsi paramasi
analyzed: mokṣa gāminām mokṣaḥ si śrīmatām śrīḥ asi gṛhyaḥ u si pātā asi param asi
translated: you are the liberation of those who go to liberation, you are the prosperity of the prosperous, you are the domestic, you are the protector, you are the supreme.

original: somo 'si sūryo 'si dīkṣāsi dakṣiṇāsi naro 'si trinayano 'si mahānayano 'si ādityaprabhavo
analyzed: somaḥ si sūryaḥ si dīkṣā asi dakṣiṇā asi naraḥ si tri nayanaḥ si mahā nayanaḥ si āditya prabhavaḥ
translated: You are Soma, you are Surya, you are initiation, you are sacrificial fee, you are a man, you have three eyes, you have great eyes, you are born from the sun,

original: 'si surottamo 'si śucirasi śukro 'si nabhosi nabhasyo 'si iṣo 'si ūrjo 'si saho 'si
analyzed: si sura uttamaḥ si śuciḥ asi śukraḥ si nabhaḥ asi nabhasyaḥ si iṣaḥ si ūrjaḥ si sahaḥ si
translated: you are the best of gods, you are pure, you are Shukra, you are the sky, you are Nabhasya, you are food, you are strength, you are power,

analyzed: sahasyaḥ si tapaḥ si tapasyaḥ si madhura asi
translated: you are Sahasya, you are austerity, you are Tapasya, you are sweet,

original: mādhavo 'si kālo 'si saṃkramo 'si vikramo 'si parākramo 'si aśvagrīvo 'si mahāmedho
analyzed: mādhavaḥ si kālaḥ si saṃkramaḥ si vikramaḥ si parākramaḥ si aśvagrīvaḥ si mahā medhaḥ
translated: you are Madhava, you are time, you are a transit, you are valor, you are prowess, you are Ashvagriva, you are Mahamedha,

original: 'si śaṅkaro 'si hariśvoro 'si śaṃbhurasi brahmeśo 'si sūryo 'si mitrāvaruṇo 'si prāgvaṃśakāyo
analyzed: si śaṅkaraḥ si si śaṃbhuḥ asi brahmā īśaḥ si sūryaḥ si mitrāvaruṇaḥ si prāgvaṃśa kāyaḥ
translated: you are Shankara, you are Harishva, you are Shambhu, you are Brahma, you are Ishvara, you are Surya, you are Mitra-Varuna, you are the body of the eastern ridge,

analyzed: si bhṛta ādiḥ asi mahābhūtaḥ si ūrdhva karmā asi karttā asi
translated: you are the beginning of the Bhritas, you are a great element, you are one who performs upward rites, you are the performer,

analyzed: sarva pāpa vimocanaḥ si tri vikramaḥ si om namaḥ te
translated: you are the liberator from all sins, you are Trivikrama, Om, salutations to you.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: ittham stutaḥ padmavena viṣṇuḥ tapasvibhiḥ ca adbhuta kārma kārī
translated: Thus praised by the lotus-born one and the ascetics, Vishnu, the performer of wondrous deeds,

original: provāca devaṃ prapitāmahaṃ tu varaṃ vṛṇīṣvāmalasattvavṛtte // / //
analyzed: provāca devam prapitāmaham tu varam vṛṇīṣva amala sattva vṛtte
translated: spoke to the god, the great-grandfather: Choose a boon, O you of pure and excellent conduct.

original: tamabravīt prītiyutaḥ pitāmaho varaṃ mamehādya vibho prayaccha /
analyzed: tam abravīt prīti yutaḥ pitāmahaḥ varam mama iha adya vibho prayaccha
translated: The grandfather, filled with joy, said to him, O Lord, grant me a boon today.

original: rūpeṇa puṇyena vibo hyanena saṃsthīyatāṃ madbhavane murāre // / //
analyzed: rūpeṇa puṇyena vibo hi anena saṃsthīyatām mad bhavane murāre
translated: O Murari, O knower of virtue, with this form of yours, please stay in my abode.

original: itthaṃ vṛte devavareṇa prādāt prabhustathāstviti tamavyayātmā /
analyzed: ittham vṛte deva vareṇa prādāt prabhuḥ tathā astu iti tam avyaya ātmā
translated: Thus chosen by the best of gods, the imperishable Lord said, So be it.

original: tasthau hi rūpeṇa hi vāmanena saṃpūjyamānaḥ sadane svayaṃbhoḥ // / //
analyzed: tasthau hi rūpeṇa hi vāmanena saṃpūjyamānaḥ sadane svayaṃbhoḥ
translated: He stayed in the form of Vamana, being worshipped in the abode of the self-existent one.

original: nṛtyanti tatrāpsarasāṃ samūhya gāyanti gītāni surendragāyanāḥ /
analyzed: nṛtyanti tatra apsarasām samūhya gāyanti gītāni sura indra gāyanāḥ
translated: There, groups of celestial nymphs dance, the best of celestial singers sing songs,

analyzed: vidyādharāḥ tūryarān ca vādayan stuvanti deva asura siddha saṅghāḥ
translated: The Vidyadharas play musical instruments, and the hosts of gods, demons and Siddhas praise him.

original: tataḥ samārādhya vibhuṃ surādhipaḥ pitāmaho dhautamalaḥ sa śuddhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas samārādhya vibhum surādhipaḥ pitāmahaḥ dhauta malaḥ sa śuddhaḥ
translated: Then, having propitiated the Lord, the king of gods, the grandfather, being pure and cleansed,

original: svarge viriñciḥ sadanāt supuṣpāṇyānīya pūjāṃ pracakāra viṣṇoḥ // / //
analyzed: svarge viriñciḥ sadanāt su puṣpāṇi ānīya pūjām pracakāra viṣṇoḥ
translated: Having brought excellent flowers from the abode of Brahma in heaven, he performed worship of Vishnu.

original: svarge sahasraṃ sa tu yojanānāṃ viṣṇoḥ pramāṇena hi vāmano 'bhūt tatrāsya śakraḥ pracakāra pūjāṃ svayaṃbhuvastulyaguṇāṃ maharṣe // /
analyzed: svarge sahasram sa tu yojanānām viṣṇoḥ pramāṇena hi vāmanaḥ bhūt tatra asya śakraḥ pracakāra pūjām svayaṃbhuvaḥ tulya guṇām mahā ṛṣe  /
translated: In heaven, he became Vamana, a thousand yojanas in size according to Vishnu's measure. There, O great sage, Shakra performed worship of him, equal in qualities to the self-existent one.

original: etat tavoktaṃ bhagavāṃstrivikramaścakāra yad devahitaṃ mahātmā /
analyzed: etat tava uktam bhagavān trivikramaḥ cakāra yat deva hitam mahātmā
translated: O Brahmin, I have now told you about the great deed performed by the illustrious Trivikrama for the welfare of the gods.

analyzed: rasātala sthaḥ ditijaḥ cakāra yat tat śṛṇuṣva adya vadāmi vipra
translated: Now listen to what the demon Bali, residing in the netherworld, did. I shall tell you that now.

analyzed: iti śrī vāmanapurāṇe ṣaṭṣaṣṭitamaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixty-sixth chapter in the Vamana Purana—66.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca  gatvā rasātalam daityaḥ mahārha maṇi citritam
translated: Pulastya said:🔽The demon went to the netherworld and had a city built there, adorned with precious gems,

original: śuddhasphaṭisopānaṃ kārayāmāsa vai puram // / //🔽tatra madhye suvistīrmaḥ prāsādo vajravedikaḥ /
analyzed: śuddha sphaṭi sopānam kārayāmāsa vai puram  tatra madhye prāsādaḥ vajra vedikaḥ
translated: with steps made of pure crystal.🔽In the middle of that city, Vishvakarma built a palace with a diamond platform,

analyzed: muktā jāla antara dvāraḥ nirmitaḥ viśvakarmaṇā
translated: with doors covered with pearl nets.

original: tatrāste vividhān bhogān bhuñjan divyān sa mānuṣān /
analyzed: tatra āste vividhān bhogān bhuñjan divyān sa mānuṣān
translated: There, the demon enjoyed various divine and human pleasures.

analyzed: nāmnā vindhyāvalī iti evam bhāryā asya dayitā bhavat
translated: He had a beloved wife named Vindhyavali.

analyzed: yuvatīnām sahasrasya pradhānā śīla maṇḍitā
translated: She was the chief of a thousand young women, adorned with good conduct.

original: tayā saha mahātejā reme vairocanirmune // / //🔽bhogāsaktasya daityasya vasataḥ sutale tadā /
analyzed: tayā saha mahā tejāḥ reme vairocaniḥ mune  bhoga āsaktasya daityasya vasataḥ su tale tadā
translated: O sage, the greatly powerful son of Virochana enjoyed with her.🔽When the demon, attached to pleasures, was residing in the netherworld,

analyzed: daitya tejaḥ haraḥ prāptaḥ capātāle vai sudarśanaḥ
translated: the discus Sudarshana, which takes away the brilliance of the demons, reached the netherworld.

original: cakre praviṣṭe pātālaṃ dānavānāṃ pure mahān /
analyzed: cakre praviṣṭe pātālam dānavānām pure mahān
translated: When the discus entered the netherworld, there was a great destruction of the demons' city,

analyzed: babhai halahalā śabdaḥ kṣubhita arṇava saṃnibhaḥ
translated: There arose a loud uproar, resembling the agitated ocean.

original: taṃ ca śrutvā mahāśabdaṃ baliḥ khaṅgaṃ samādade /
analyzed: tam ca śrutvā mahā śabdam baliḥ khaṅgam samādade
translated: Hearing that great sound, Bali took up his sword.

analyzed: āḥ kim etat iti itthan ca papraccha asura puṅgavaḥ
translated: Ah! What is this? Thus asked that best of demons.

original: tato vindhyāvalī prāha sāntvayantī nijaṃ patim /
analyzed: tatas vindhyāvalī prāha sāntvayantī nijam patim
translated: Then Vindhyavali, comforting her husband, said:

analyzed: kośe khaṅgam samāveśya dharma patnī śuci vratā
translated: Placing the sword in its sheath, the righteous wife of pure vows...

analyzed: etat bhagavataḥ cakram daitya cakra kṣayaṅkaram
translated: This is the discus of the Lord, the destroyer of the circle of demons.

analyzed: saṃpūjanīyam daitya indra vāmanasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: O lord of demons, the great Vamana should be worshipped.

analyzed: iti evam uktvā cāru aṅgī sa arghapātrā viniryayau
translated: Having said this, the beautiful one went out with the offering vessel...

analyzed: atha abhyāgāt sahasra aram viṣṇoḥ cakram sudarśanam
translated: Then the thousand-spoked discus of Vishnu, Sudarshana, came.

analyzed: surapatiḥ prahvaḥ kṛta añjali puṭaḥ mune
translated: Then, O sage, the lord of demons, with folded hands,

analyzed: saṃpūjya vidhivat cakram idam stotram udīrayat
translated: having duly worshipped the discus, uttered this hymn...

analyzed: baliḥ uvāca
translated: Bali said:

analyzed: namasyāmi hareḥ cakram daitya cakra vidāraṇam
translated: I bow to Hari's discus, the destroyer of the circle of demons,

analyzed: sahasra aṃśum sahasra ābham sahasra āram su nirmalam
translated: having a thousand rays, a thousand lights, a thousand rims, and is very pure...

analyzed: namasyāmi hareḥ cakram yasya nābhyām pitāmahaḥ
translated: I bow to Hari's discus, in whose nave is the Grandsire (Brahma),

analyzed: tuṇḍe triśūladhṛk śarvaḥ ārā mūle mahā adrayaḥ
translated: At the tip of the beak, Sharva holding a trident, at the base of the garden, the great mountains.

original: areṣu saṃsthitā devāḥ sendrāḥ sārkāḥ sapāvakāḥ /
analyzed: areṣu saṃsthitāḥ devāḥ sa indrāḥ sa arkāḥ sa pāvakāḥ
translated: In the joints, the gods reside with Indra, Surya, and Agni.

original: jave yasya sthito vāyurāpogniḥ pṛthivī nabhaḥ // / //🔽āraprānteṣu jīmūtāḥ saudāminyṛkṣatārakāḥ /
analyzed: jave yasya sthitaḥ vāyuḥ āpaḥ agniḥ pṛthivī nabhaḥ  āra prānteṣu jīmūtāḥ saudāminī ṛkṣa tārakāḥ
translated: In whose speed, Vayu, water, fire, earth, and sky are situated.🔽At the ends of the arms, the clouds, lightning, stars, and constellations.

analyzed: munayaḥ yasya bālakhilya ādayaḥ tathā
translated: On the back, the sages such as the Valakhilyas.

analyzed: tam āyudha varam vande vāsudevasya bhaktitaḥ
translated: I pay homage to that excellent weapon of Vasudeva with devotion.

original: yanme pāpaṃ śarīrotthaṃ vāgjaṃ mānasameva ca // / //
analyzed: yat me pāpam śarīra uttham vāc jam mānasam eva ca
translated: Whatever sin I have committed with my body, speech, or mind,

analyzed: tat me dahasva dīpta aṃśo viṣṇoḥ cakra sudarśana
translated: Burn it, O flaming discus of Vishnu, O Sudarshana.

original: yanme kulodbhavaṃ pāpaṃ paitṛkaṃ mātṛkaṃ tathā // / //
analyzed: yat me kula udbhavam pāpam paitṛkam mātṛkam tathā
translated: Whatever sin I have inherited from my ancestors, paternal or maternal,

analyzed: tat me harasva tarasā namaḥ te acyuta āyudha
translated: Quickly remove it from me, I bow to you, O weapon of Achyuta.

original: ādhayo mama naśyantu vyādhayo yāntu saṃkṣayam /
analyzed: ādhayaḥ mama naśyantu vyādhayaḥ yāntu saṃkṣayam
translated: May my mental afflictions be destroyed, may my illnesses be eradicated.

analyzed: tvad nāma kīrtanāt cakra duritam yātu saṃkṣayam
translated: By the recitation of your name, O discus, may my sins be destroyed.

analyzed: iti evam uktvā matimān samabhyarcya atha bhaktitaḥ
translated: Having said this, the wise one should worship with devotion,

analyzed: saṃsmaran puṇḍarīkākṣam sarva pāpa praṇāsanam
translated: Remembering the lotus-eyed one, the destroyer of all sins.

original: pūjitaṃ balinā cakraṃ kṛtvā nistejaso 'surān /🔽niścakrāmātha pātālād viṣuve dakṣime mune // / //
analyzed: pūjitam balinā cakram kṛtvā nistejasaḥ surān  niścakrāma atha pātālāt viṣuve dakṣime mune
translated: Having worshipped the discus, Bali made the demons devoid of splendour.🔽Then, O sage, the discus emerged from the nether world at the time of the southern solstice.

analyzed: sudarśane nirgate tu baliḥ viklava tām gataḥ
translated: When Sudarshana emerged, Bali became distressed.

analyzed: paramām āpadam prāpya sasmāra sva pitāmaham
translated: Having attained the highest calamity, he remembered his grandfather.

original: sa cāpi saṃsmṛtaḥ prāptaḥ sutalaṃ dānaveśvaraḥ /
analyzed: sa ca api saṃsmṛtaḥ prāptaḥ sutalam dānava īśvaraḥ
translated: And he, the lord of the demons, was remembered and arrived at Sutala.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tasthau mahā tejāḥ sa arghapātraḥ baliḥ tadā
translated: Seeing him, the greatly radiant Bali, with a vessel of welcome offerings, stood there.

analyzed: tam arcya vidhinā brahman pituḥ pitaram īśvaram
translated: O Brahmin, having worshipped him with the prescribed method, the grandfather of his father, the lord,

analyzed: kṛta añjali puṭaḥ bhūtvā idam vacanam abravīt
translated: with folded palms, spoke these words:

original: saṃsmṛto 'si mayā tāta suviṣaṇṇena cetasā tanme hitaṃ ca pathyaṃ ca śreyogryaṃ vada tāta me /
analyzed: saṃsmṛtaḥ si mayā tāta su viṣaṇṇena cetasā tat me hitam ca pathyam ca śreyogryam vada tāta me
translated: O father, you were remembered by me with a very distressed mind. Tell me that which is beneficial for me, which is wholesome, and which is the best for attaining liberation.

original: kiṃ kāryaṃ tāta saṃsāre vasatā puruṣoṇa hi /
analyzed: kim kāryam tāta saṃsāre vasatā hi
translated: What is the purpose of a man living in the world?

original: kṛtena yena vai nāsya bandhaḥ samupajāyate /🔽saṃsārārṇavamagnānāṃ narāṇāmalpacetasām /
analyzed: kṛtena yena vai na asya bandhaḥ samupajāyate  saṃsāra arṇava magnānām narāṇām alpa cetasām
translated: By what deed is he not bound?

analyzed: taraṇe yaḥ bhavet potaḥ tat me vyākhyātum arhasi
translated: You should explain to me that which would be a boat for men of little intelligence who are immersed in the ocean of worldly existence, for crossing over.

analyzed: pulastyaḥ uvāca
translated: Pulastya said:

analyzed: etat vacanam ākarṇya tad pautrāt dānava īśvaraḥ
translated: Hearing these words from his grandson, the lord of the demons,

original: vicintya prāha vacanaṃ saṃsāre yadvitaṃ param // / //
analyzed: vicintya prāha vacanam saṃsāre yat vitam param
translated: reflecting on the highest truth in the world, spoke these words.

analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

analyzed: sādhu dānava śārdūla yat te jātā matiḥ tu iyam
translated: Excellent, O tiger among demons, that such a thought has arisen in you.

original: pravakṣyāmi hitaṃ te 'dya tathāneyeṣāṃ hitaṃ bale // / //
analyzed: pravakṣyāmi hitam te dya tathā aneya iṣām hitam bale
translated: I shall today tell you what is beneficial, and what is beneficial for your kinsmen, O Bali.

analyzed: bhava jaladhi gatānām dvāndva vāta āhatānām suta duhitṛ kalatra trāṇa bhāra arditānām
translated: For those who are in the ocean of worldly existence, struck by the winds of duality, burdened by the protection of sons, daughters, and wives,

original: viṣamaviṣayatoye majjatāmaplāvānāṃ bhavati śaraṇameko viṣṇupoto narāṇām // / //
analyzed: viṣama viṣaya toye majjatām aplāvānām bhavati śaraṇam ekaḥ viṣṇu potaḥ narāṇām
translated: Drowning in the waters of difficult objects, without a raft, the boat of Viṣṇu alone is the refuge for men.

original: ye saṃśritā harimanantamanādimadhyaṃ nārāyaṇaṃ suraguruṃ śubhadaṃ vareṇyam /
analyzed: ye saṃśritāḥ harim anantam an ādi madhyam nārāyaṇam suragurum śubha dam vareṇyam
translated: Those who take refuge in Hari, the infinite, the beginningless and endless, Nārāyaṇa, the preceptor of the gods, the giver of good, the excellent one,

original: śuddhaṃ khagendragamanaṃ kamalālayeśaṃ te dharmarājakaraṇaṃ na viśanti dhīrāḥ /
analyzed: śuddham khagendra gamanam kamala ālaya īśam te dharmarāja karaṇam na viśanti dhīrāḥ
translated: The pure one, the one who moves like the king of birds, the lord of the abode of lotuses, the wise ones do not enter the cycle of birth and death.

original: svapuruṣamabhivīkṣya pāśahastaṃ vadati yamaḥ kila tasya karṇamūle /
analyzed: sva puruṣam abhivīkṣya pāśa hastam vadati yamaḥ kila tasya karṇa mūle
translated: Seeing his own man with a noose in hand, Yama is said to whisper in his ear:

analyzed: parihara madhusūdana prannān prabhuḥ aham anya nṛṇām na vaiṣṇavānām
translated: Avoid those who are devoted to Madhusūdana. I am the lord of others' debts, but not of the devotees of Viṣṇu.

analyzed: tathā anyat uktam nara sattamena ikṣvākuṇā bhakti yutena nūnam
translated: Similarly, it has been said by the best of men, by Ikṣvāku, who was certainly full of devotion,

original: ye viṣṇubhaktāḥ puruṣāḥ pṛthivyāṃ yamasya te nirviṣayā bhavanti // / //
analyzed: ye viṣṇu bhaktāḥ puruṣāḥ pṛthivyām yamasya te nirviṣayāḥ bhavanti
translated: Those men on earth who are devotees of Viṣṇu, they are beyond the jurisdiction of Yama.

original: sā jihvā yā hariṃ stauti taccittaṃ yattadarpitam /
analyzed: sā jihvā yā harim stauti tat cittam yat tad arpitam
translated: That is the tongue which praises Hari, that is the mind which is devoted to Him.

original: tāveva kevalaṃ śalāghyau yau tatpūjākarau karau // / //
analyzed: tau eva kevalam śalāghyau yau tad pūjā karau karau
translated: Those two alone are praiseworthy who are the hands that perform His worship.

analyzed: nūnam na tau karau proktau vṛkṣa śākhā agra pallavau

analyzed: na yau pūjitum śaktau hari pāda ambuja dvayam  nūnam tat kaṇṭha śālūkam athavā pratijihvakā

analyzed: rogaḥ uvā anyaḥ na sā jihvā yā na vakti hareḥ guṇān
translated: Or some other disease, that is not the tongue which does not speak of the qualities of Hari.

analyzed: yatā ratnāni jaladheḥ asaṃkhyeyāni putraka

analyzed: ye śaṅkha cakra abja karam sa śārṅgiṇam khaga indra ketum vara dam śriyaḥ patim
